loans.name: Mildred

texts.es:
Mildred  es una mujer dinámica y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, región D. Ucayali, tiene 65 años y es madre D. cuatro hijos mayores D. edad, ella  tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes que funciona en su casa. Su esposo es profesor jubilado. Ella forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Caseritas” desD. hace dos años, el primer que obtuvo fue D. 300 soles que utilizó en la compra D. algunos artículos para su bodega.
Este crédito D. 2000 soles será utilizado una parte para comprar productos para su bodega y otra parte invertirá en la compra D. una congeladora y poner sus bebidas gaseosa, carnes, etc. La meta D. Mildred es surtir su negocio y ampliarlo. Además esta agradecida con la ONG Manuela Ramos porque gracias a los préstamos que le dieron pudo implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mildren is a dynamic and hardworking woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is 65 years old and the mother of four adult children. She has a small grocery store that she operates out of her house. Her husband is a retired teacher.

Mildred joined the Communal Bank “Las Caseritas” two years ago. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 soles and was used to purchase items for her store. With this loan of 2000 soles, she will buy merchandise for the grocery store and use part of the loan to purchase a freezer for storing sodas, meats, and other products. Mildred’s goal is to expand her business and keep it well-stocked. She thanks Manuela Ramos for providing loans that have kept her business in operation.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grocery products & a freezer

loans.name: Wael

texts.en:
Wael lives in Al-Nusairat, between Gaza and Dier al Balah. He is married with three children: Zaki, 6; Nadeen, 3; and Rula, 1.

Wael works in a hotel for a monthly salary of 300 USD, and he also owns a taxi that he operates in the middle area of Gaza Strip. He has owned this taxi for two years.

Wael has requested 1,000 USD to do some maintenance on his taxi before winter. He appears in the photo next to his taxi.

loans.use: To pay for taxi maintenance

loans.name: Wani

texts.en:
Wani J. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol and bread at home and is requesting a loan to stock more materials to use to make more alcohol to sell.  Wani is 30 years old and is married to a peasant. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar and restaurant.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more ingredients to make alcohol to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes O. is from the village of Sicayab. She is 31 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Agnes owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling different cosmetic products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Agnes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to fully pay for a television and to support monthly payments of her refrigerator. Agnes is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to fully pay for the said refrigerator. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. Agnes plans to own more appliances for the family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To complete the payment for her refrigerator

loans.name: Naimjon

texts.en:
Naimjon is a married man and he has three children. His wife has a high degree and she works as a teacher in high school. Naimjon started his business of goods transportation with his truck. He does that already for more than three years and earns enough only for living. So he decided to get this loan to purchase another gas cylinder and thus save on road expenses. Also Naimjon wants to get some spare parts for his truck. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a gas cylinder and spare parts for a truck.

loans.name: Evelin De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Evelin de los Ángeles Z. R. de 29 años de edad, reside en Candelaria, ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como albañil, y sus dos hijos de 9 y 3 años de edad. Evelin, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de puros, negocio en el cual tiene 10 años de dedicarse, así mismo ella comercializa cosméticos y ropa, esto con el fin de poder obtener ganancias extras, debido a que el trabajo de su esposo no es constante, Evelin debe trabajar muy duro para poder llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar material para la elaboración de los puros, de esta manera ella podrá hacer mayor cantidad de productos atendiendo de esta manera a más clientes, así mismo desea poder comprar más cosméticos, los cuales son de los productos que más vende, de esta manera ella podra ofrecer variedad en sus productos. Esto la llena de mucha ilusión ya que le será posible mejorar las condiciones económicas de su hogar.
texts.en:
Evelin de los Ángeles Z. R., 29, lives in Candelaria, Cuscatlán department with her husband, who is a bricklayer, and their two children, 9 and 3 years old, respectively. Evelin makes and sells cigars. She has been in this line of work for 10 years; she also sells cosmetics and clothing in order to make extra income because her husband's employment isn't consistent. Evelin must work very hard to provide for her family's daily support. She is requesting funding to buy cigar-making supplies so that she can manufacture a larger quantity and meet the demand of more customers. She also wants to buy more cosmetics, which are her highest-selling items, so that she can offer a greater variety of products. This fills her with hope that she will be able to improve her household's economic conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cigar-making supplies.

location.town: Candelaria en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe T. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old and married with one school-aged child. Fe owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, bar soap for laundry, sardines, toothpaste, etc. in the local community. Fe has been involved in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan, for 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama B. est marié à deux femmes et père de huit enfants. Il est né le 31 Décembre 1972 à Zanso un des villages de la préfecture de Kadiolo - 3eme région administrative  de la république du Mali.  Il vit entre Zanso et Loulouni ville où il a  une de ses épouses.
N’ ayant pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école il s’intéressa très tôt aux activités génératrices de revenus, notamment le commerce qu’il mène depuis maintenant 
 7ans. Très expérimenté en raison des années passées dans le commerce, il le fait avec assez de réussite. 
Il est à sa première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Il compte acheter avec son prêt,  5 colis  constitués de différents articles pour boutique (lait, sucre, huile, thé, savons, biscuits, bonbons, café, lipton, œufs de poules etc). 
Il s’approvisionne dans les villages avoisinants et à Sikasso ville et effectue sa vente  dans son kiosque à Loulouni ville en détail, au comptant,  souvent à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé en grande partie pour augmenter son fonds de commerce et l’autre partie sera utilisée dans les dépenses familiales.
Il ambitionne se procurer d’un lot à usage d’habitation à Sikasso ville.
texts.en:
Mr. Adama B. is married to two women and is father to eight children. He was born on 31st December 1972 in Zanso, one of the villages in the prefecture of Kadiolo, the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. He lives between Zanso and Loulouni town, where one of his wives lives. As he did not have the opportunity to go to school, he showed an early interest in income-generating activities, notably in commerce in which he has been engaged for seven years now. In view of the number of years he has been active in commerce, he is now very experienced and quite successful. This is his first collaboration with the micro-finance company, Soro Yiriwaso. With his loan, he is planning to buy five parcels of various shop articles (milk, sugar, oil, tea, soaps, biscuits, sweets, coffee, Lipton tea, chicken eggs etc.) He gets his supplies in the neighboring villages and in Sikasso town and he retails his products in his kiosk in Loulouni for cash, and often on credit, to a customer base made up of men and women. He expects to make a monthly profit of 65,000 FCFA, of which a large part will be used to build up his business and the rest for family expenses. His ambition is to procure a plot of land in Sikasso town to live on.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various shop articles

loans.name: Shakira's Group

texts.en:
Shakira is a wife of M. M. A. and lives in a city named Lahore, in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods.

Shakira is a housewife but a very talented lady as well. She runs a beauty salon, and although she has no suitable place for her business, she still serves her customers with full dedication. She earns approximately Pak Rs. 15,000 on every month. This is a big financial support for her family. 

She has decided to arrange a place for her parlor so that she makes a renowned parlor for the outsiders because now her customers’ base is just her neighbors.  She is asking for a loan of worth Pak Rs. 20,000 to pay the advance of the place where she wants to starts her parlor.

She has four other ladies in her loan group. Shamim wants a loan to buy clothes for her cloth selling business. Safia wants  a loan to buy electric supplies (switches, tube lights etc) for her electric shop. Zaitoon wants a loan to buy cosmetics for her beauty salon. Another Safia wants a loan to buy construction supplies (cement & bricks) to resell.

loans.use: To pay the advance of a place for opening parlor

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica O. is from the village of Sto. Nino, Talakag Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Jessica is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jessica owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Jessica has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jessica joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Jessica is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jessica from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Carapegua en el Barrio San Cayetano distante a 3km de la oficina de Carapegua se formó el comité de mujeres Santa Rosa, estas señoras son activas la mayoría de ellas se dedica actividad que generen ingresos para sus familias, las mujeres del comité buscan apoyo para fomentar a través del crédito sus ingreso familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida.
  Así como la señora Luciana quien se dedica a la reventa de artesanía que trae de ciudad de Yataity del Guaira, es el lugar donde se hacen ropas de Ao po’i (ropas de telas de lienzos bordados y trabajados). Este producto es muy querido por la gente y ella aprovecha eso para vender sus mercaderías.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de vestir de Ao Po’i.
texts.en:
The Santa Rosa Women's Committee was started in the San Cayetano neighborhood of Carapegua, 3 kilometers from the Carapegua office. They are active women and the majority of them work to generate income for their families. The women of this committee are seeking support in the form of a loan to boost their household incomes and improve the quality of life for their families. Luciana resells handicraft that she brings from the city Yataity del Guaira. Yataity del Guaira is know for the Ao po'i clothing, which is made of embroidered cloth. This clothing is in demand and Luciana makes the most of this in her sales. She is requesting this loan to purchase Ao Po'i clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel French, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase embroidered Ao Po'i clothing

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a wife of T. H. and she lives in a mid-size city named Riwind, in Pakistan. Riwind city is famous for its dairy business.
She is 44-year old woman and owns a two room house, in which she has been living with her family for over 10 years. She is an uneducated lady because she lives in a community where people don’t like to send the girls to school for an education. They raise girls with the guidance of managing domestic chores. This same upbringing happened to Shahnaz and she learned the skills of managing domestic chores and cooking. Shahnaz has given birth to four boys. Her eldest son is a painter and paints doors and windows on call. The next to him works in a local factory on a monthly wage. The youngest sons are enrolled in school and are getting an education. Shahnaz's husband is a mason by profession. He has been in this profession for the last 20 years. Shahnaz is a very caring lady. She takes care of their health by cooking good food and presents it to her family on time, which makes them happy when they reach home. 

Shahnaz is a regular client of Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva). She has successfully repaid her three loans to Asasah and now she is applying for a loan for the fourth time. She will use the loan funds to purchase masonery tools so that her husband may earn a good profit from his profession and improve the standard of living for their family.

loans.use: To purchase masonery tools.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
La señora Benita A. M. domiciliada en el barrio San Pedro de la cuidad de Encarnación se dedica a la compra y venta de animales porcinos, actividad que realiza con su conyugue el señor Eliodoro Vera.

Compras dichos animales los faenan y venden en la zona de Encarnación.
Ellos consiguen buena ganancia haciendo este trabajo, ademas pueden usar la carne para su alimentación.
Solicitan el préstamo para la compra de cerdos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Benita A. M. lives in the San Pedro neighborhood of the city Encarnación. She and her husband Eliodoro Vera have a business buying and selling pork products. The buy this animals and raise them to later sell them in Encarnación. They earn a good profit with this business, and they can also use the meat for food. They are applying for this loan to purchase more pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pigs

loans.name: Mtama Kulanga Group

texts.en:
Tatu M. M., age 39, is married with two children, who are ages 15 and 11. She has run a kiosk business selling juice, water, sodas, rice, sugar and beans since 2008. She works from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and she is able to make a monthly profit of about $208.

This will be Tatu’s first Motisha loan. This is a loan product from Tujijenge Tanzania (a Kiva partner) that allows clients in good standing to access a loan before they have completed their existing loan. It serves as "top-up" financing. Tatu wants this Motisha loan in order to increase her stock. She will increase the things which are out of stock. Her dreams are to expand her business by getting a bigger frame and to take her children to good schools.

Tatu will share this loan with her loan group Mtama Kulanga, which totals six members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 

In the picture, Tatu is the first on the right.

loans.use: To buy products that are out of stock

loans.name: Liricia Moserrate

texts.es:
La señora Liricia es casada aun no ha podido tener hijos pero no descarta la posibilidad de ser madre, tiene como socia 30 ciclos en el banco comunal Los Tamarindos, este banco se reúnen en la ciudad de Portoviejo, trabaja como maestra de Parvulario de un  jardín de infantes en la mañana y en la tarde en un colegio,  aparte de eso ella se dedica al comercio de perfumes Yanbal y Perfumes Americanos de marcas reconocidas como Carolina Herrera entre otros, los productos  de Yanbal los compra en la ciudad de Portoviejo y los demás hace pedidos a sus familiares que viven en EE.UU.

Ella  vende por medio de pedidos, tiene 10 clientes fijos  y aparte  vende a los amigos de sus amigos, la señora Liricia  en cada compra que realiza invierte todo el crédito de la Fundación.

En los actuales momentos nuestra socia tiene un buen capital invertido en los perfumes y con este nuevo crédito podrá pagar varios de ellos, además surtir con mas productos de Yanbal,  nos comentó que cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo y se siente muy contenta con su negocio,  lo único que pide es seguir con salud para poder trabajar sin problema alguno.
texts.en:
Liricia is married and hasn't been able to have children yet, although she is not discounting the possibility of being a mother. She has been a member of the communal bank Los Tamarindos for 30 cycles. This bank meets in the city of Portoviejo. She works as a preschool teacher in in the morning and at a high school in the afternoon. In addition to that, she sells Yanbal perfume and American perfumes with recognizable brand names such as Carolina Herrera, among others. She buys the Yanbal products in Portoviejo and the rest she orders from her relatives who live in the U.S.A. She sells by order. She has 10 regular customers and she also sells to freinds of friends. Liricia invests everything into the loan from the Fundación with every purchase. At this time, our member has a good amount of capital invested in perfumes and with this new loan, she will be able to pay for several and also diversify with more Yanbal products. She told us that she has her husband's support and she is very happy with the business. The only thing she asks for is to stay healthy to be able to work without any trouble.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfume and makeup to sell

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es: La Señora Lizbeth tiene una tienda de abarrotes la cual ella atiende todo el día, el esposo de la Señora Lizbeth trabaja como obrero en una maquilaora, tienen tres hijos pequeños. Pero la señora es una mujer muy trabajadora y desea invertir en la compra de mas mercancia para el negocio y así poder incrementar las ventas y los ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Lizbeth has a grocery store where she works all day. Her husband is a factory worker. They have three small children.

Lizbeth is a hardworking woman and wants to buy more merchandise for her business so that she can increase her sales. Her income will improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Eseri

texts.en:
Eseri is married with four children and all of them are at school. She also takes care of additional family members. She owns a store selling charcoal and bananas in Nabulagala in Lubaga Division. She has been in this business for four years.    She plans to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas and bags of charcoal. She sells to all categories of people in the area, both retail and wholesale. 

Eseri works seven days a week.  She depends on this job for a living. She buys bunches of bananas and bags of charcoal from Kiboga, one of the districts in the central region. Eseri uses public transport to and from Kiboga and goes shopping once a week. Her business challenges include transportation and the rainy season because when it rains the roads become impassable.  She is aspiring of educating her children up to university. 

Eseri joined MCDT to acquire additional capital.   She  resides in and owns a house which has no electricity or piped water. Among her  monthly expenses  are school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of banana and bags of charcoal

loans.name: Hazaa

texts.en: Hazaa is 38 years old and lives in Bint Jbeil with his wife and six children. He has made a living raising sheep for the last 25 years, and has been self-employed since 1990. Hazaa has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua, his first, to buy a cow. This will allow him to increase his income by selling milk and raising calves. He loves his work a lot and believes that it's a good source for income for taking care of his family. In the future, he also hopes to own a large farm.

loans.use: To buy a cow so he can raise calves and sell its milk

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, D. 53 años, es una madre D. familia muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Pablo D. 51 años y sus 2 hijos menores, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida. Los largos días D. trabajo que tiene Victoria en sus tierras, han hecho que se vuelva una gran conocedora D. la agricultura, sus cultivos están muy bien cuidados y siempre consigue un buen precio por la venta D. sus productos, puesto que en estos últimos meses, la demanda por la papa, arveja y maíz que cultiva se ha incrementado. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cultivar la tierra, ya que es la actividad que realiza desD. que era niña, sin embargo considera que le es difícil transportar sus productos hasta el mercado D. Tarma, pero sabe que todo esfuerzo tiene su recompensa. Ahora espera comprar más tierras y así incrementar su producción. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias D. su grupo comunal, donD. se siente muy contenta. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará fertilizantes, para hacer más productivas sus tierras.
texts.en:
Victoria is 53 years old, and a very simple hard-working mother of a family. She lives in her own house with her husband Pablo, who is 51, and her 2 minor children. She wishes to offer them a better quality of life. The long days of work that Victoria spends on her land have maD. her very knowledgeable about agriculture. Her crops are very well cared for and always bring a good price when sold, especially since in recent months demand for the potatoes, vetch, and corn that she grows has grown. What Victoria likes most about her work is to cultivate the earth, since that is what she has done since she was a child. Nonetheless, she considers it difficult to transport her produce to market in Tarma, but understands that all effort has its recompense. Now Victoria wants to buy more land and thus, increase her production. This is her 2nd loan with MFP and she is saving to be able to make her payments on time, since she doesn't want to cause problems for fellow members in her communal bank, where she feels very content. With the 1,000 new sols she is requesting, Victoria will buy fertilizers to make her land more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING FERTILIZERS TO MAKE HER LAND MORE PRODUCTIVE

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es: Lilia tiene 26 años, ella vive con su esposo y su hija de 6 años en casa de sus suegros. Desde hace 4 años se dedica al bordado y tejido, actividad que le enseñaron su familia y ahora produce bellos trabajos con calidad que son usados en las danzas típicas de su ciudad. De esta manera esta aportando en la economía de su hogar al mismo tiempo que atiende a su pequeña hija que esta estudiando. Es así que Lilia realiza este trabajo en su misma y las ganancias que percibe son rentables, por tal motivo desea producir cantidad de fustanes bordados aprovechando las épocas festivas que se acercan. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de lana por fardos, telas e hilos para incrementar su producción.
texts.en:
Lilia is 26 years old and lives at her in-laws’ house, along with her husband and six year old daughter. She’s been knitting and embroidering for the past four years; a trade she learned from her family and now she produces beautiful quality works that are used in traditional dances throughout the city. In this way she can contribute to the household finances and care for her young daughter who attends school. Lilia’s sales are profitable and she wants to make large quantities of embroidered skirts, so that she can take advantage of the approaching festive seasone. This will be her third loan through MFP, and she’s glad to know that she has financial support. She’s always been responsible with her payments and is happy to be a part of a communal bank because all of its members are responsible and united people. She appreciates those who make this loan possible and it will be very useful for her business’ progress. She will use the money from this loan to buy bales of yarn, fabrics, and thread so that she can increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: María Inés Moreno

texts.es: María Inés M. de 31 años de edad, reside en la zona rural de Suchitoto, ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán, ella vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos menores de edad. María trabaja junto a su esposo en su propia parcela sembrando maíz para posteriormente comercializar, ganancias las cuales representan la única fuente de ingresos para sostener a su familia, así mismo María posee algunas vacas de las cuales obtiene productos lácteos como leche y queso para el consumo de la familia. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar dos novillas para criarlas y posteriormente obtener los mayores recursos de ellas, así mismo ella desea comprar mayor cantidad de maíz para incrementar su cosecha y de esta forma obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
María Inés M. is 31 years old and resides in the rural district of Suchitoto in the Department of Cuscatlán. She lives with her husband and their three young children. María and her husband own a parcel of land where they grow corn to sell at a later time. Their earnings from this activity is the only source of income by which they support their family. María also owns cows from which she is able to obtain milk for family consumption and for making cheese.

She is requesting a loan so that she will have the money needed to buy two young heifers. This will allow her to obtain more milk in the future. She also wants to buy more corn so that she can increase her yield and generate more earnings.

loans.use: Purchase corn & two heifers

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su decimo tercer ciclo, trabajando en conjunto entre las integrantes. Cada una de ellas realiza un trabajo independiente adema de los trabajos que realizan como grupo.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Sra. Evangelista G. con 50 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos que se quedan  en la casa mientras ella se  va a vender sus productos de limpieza  por la mañana en un bolso y de paso junta  los envases reciclados luego regresa a su casa prepara para el almuerzo  y vuelve a salir por la tarde para a hacer su venta de reciclajes.
Es una señora muy sufrida que tiene un día a día muy pesado  por que al llegar de su trabajo debe de realizar las tareas de la casa y todo lo hace para salir adelante con sus hijos ya que es madre soltera.   
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de ingredientes que utiliza para elaborar los productos de limpieza que ella venda como detergentes, desodorante de ambiente y otros.
texts.en:
The group is currently on its tenth loan cycle. Each of the members has their own business but they also have work that brings them together as a group. 

One of the members is Mrs. Evangelista Gonzalez. She is 50 years old and she has 2 children who stay at home while she goes out to sell cleaning products in the mornings. She carries the products in a sack that she later fills with empty bottles for recycling. She comes home to have lunch ready and she goes out again afterward to sell the recyclable goods. 

She is a much stressed woman, having to go out day after day with a very heavy load. When she comes home from work she has to do housework, doing all of this for the sake of her children.  She is a single mother. 

She requests a loan to purchase ingredients to be used to make the cleaning products she sells, such as detergents and household air fresheners among other products.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make cleaning products.

loans.name: Ekawa

texts.fr: En 2004, D. a ouvert sa boutique dans laquelle elle vend des produits de beauté. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Sa clientèle est en majorité féminine. Elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour gonfler son stock avec divers produits de beauté. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants.
texts.en:
In 2004 D. opened a shop where she sells beauty products. She gets her supplies from the main market in Lomé. Her customers are for the most part women.

She is requesting a loan from WAGES to bolster her stock supply with various beauty products. She is married and the mother of three children.

loans.use: buy beauty products

loans.name: Casilda Maria

texts.es:
Casilda es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Triunfadoras” ubicado en el distrito D. Cabanilla, provincia D. Lampa, departamento D. Puno, tiene 46 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y con 03 hijos. La señora tiene estudios D. educación primaria incompleta.

Casilda viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 02 años, su  préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para incrementar el capital D. su negocio D. venta D. animales caseros.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá para comprar más animales.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener ganados mejorados. Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las reuniones.
texts.en:
Casilda is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Triunfadoras” (Triumphant Women), which is located in the District of Cabanilla, Lampa Province, Department of Puno. She is 46 years old, married, and has three children. Casilda did not finish her elementary school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for two years. Her first loan was in the amount of 500 PEN, which was used to increase her business capital for selling domesticated animals.

Now she is requesting a new loan of 1500 PEN to invest in the purchase of more animals. Casilda dreams of improving her income in the future. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the meetings.

loans.use: Purchase more animals to sell

loans.name: Norma Dominga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Norma; ella tiene 51 años de edad, soltera  y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de flores las cuales ella hace pedido a la ciudad de Lima y luego ella lo distribuye a quienes lo solicitan como arreglos florales  entre otros, a la vez la socia trabaja en un colegio de la provincia de Ollantaytambo en el cargo de auxiliar de educación. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio con mas variedad de flores y así poder ofrecer a sus clientes distintas variedades.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Llankachinapac communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, which is in the Urubamba province and the department of Cusco. 

Norma is 51 year old. She is single and has one child. She has a business selling flowers that she has ordered from Lima and which she then distributes as floral arrangements. She alternates this activity with a job as a teacher’s aide at a school in Ollantaytambo.

Norma is seeking this loan to provide a greater variety of flowers for her business, offering her customers a better selection. She is grateful to all those who have made this dream possible, and promises to make her payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: Buy flowers to sell

loans.name: Joseph Olum

texts.en:
Joseph N. is 35 years old and is married to Mary. They have six children, with the eldest being 14 years old. They live in Kondele in Kisumu city.

Joseph is in the business of selling second hand clothes and has been doing it for 10 years. He is applying for his first loan from Kadet Ltd after being introduced by a friend who has benefited from the loans before. Joseph intends to use the money to buy five bales of clothes to add to his stock. The profits made from his business will be used for the family’s needs and also to pay school fees for his children.

His dream is to diversify into the transport business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more bales of clothes to add to his stock

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Nov S. is 57 years old, married, and has five children.  They live in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia, an area known for well-supplied with freshwater from major rivers. She is requesting a loan of $1,100 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. S. and her husband are farmers, earning $2 each per day.  The family has to spend $30 on food,  $1 on electricity supply, and $13 on other necessary expenses every month.  Her three children are employed, earning about $1.5 each per day to help cover the family expenses.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Django

texts.es:
El señor Django es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres durante mucho tiempo, en la zona de Rincón La Portada de la ciudad de La Paz.
El cliente es medico odontólogo que acaba de salir de la universidad, cuenta con un ambiente en su casa, el cual utiliza como clínica dental realizando curaciones y armado de placas dentales en la misma zona de La Paz. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de equipos de odontología para su clínica y brindar mejor servicio a su clientela así poder aumentar sus ingresos.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Django is single and doesn't have any children.  He has lived in his parents' home for a long time, in Rincón La Portada district of the city of La Paz.

Django is a medical dentist who has just finished university.  He has an area in his home that he uses as a dental clinic, treating patients and making dentures.  This is how he makes income for his household.

Django will use his loan to buy dentistry equipment for his clinic so that he can provide his clients with a better service and thereby improve his income.  This is his first loan and the socio-economic analysis we have performed qualifies him favorably to take a loan.

loans.use: To buy equipment for his dental clinic

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
We do not need to make a lot of mistakes before we get to learn. At the age of 44, Felisa, learns the ways of both business and life in order to improve herself.   She is married to Terlito I., an auto mechanic.  They live in Malaria, Caloocan City.

Felisa has been managing their auto repair shop for 15 years.  She also partners with Terlito as an auto mechanic.  They have no other employees, so  Felisa gives her utmost strength to make her business work. She earns an estimated net income of around Php700 per day.

To help her grow her business, Felisa is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will use this money to buy a motor engine and other spare parts needed to continue operation of their auto repair shop. With this money on hand she can easily improve her business, a lesson she got in her fellowship with fellow community partners.

The simplest dream she has in her heart is for everyone in the family to have good health, and to see  more customers who will prefer their services and eventually bring growth for her business.  As CCT community partner, she is faithfully attending their weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration received from the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: For a motor engine and other spare parts needed for auto repair

loans.name: Simon Mwangi

texts.en:
Simon has been selling fruits and vegetables in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years.  He is 35 years old, married to Grace Wangui, and they have two children.

Simon was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

In the future, Simon hopes to be supplying fruits and vegetables to the local market in large quantities.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Phorn P., 62, resides with his family in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. P. is a traditional doctor, earning an income of USD 3 per day. His wife is employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 3.5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 80 on food and USD 38 on the other necessary expenses.

 P. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase an inexpensive truck to transport firewood and charcoal for sale. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a truck to transport firewood and charcoal for resale

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 23 years old, married, and the father of one child. He has been operating a taxi business for more than two years. He dreams of owning more taxis in order to become financially stable. He also does dairy farming to supplement his family’s income. He has been able to improve his businesses, and therefore, his standard of living. He has requested a loan of 10,000 KES to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona T. is from the village of Hinaplanon, Iligan City. She is 39 years old. Chona is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Chona owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling snack foods, shampoo, soap, and beverages in the local community. She is also selling electronic loads from several networks. Chona has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Chona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Chona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Chona is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory such as canned goods and snack foods. This loan will be Chona's ninth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory such as canned goods and snack foods

location.town: Hinaplanon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: rebuild her husband's destroyed bakery

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah K. lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children, four of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). Deborah lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and  feeding the family.      

Deborah has a business of selling fish. She has been in this business for a few years, and she works seven days out of every week. Deborah   sells her products at the market, by means of retail. The main business challenges for Deborah include ever increasing prices of smoked fish and seasonality.   

Deborah has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more baskets of fish. 

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on wholesale only and also to educate her children up to university.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of fish.

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Mr. Battulga is 36 years old and works as a taxi driver. He has been running a taxi business since 2001. He used to work for the State-owned taxi company and when the company was privatized, he bought his car on a leasing contract and successfully paid it off. 

Battulga lives with his mother in his mother’s apartment. A few years ago, he separated from his wife. Now he has met another woman and he is planning to marry her and start a new life. He has a small plot of land,  and at the moment he is planning to build a family house on it. He is going to finance the project from his savings, but still needs some money on top. The loan he is taking will be used to buy necessary building materials to build a family house on his plot of land.

loans.use: To buy necessary building materials to build a family house on his plot of land.

loans.name: Victor Desiderio

texts.es:
Victor de 65 años, es un hombre trabajador que se levanta todos los días a laborar en su taxi recorriendo las calles de Guayaquil.  Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su taxi ya que le ayuda a solventar los gastos de su familia. 

Trabaja todo el día desde muy temprano recorriendo las calles de Guayaquil ya que está asociado a una cooperativa que le ayuda a tener clientes por teléfono. Quiere continuar trabajando por eso quiere el préstamo para arreglar su carro y otra parte para construir mejor su casa. En el futuro quiere mejorar sus ingresos comprando otro taxi.
texts.en:
Victor is 65 years old. This hardworking gentleman wakes up early every day for his job driving his taxi through the streets of Guayaquil. As a taxi driver, he has many aspirations to resolve his family’s expenses.

Victor works all day driving through the streets of Guayaquil, starting in the early morning hours. He is part of a cooperative that accepts customer requests for taxis over the telephone. Victor wants to continue working, so he will use the loan to repair his automobile. Part of the loan will be used to build his house. In the future, he wants to improve his earnings so that he can buy another taxi.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle repairs and to purchase materials for building his house.

loans.name: Ma. Rochel

texts.en:
Ma. Rochel is 32 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries,etc.

Ma. Rochel has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 5 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport and rice retailing.

Ma. Rochel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Shangba

texts.en:
Shangba is 39 years old and married with two children, ages 17 and 21. She runs a boutique on Fourabay Road near Freetown. Shangba has been in this business for five years and sells clothing, shoes, bags, and earrings at her store. Her business is the only source of income she has. She says that her business is doing well, and she faces few challenges.   

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase some boutique stock, which is very helpful for her business. Shangba says that the extra income from this loan will help her educate her children. In the future, she would like to improve her products and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more boutique items, shoes, bags, and dresses

loans.name: Elisa

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade da Matola, Provincia de Maputo, sul de Mocambique é casada e mãe de 1 filho de 3 anos de idade que ainda não frequenta Escola. Fez 12a classe e continua com seus estudos frequentando neste momento o ensino superior. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta seus pais mandando dinheiro para alguma ajuda alimentar.
Saiu da Matola para Boane quando se casou, é funcionaria permanente do Ministerio da Educação ha mais de 5 anos onde recebe um salario de  6.848.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Ja fez emprestimo no banco Millenium Bim para habitação e pagou sem problemas, Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem são clientes desta instituição e dicidiu solicitar o seu primeiro emprestimo no valor de 11.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento,areia,varões e outros) para dar continuição a sua obra de construção da sua casa.
o seu sonho e concluir a sua obra e iniciar um pequeno negocio, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Elisa was born in the city of Matola, in the southern Mozambican province of Maputo. She is a married mother of a 3 year old son, who does not yet attend school. She attended school herself up to the 12th Grade and she is currently continuing with her studies in higher education. She lives in her own home with her family and she supports her parents by sending them money to help out with their food costs.
She left Matola and came to Boane when she got married. She has had a permanent position as an office clerk at the Ministry of Education for the last 5 years, for which she receives 6,848MZN each month. She uses this money for household expenses and puts some away as savings in her bank account.
She has already borrowed money from the Millenium Bim bank for work on a bedroom, and she repaid this without any problems. She heard about Hluvuku through friends who are also Hluvuku clients and she decided to apply for her first loan of 11,000MZN. She intends to use this money to buy building materials (cement, sand, rods and other materials) to continue with the building work on her house.
Her dream is to finish this work and to start a small business. She hopes to apply for further loans to achieve these aims.

loans.use: to buy building materials (cement, sand, rods and othe rmaterials).

loans.name: Isabelo

texts.en:
Isabelo is 49 years old and lives in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married with four school-aged dependents.

Isabelo is a motorcycle taxi driver. He owns and operates a service-based business, providing passenger services in the local community. He has been engaged in this business for over three years. He earns a total of 6,000 PHP a month from this business. He has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP at GDMPC to purchase tires and spare parts and to pay for the labor cost in motorcycle repair and maintenance.

Isabelo has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Isabelo hopes to gain more income from this business to purchase an additional motorcycle for transport.

loans.use: to purchase tires and spare parts, and to pay for the labor cost of motorcycle repair and maintenance

loans.name: Nueva Aurora Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Nueva Aurora" y se ubica en el estado de Puebla en México. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes, la señora Antonia es la presidenta del grupo. Ella se dedica a la venta de Ropa y zapatos que inicio hace 3 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar surtir su negocio y comprar más ropa y zapatos de diferentes modelos, colores y tallas ya que le hacen pedidos frecuentemente, ella tiene 31 años, estudio hasta tercero de primaria, ella es madre soltera y tiene en total 4 hijos. Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente entusiasmada por la oportunidad de seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y con esto tener mas clientes y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia y así apoyar a sus hijos para asistir a la escuela y tengan una carrera profesional que les permita tener más oportunidades en el futuro..
texts.en:
This group is called "Nueva Aurora" [New Dawn] and is located in the state of Puebla in Mexico.  The group is made up of 9 members with Señora Antonia as the president.  
Señora Antonia has been selling clothing and footwear for a living for 3 years.  She is requesting a loan to stock her business with more clothing and shoes of different styles, colors, and sizes since she frequently has orders.   She is 31 years old and has a third grade education.  She is also a single mother and has 4 children.  When applying for this loan she felt enthusiastic about the opportunity to continue investing in her business as this will bring in more customers.  In return, she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.  She will be able to support her children so that they can attend school and have a professional career that will allow them to have more opportunities in the future.

loans.use: purchase more clothing and footwear of different styles, colors, and sizes.

loans.name: Salaheddin

texts.en: Salaheddin is a 24-year-old young man. He is married and lives in Ramallah city located in Palestine. Salaheddin has an internet cafe and he wants to increase the number of computers because of the increasing numbers of visitors using the current computers. Salaheddin has an amount of money that isn't enough to pay for the computers, so he needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Salaheddin takes the FATEN loan that is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to increase the number of computers and more customers will visit the internet cafe to enjoy the service. In this way, Salaheddin will improve his income and have better work and life conditions. Salaheddin is photographed in his internet cafe.

loans.use: To purchase more computers for his internet cafe

loans.name: Scolastica

texts.en: Scolastica is a hardworking business lady who was born in 1978. She is married and blessed with two children who are school-going. For the last three years, she has been selling construction materials to make a living. In the next five years, she wants to have a large firm dealing with the supply of construction materials. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy pipes. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to embrace the culture of saving.

loans.use: to buy pipes.

loans.name: Hanane

texts.en:
Hanane is a 49-year-old married woman living with her husband and two children. She is from Lebanon. She has been working as a cook since 2002. She works at her house. Her delicious prepared Lebanese food products are sold to customers from her community. She has been working hard to support her family in cooperation with her husband who used to be in the Lebanese army. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new oven in order to increase her business productivity. In the future, she would like to rent out a small space to sell merchandise, as well as selling popular home-made food products.

loans.use: to purchase a new oven in order to increase her business productivity.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has practiced dairy farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last three years.  She also sells milk and milk products like powdered milk.  She is 32 years old and a single mother of two school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow.

In future, Jane hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Tlahkotepec Group

texts.es:
María Angélica es la representante del grupo Tlahkotepec que en su dialecto Náhuatl significa medio cerro, ella es originaria de la comunidad de altas montañas, el grupo lo conforman tambien Norma y la señora María Guadalupe.
Angélica como comúnmente la conocen en su comunidad vive con su esposo Ezequiel y su pequeña hija Nayeli de cuatro años la cual apenas da inicio con su educación preescolar, ella es ama de casa y se dedica a comprar y criar pollos que sale a vender a las comunidades que se encuentran cercanas a la suya.
Norma dedica su tiempo a las labores del hogar atendiendo a su esposo y a sus pequeñas hijas, Jesica y Perla de cuatro y siete años, mientras que doña María Guadalupe vive con su hijo Isidro y su nieta Veronica, ella cubre sus gastos diarios con pequeños apoyos que recibe de su hijo, estas últimas integrantes del grupo desean iniciar con un negocio ya que sean entusiasmado tanto con los comentarios que les realiza Angélica de que su negocio le deja excelentes ganancias.
La meta que tiene este grupo es de fortalecer sus negocios para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias y así ayudar a sus esposos con los gastos diarios dentro del hogar.
Las integrantes agradecen de todo corazón la ayuda recibida por parte de FRAC y KIVA, ya que para ellas era muy complicado tener acceso a un crédito por otras instituciones.,  con su recurso ellas fortalecerán sus negocios comprando mas pollos y alimento para su engorda.
texts.en:
María Angélica is the representative of the “Tlahkotepec” group which in their Náhuatl dialect means “half hill.”   She’s from the community of Alta Montañas and the other group members are Norma and María Guadalupe.

Angélica, as she’s commonly known in the community, lives with her husband, Ezequiel and her little girl, Nayeli, 4, who has just started pre-school.  She’s a housewife and also buys chicks to raise and then sell in the communities that are near hers.

Norma spends her time doing household chores and taking care of her husband and little daughters, Jesica and Perla, 4 and 7 respectively, while María Guadalupe lives with her son, Isidro, and her granddaughter, Verónica.  She covers her daily expenses with small contributions she gets from her son.  These last two group members want to start a business because they are very excited by the comments Angélica makes about how profitable her business is.

This group’s goal is to strengthen their businesses to improve their families’ living conditions and help their husbands meet daily household expenses.

The group members thank FRAC and VIVA with their whole hearts for the help they’ve gotten because it is very complicated for them to have access to loans from other institutions.  With this resource, they will strengthen their businesses buying more chicks and feed for them.

loans.use: to buy feed and chicks to raise and sell.

loans.name: Josejhane

texts.en:
Josejhane is 30 years old and is a married woman with 1 child. Her husband is a driver and owns his own tricycle.

Josejhane is into a buy & sell business. She buys chickens and pigs to sell at the market. She has been in this business for 2 years. She requested this loan to buy more chickens and pigs to sell. She hopes to save for her child's future.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and pigs to sell.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is a 25-year-old married woman from Madab, Jordan and the mother of one child. She has a grocery store and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more foodstuffs for her store.

Mai is looking to expand her business and improve her family's  living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs for her store.

loans.name: Aurea Marie

texts.en: Aurea Marie is 26 years old and lives in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. Aurea Marie works in the fish industry and sells/catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 8 years. She has requested a loan of PHP5,000 to purchase fishing materials needed for fishing. Aurea Marie has been a member of PMPC for 8 years.

loans.use: To purchase fishing materials needed for fishing.

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab is from the village Zenakidzeebi, West Georgia. He is 48 years old, married and lives with his family: his wife, Maya, his 72-year-old father and his 3 daughters (23, 21 and 16 years old). The youngest daughter goes to school, the middle one is a student and the eldest daughter helps her parents on the family farm.

The main source of income for this 6-person family is farming. The family owns 0.3 hectares of land, where they grow fruits and vegetables. Merab sells the harvested vegetables and fruits to greengrocery retailers. Along with the agriculture, Merab works as a driver in a local company, earning a salary. The family's total average monthly income is 700 GEL, including Merab’s father's pension. Merab has requested a loan to purchase materials for greenhouse construction. He will buy wooden materials and polyethylene and construct a greenhouse. When the family will have the greenhouse, they will be able to grow cucumbers and tomatoes in the winter and spring months and sell them to their partner retailers. The family's income will increase. Merab and Maya plan to use the anticipated profits to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse construction

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, de 33 años; un ejemplo de madre para sus 3 hijos quienes viven en casa propia asimismo a quienes desea brindarles un buen futuro. Hace 02 años Nancy, abrió una pequeña tienda de venta de ropa a la que ahora se dedica constantemente. Cada mañana se levanta temprano para poder atender a sus hijos y enviarlos al colegio; después abre su negocio en la espera de clientes. Nancy, comenta que las ventas salen los días sábados y domingos ya que vienen de anexos de la localidad de Santa Rosa para hacer sus compras. Ella es conocida por el trato y el buen consejo que les ofrece al elegir una prenda a sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de trabajo es poder ver a sus clientes muy contentos con las prendas que se llevan y considera que lo más difícil es esperar hasta el fin de semana para tener buenas ventas. Con el crédito solicitado podrá incrementar más prendas de vestir para dejar contentos a sus clientes. Este será su préstamo número 06 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá  el apoyo financiero, ya que así se siente segura de avanzar con su negocio. En su banco comunal es muy alegre y comparte experiencias con sus compañeros. Con el crédito solicitado de 2,000 nuevos soles, podrá comprar ropa como: blusas, polos, pantalones, sí podrá mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Nancy, 33, is an exemplary mother for her three children, who live in their own home and to whom she wants to give a good future.  Two years ago Nancy opened a little clothing store in which she now works constantly.  Every morning she gets up early to be able to take care of her children and send them to school; later she opens her store to wait for customers.

Nancy says that the sales come on Saturday and Sunday, since people come to shop from the outskirts of the town of Santa Rosa.  She is known for the treatment and good advice she gives her customers when they are choosing a garment.

What she likes most about her work is being able to see her customers happy with the clothes they take with them.  The most difficult thing is waiting until the weekend to have good sales.

With the requested loan she will be able to increase her articles of clothing to leave her customers happy.  This will be her sixth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will have the financial help, because in this way she feels secure about moving forward with her business.  She is very happy with her communal bank and she shares experiences with her companions.

With the requested loan of 2,000 PEN, Nancy will be able to buy clothing such as blouses, polo shirts, and pants, so she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy blouses, polo shirts, and pants.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is 37 years old, married, and a father of six children. He operates a motorbike transport business (known locally as boda boda) in Tezo, Kilifi.  He has been in this business for the last two months and he is doing great. 

This will be Samwel’s first loan from KADET LTD to expand his business. He plans to buy another motorcycle and use the anticipated profits to repay his loan.  He hopes to have an improved standard of living for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy another  motorcycle

loans.name: Athieng

texts.en:
Athieng is a 37-year-old married woman with seven children; three of them are in school. She has had a business selling drinks in Bor, South Sudan for five years.

Athieng is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase soda and beer. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase soda and beer for sale.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Paulino tiene 47 años edad y tiene cinco hijos, él nació en el distrito de Urubamba de la provincia de Urubamba y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él es docente y trabaja en uno de los colegios más prestigiosos de la ciudad de Chincheros y enseña en el nivel primario por las mañanas. Ya son 17 años que ejerce su profesión y le va muy bien. Paulino también tiene un pequeño taller de carpintería en su domicilio donde él trabaja por las tardes. Paulino tiene un trabajador quien se encarga del negocio en las horas que paulino no se encuentra en el negocio. En esta oportunidad Paulino requiere el préstamo para comprar madera. 

Paulino es integrante del banco comunal “Nueva Vision de Rumichaca”. Este  grupo está conformado con 19 socios que viven  en la provincia de Urubamba. La provincia de Urubamba está ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco, a orillas del río Vilcanota, en una zona que se conoce como el “Valle Sagrado” debido a su clima templado, tierra  fértil y abundantes riachuelos, que hacen de este valle uno de los más bellos del planeta.
texts.en:
Paulino is a member of the Nueva Vision de Rumichaca communal bank, a group of 19 members who live in Urubamba Province located north of the city of Cusco on the banks of the Vilcanota River. The area is known as the Sacred Valley for its mild climate, fertile soil, and abundant streams that make this valley one of the most beautiful on the planet.

Paulino is 47 years old and has five children. He was born in the Urubamba District in Urubamba Province and lives in the same city where he was born. His is a teacher at one of the most prestigious schools in the city of Chincheros and teaches at the primary level in the mornings. He's already been working in this profession for 17 years and it's going very well. Paulino already has a small carpentry workshop in his home where he works in the afternoon. Paulino has one worker who he employees to man the shop in the hours when he's not there. At the moment, Paulino needs this loan to buy wood.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Aluk

texts.en:
Aluk lives in bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 year old, married, and has four children; three of them are still in school. 

Aluk heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase sugar, cooking oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the children’s school fee.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 30 years old and married with 3 children. Two are in primary and the last born is in pre-primary. She is very active in the group being one of the founders, and she demonstrates good record of attendance in the group.

She had an aim of improving her life when she joined the group. She has proven herself right and she has been the pillar to the success of the group, as everyone looks to her for strength. She has also been able to contribute in leadership among women, empowering them and motivating them.

Ann sells used shoes at Ngurueni market and besides this, she grows vegetables and sells cereals for family consumption on her farm. Her business has been doing well despite the fact that she has been experiencing stock outs. By securing a loan, Ann will manage to acquire more stock for her business and she will be on the right track to fulfilling her dream of financial independence.

loans.use: Ann wants to buy more shoes for her business

loans.name: Naringul

texts.en: Naringul M. owns a market in the small town of Devechi, just south of Khachmaz, located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Naringul wants to increase the quantity and variety of his inventory in order to attract more customers. Husband is pictured here.

loans.use: Invest in a newer and more diversified inventory

loans.name: Teresa Helena

texts.en:
Teresa is 34 years old. She was born in Maputo and lived with her father. She studied and in her spare time sold bread and braided hair as a way of helping her family. Teresa left school in the 7th grade. She was married in Ressano Garcia, and had 2 daughters. She worked as a maid and helped her husband in the small shop he owned and operated until his death. Teresa decided to restart her life. She began buying products such as: eggs, cooking oil, and beverages in the neighboring South Africa and delivering them to local shops in the city of Maputo. With the profits she bought a small stand shop in Catembe. She stocked the shop and invited her brother to manage the business. In 2004, Teresa moved in with her mother in Catembe and started managing her shop. In 2005, her younger sister told her about Hluvuku-Adsema. This is her first loan. With the loan of 15,000.00 MTN Teresa wants to diversify her stock, and expand her shop. With the profits she wants to be able to better sustain her family, continue the schooling of her children, and have the shop make an impact in society as place of gathering in the weekends. In the future, she wishes to upgrade her stand to a well known grocery shop in Catembe

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Guachene - Catembe Cliente: Teresa Helena P. Actividade: Comércio Valor empréstimo: 15.000,00MT (600.00US$) Aplicação do empréstimo: Compra e revenda de produtos a retalho Início: 12/04/2007 Fim: 31/12/2008 Teresa, nascida a 34 anos em Maputo, viveu com o pai na Matola onde estudava e nos tempos livres fazia tranças e vendia pães como forma de ajuda no sustento familiar. Deixou de estudar na 7ª classe, altura que se casou maritalmente e passou a viver com seu marido em Ressano Garcia onde tiveram duas filhas. Ela era doméstica e de vez em quando acompanhava os movimentos das vendas no pequeno estabelecimento no qual seu marido era proprietário, onde este, anos mais tarde veio a falecer. Assim, ela decide recomeçar a vida comprando Produtos como:Ovos, Óleo e Bebidas diversas na vizinha África do Sul e entregava-os aos armazenistas na cidade de Maputo, e com os lucros que ia amealhando decide comprar um pequeno estabelecimento comercial barraca na Catembe tendo reabilitado completamente e apetrechada com uma gama de produtos, logo a seguir contratou seu irmão mais novo para gerir o negocio. Em 2004 decide viver com sua mãe em Catembe e toma a gerência da barraca. Em 2005 a irmã mais nova comentara da Hluvuku-Adsema sendo uma Instituição que concede crédito, e esta decide solicitar o primeiro empréstimo. Com o crédito de 15.000,00MTN ela pretende capitalizar seu negócio colocando diversos produtos, reabilitar e ampliar o seu estabelecimento. Com o rendimento do negócio consegue o sustento da família, por as crianças a estudar e tem impacto na sociedade como local de lazer aos fins de semana. A perspectiva futura é modernizar a barraca e transformá-la numa Mercearia de referencia na Catembe.

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

loans.name: Fatumata

texts.en: Fatumata K. is forty years old and a mother of four children.  She started her business when she was young but could not continue during the civil war.  After the war, she started selling vegetables that she grew around her house.  She saved some of the income from the vegetable sales and diversified her business.  Married to a carpenter, her husband’s income is seasonal and cannot sustain the family all year round.  Fatumata now owns a small stall in the market in Magburaka of Sierra Leone, selling palm oil, rice, onions, butter, etc.  She is interested in increasing her inventory to increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase of additional food stock for her market stall business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Ms. Lourdes C. is 30 years old, lives with her partner Ever Moreira, a traveling salesman, and has two little daughters of 5 and 8 years of age. They live in a small house of their own, which they managed to build with great sacrifice. Fifteen years ago, she started working as a sales person; with great will and a minimal capital, she started selling brushes, handkerchiefs and bijouterie. This was only enough to eat but nonetheless, with her savings, she was able to study and learn the skills of manicure and pedicure, that presently generate income for her as well. Today, she has a stand where she sells all kinds of fruits, like oranges, apples, grapefruit, etc. She wants the $500 loan to expand her business and build a small kiosk, as her clientele has grown and she has many requests. She wishes to give a better future to her children and that they finish school and have access to a good formal job.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Lourdes C. tiene 30 años, vive con su pareja Ever Moreira, quien es vendedor ambulante, y tiene dos pequeñas hijas de 5 y 8 años. Viven en una casita propia que con mucho esfuerzo lograron construir. Hace 15 años empezó a trabajar como vendedora; con muchas ganas y con un capital mínimo, comenzó a vender diferentes productos, como cepillos, pañuelos y accesorios de bijouterie. Esto le dejaba ingresos con los que solamente daba para comer, pero a pesar de ello con sus ganancias ahorradas, pudo estudiar el oficio de manicura y pedicura que hoy día también le genera ingresos. Actualmente tiene una casilla donde vende todo tipo de frutas como naranjas, manzanas, pomelos, etc. Desea el crédito de $500 para ampliar su negocio, construyendo un pequeño kiosco, debido a que su clientela ha crecido y tiene bastantes pedidos. Ella desea poder dar a sus hijas un futuro mejor, que culminen sus estudios y puedan acceder a un buen empleo formal.

loans.use: To build a kiosk for sales.

loans.name: Dewa Ayu Rai Arti

texts.id:
Dewa Ayu Rai Arti, a mother who operates a store all day out of her home. The profit from the store is insufficient to cover the family’s rising expenses. As a lady who would like to improve the family’s prosperity, she intends to start another different business. Dewi Ayu with her husband, Dewa Adnyana, decided to raise pigs. With this loan and training from DINARI, she purchased a mother pig and feed. From raising this pig for 6 months will produce 10 piglets that can be sold for Rp 250.000 (about USD30) each. In the 6 months, Dewa Ayu, will generate revenue from the sale of the piglets amounting to Rp 2.500.000 (about USD300) – generating a monthly profit of Rp 370.000 (USD40) for Dewa Ayu. Thus allowing Dewa Ayu to increase the family’s income for covering the family’s essentials especially the children’s education.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Dewa Ayu Rai Arti adalah seorang Ibu yang kesehariannya menjaga warungnya yang berada dirumahnya sendiri. Dari hasil penjualan warungnya belumlah cukup untuk membiayai kehidupan keluarganya yang semakin hari semakin meningkat. Sebagai seorang wanita yang ingin meningkatkan kesejahteraan keluarganya, ia ingin membuka usaha lain lagi. Dewa ayu bersama suaminya Dewa Adnyana memutuskan uantuk memelihara babi. Dengan bantuan pinjaman modal dan pelatihan dari DINARI, dia membeli seekor induk babi dan juga untuk membeli pakan ternak. Dari seekor induk babi yang dipelihara 6 bulan bisa melahirkan 10 ekor anak babi yang nanti dapat dijual dengan harga Rp. 250. 000.- / ekor. Dalam 6 bulan Dewa Ayu mendapat penjualan anak babi sebesar Rp. 2.500. 000.- Jadi Dewa Ayu Rai Arti mendapat peningkatan pendapatan sebesar Rp. 370.000.- / Bulan. Sehingga dengaan demikian Dewa Ayu dapat meningkatkan penghasilan keluarga untuk membiayai kebutuhan keluarga terutama untuk biaya sekolah anaknya.

loans.use: Purchase feed, supplies and mother pig (Membeli pakan ternak dan induk babi)

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
Tahir S. is a 34-year-old farmer who sells dairy products. He is a local farmer and lives with his wife in the southern region of Imishli. He has seven years of experience in selling milk, and making and selling yogurt. He likes his job and is very polite with every purchaser. Sometimes orders for dairy products are very high, like for 10-15 liters of milk. However Tahir's one cow gives only 5 liters of milk in a day.
