Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling furniture in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 21 years and also earns an income from her sari-sari (variety) store. Ligaya has been sustaining her businesses through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF.

Ligaya is requesting a loan of 19,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase more furniture to sell. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase furniture to sell

loans.name: Deogratious

texts.en:
Deogratious is 22 years old and married with two children, age 5 and  2 years old. They are living in a rented house in Hioma, Uganda. He is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after the family, and his dream is to build a house in the next five years. 

For five years, Deogratious has been dealing in the textile business. He started with 500,000 UGX. 

He faces a challenge of defaulting payment by credit customers but he hopes to expand his business to a wholesale status. Deogratious needs the loan to buy clothes to resell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: La Presa 1 Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama “LA PRESA 1” y se ubica en el Estado de México; el municipio se distingue por las bellas fiestas del pueblo por su gente trabajadora y emprendedora, por sus grandes campos verdes y la humildad en cada uno de sus habitantes. El grupo esta conformado por nueve integrantes. La señora Luz es la presidenta del grupo. Inició su negocio hace 5 años, el cual consiste en vender ropa y zapatos por catálogo, requiere el prestamo para comprar zapatos y ropa de distintas tallas, modelos y colores que le solicitan sus clientas, ya que le hacen grandes pedidos y aveces no tiene para dinero suficiente para surtir su negocio. Ella tiene 42 años, estudió hasta la primaria, en el pueblo se ha distinguido por ser una persona con muchas ganas de trabajar, siempre con el deseo de brindarle lo mejor a su familia cada dia, vive felizmente casada con uno de sus hijos 19 años de edad. Con las ganancias que obtenga quiere ahorrar para poder seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y no sentirse presionada con los siguientes pedidos que le hagan.
texts.en:
This group is called “La Presa 1” (The Dam 1) and is located in the State of México.  The town is noted for its beautiful festivals, for its hardworking, enterprising residents, for its vast, green fields and for the humility of each of its inhabitants.  The group has nine members.

Luz is group President.  She started her business five years ago consisting in catalogue clothing and shoe sales.  She needs a loan to buy shoes and clothes in various sizes, styles and colors that her customers request from her because they place large orders and sometimes she does not have enough money to stock her business.  

She is 42 years old and went up to elementary school.  She stands out in town for being a person with a strong will to work, always wanting to provide her family with the best every day.  She lives happily married and with one of her children who is 19 years old.  She will use profits obtained to save up to continue to reinvest in her business so as not to feel pressured by the next orders she gets.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes in various sizes, styles and colors.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 53-year-old single mother who runs a cafe. Her business has been in operation for the last ten years. She has been a KADET client before--this is her second loan to finance her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase potatoes, onions, tomatoes, rice, and flour. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to expand her business further. Janet's dream is to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: purchase potatoes, onions, tomatoes, rice, and flour

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with four children, two of whom attend school while two are still too young for school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over ten years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Mwanasha dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of beans, maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of beans, maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Jaka

texts.en:
Jaka is 39 years old and lives in Bardnersville.  She ended her education in the 9th grade.  She is married and has children between 5 to 15 years old in school who live with her at home.

For the past three years, Jaka has been selling hair and clothes.  She is requesting a loan to purchase hair and clothes for her business. The problem she is facing with her business is a shortage of goods.  She started this business with money that her husband gave her, and she learned the business from a friend.  Jaka enjoys her business because of the way that people respond to it, and because of how fast it is growing.  She plans to expand her business, send her children to school, and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase hair and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben, 22 years old, is a single and hard working man. He has practiced livestock farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years. He was introduced to KADET LTD. by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy sheep, which he will sell later.

In the future, Reuben hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy sheep, which he will rear and sell later.

loans.name: Mwiala Shg Group

texts.en:
Moses is the facilitator of the Mwiala group. Moses and his group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Moses and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance. 

Moses takes care of one child at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to enjoy the best prices of One Acre Fund and to have additional maize profits to educate his child and ensure food security for his family. In the 2011 season, Moses had a very good maize yield harvesting nine bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Moses was only able to harvest three bags of maize on ½ acre of land. 

With income from maize sales, Moses will invest in animal rearing and save for future use. 

In 2012, the members of Mwiala group will each plant between ½ and one acre of maize.

In the photograph Moses is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: C5670Umucyo Group

texts.en:
Ancille is 51 years old and is a widow. She has six children between the ages of 4 and 16 years. Ancille is the president of a group called “Umucyo.” She is the first person on the left side of the photo. Ancille sells bananas, and has been working for two years.

Ancille and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more bananas. With the profits from this loan, Ancille and her team would like to satisfy the basic needs of their families, and start saving for their children.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas.

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham is a 39-year-old married mother of  three sons and three daughters; her husband and one of her daughters are workers with decent salaries. Ilham, who sells gas canisters to earn income, wants to improve her business and income by purchasing more canisters for sale. She is therefore requesting a loan, to be repaid on a monthly basis, of $2,000 from FATEN, to make the purchase. The additional resulting income will enable Ilham to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more gas canisters for sale.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine, a 29-year-old single mother of one child, lives in Talic, Oroquieta City where she has a balut-vending business that earns her approximately PHP 5,000 each month.  A member of PMPC for a year, she has a requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase raw ingredients to make balut. Geraldine, a good daughter and an honest person, hopes to earn a substantial income in the future to help her parents

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her balut-making.

loans.name: Susy

texts.es:
Susy de 33 años es una madre soltera luchadora. Tiene una hija de 13 años, la que se encuentra en la ciudad de Lima estudiando. Susy vive en la casa de sus padres en el distrito de Tapo -Tarma. Susy cuenta con terrenos propios de cultivo, en ellos siembra con la ayuda de personal al que contrata: papas, arvejas, habas y zanahorias, productos que vende en el mercado mayorista de Tarma.
Esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres y tíos, a quienes vio desde niña trabajar la tierra.
“Me conviene sembrar de todo, con cada uno de obtengo buen dinero, especialmente con la papa y las arvejas”, comenta. De esa manera ella puede mandar cierto dinero cada mes a su hija y apoyar en la mantención del hogar de sus padres. En todo su tiempo de agricultora, su principal problema, para continuar sembrando ha sido la falta de capital, por ello se limitaba a cultivar una pequeña cantidad de verduras. Susy manejó esta situación con el apoyo de familiares y préstamos. Esta madre espera, ahorrar el dinero suficiente para viajar a Lima y residir ahí, al lado de su hija y sin descuidar a sus padres. Este sería su préstamo número 8 de MFP, entidad de la que siente agradecido por el apoyo en todo este tiempo, por esa razón se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. En cuanto a su banco comunal, menciona sentirse a gusto al lado de compañeros que comparten los mismos intereses.
Con el dinero del crédito comprará semillas de arvejas con 800 soles, con lo restante adquirirá abono de granja.
texts.en:
33-year-old Susy is a tenacious single mother.  She has a 13-year-old daughter who is in the city of Lima studying.  Susy lives in her parents' home in Tapo-Tarma district.  She owns her own farmland where she grows crops with the help of staff who she hires.  She grows potatoes, peas, beans and carrots and sells her crops in the wholesale market in Tarma.  Susy learned this business from her parents, aunts and uncles, who she watched working the land since she was a young girl.  "I grow a bit of everything.  Everything I grow makes me good money, especially the potatoes and peas" she comments.  In this way, she is able to send a certain amount of money each month to her daughter and help support her parents in providing for the household.  In all the time she has been a farmer, Susy's main problem in continuing to work has been a lack of capital.  For this reason, she limited herself to growing a small quantity of vegetables.  She handled this situation with the support of family members and loans.  This mother hopes to save up enough money to travel to Lima and live there alongside her daughter, without neglecting her parents.

This will be Susy's eighth loan from MFP, to whom she feels grateful for the support they have given her.  For this reason, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  WIth her loan money, Susy will buy pea seeds for 800 soles and she will use the rest to obtain barnyard manure.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and pea seeds

loans.name: Roberto Santiago

texts.es:
Roberto Santiago tiene 45 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 4 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 9, 7, 4 y cuatro meses de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

La VRC ALAS DE CRISTO  se encuentra ubicada en las calles sucre y Ernesto Briones, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Comerciales en General.

Roberto se dedica a realizar conecciones eléctricas hace 15 años, las compras de los materiales que necesita lo realiza en los almacenes eléctricos y las instalaciones lo realiza donde le pidan. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar materiales para poder realizar las instalaciones.

Con la ayuda del crédito obtendría un beneficio económico. El sueño es poder comprar unas bóvedas en el cementerio.

 No se le han presentado ningún tipo de inconveniente.En los tiempos libres le gusta realizar trabajos.
texts.en:
Roberto Santiago is 45 years old and lives with his common-law wife and four children, ages nine, seven, four, and four months.  They live in the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank ALAS DE CRISTO is located on Sucre and Ernesto Briones Streets and belongs to the Ventanas Canton.  In general, the members are merchants.

Roberto has been in business installing electrical wiring for 15 years.  He buys the supplies he needs at the electric materials warehouses and carries out installations where asked to do so.

He is requesting a loan to buy materials to do his job.  The loan will benefit his economic situation.  His dream is to buy a mausoleum in the cemetary.  He has not run into any inconveniences.  In his free time he enjoys doing what he does at work.

loans.use: To buy materials for work.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, a married mother of one, lives in Changamwe, Kenya. She owns a salon which she started with her personal savings. The business has been in operation for the last one year. 
She is applying for a loan of Ksh 30,000 to purchase hair pieces, weaves and cosmetics for her business. 
Margaret looks forward to owning other salons in future. The main challenge she faces is that some customers like to obtain services on credit and take long to pay.
She will use the extra income to open other businesses.

loans.use: To purchase hair pieces, weaves and cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Livingston

texts.en:
Livingston is 50 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kamala region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past seven years, Livingston has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Livingston has requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar and soap for resale and will help Livingston to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Livingston hopes that in the future he will be able to open up a wholesale shop. 

Livingston is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Livingston who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and soap

loans.name: Villa Primaveral Group

texts.es:
El comité "Villa Primaveral" en un grupo antiguo dentro de la fundación, están en decimo ciclo del programa. El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar en equipo, fomentar el espíritu solidario y mantener la unidad en el grupo. Mediante el programa de comités muchas señoras lograron iniciar y aumentar sus actividades, valoran la importancia de estar en comité, conocer gente nueva, cosechar amistades y tener fuente de trabajo digno, mejorar la educación de sus hijos mediante las capacitaciones brindada por el programa.
Margarita es una de estas mujeres, quien comenta que desde tempranas horas del día empieza a trabajar. Ella se dedica a la venta de alimentos y cuenta que le va muy bien, pues ella tiene muy buena mano para las comidas, es por ello que ya tiene una buena clientela que le solicita sus platillos y es por ello que tiene buenos ingresos.
Ella solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva para poder comprar carnes, condimentos, hortalizas y demás insumos para poder elaborar las comidas que vende. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad de progreso que se le está dando.
texts.en:
The “Villa Primaveral” Communal Bank is a long-time group within the Fundación. Its members are in their tenth loan cycle in the program. The objective of each one of them is to work as a team, promote a feeling of solidarity and maintain group unity. Through the training provided by the program, many of the women succeed in starting and expanding their businesses and they value the importance of being in the bank: they meet new people, create friendships and have a source of dignified work which enables them to improve the educational opportunities of their children.

Margarita is one of these women. She notes that she starts working in the very early hours of the morning. She sells food and says that it is going very well since she is a very good cook and she already has a good clientele who request her dishes. Consequently she makes a good income. 

She is requesting the help of the Fundación and Kiva so that she can buy meat, condiments, vegetables and other products in order to make the meals that she sells. She is grateful for this new opportunity to progress that is being given to her.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables and other products.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: With the launch of her contemporary art gallery, Jessica, a practicing freelance lawyer, was able to see her lifelong dream come true. Jessica has always had a passion for all types of art and has worked very hard to put herself in a position to transform this passion into a sustainable life. Located in an artsy district of New York City, her gallery is very diverse. It offers original pieces in paintings, drawings, limited edition photographs, and mixed media. The gallery is also very diverse in the services that it offers. Not only can customer’s purchase art in the store and on arttogift.com, but she also offers art rental and art consultations for inexperienced buyers looking to learn. Working two full time jobs though has proven to be strenuous. Jessica would like this loan to help her attend more art fairs to further promote her gallery. She would like to continue the growth of her business and one day get to a point where it is a sustainable source of revenue and she can narrow her focus to only operating the gallery.

loans.use: to attend art fairs and publicize her gallery

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Lan is 33 years old. She has two children whom are studying at school. She raises pigs and be a worker in a factory for a living. She gets from her jobs 3,800,000 VND per month. She has taken part in crediting program of SEDA from 2011. The last cycle, she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 6,944,000 VND to upgrade her pigsty and buy food for pigs. Then she hopes the benefit would be afforded enough for rebuilding her house.

loans.use: to upgrade her pigsty and buy food for pigs. Then she hopes the benefit would be afforded enough for rebuilding her house.

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Enyonam is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling "wakye" (a traditional Ghanaian dish made primarily from beans, rice, and colored leaves). She usually sells her wakye in Wegbe (near Hohoe). She has been involved in preparing and selling wakye for four years. Enyonam is married and has one child. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. Enyonam wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of rice, gallons of oil, beans, and cartons of meat and chicken, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty wakye. In the long term, Enyonam plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of rice, gallons of oil, beans, and cartons of meat and chicken thus increasing her current inventory levels

loans.name: Bahry

texts.en: Bahry was born in 1965 year. She is sociable woman. Bahry is married and has adult children. She has been busy with selling milk products more than 20 years. She sells milk products in a local market. Bahry has additional income from growing agricultural products. Her husband helps her with managing business. Bahry has a great experience in this field and runs her business well. She always tries to find the new ways of developing business. Now, she needs to fridge for her business. She must keep milk products in a fridge. With this aim she is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy fridge. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy fridge for her milk sales business

loans.name: 65 Minh Hùng Minh Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phơ works in agriculture farming poultry . She is requesting a loan to puchase more poultry to raise and sell in future

Phơ is 53 years old and she is married with 4 children.
She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 65 Minh Hùng Minh Lộc solidarity group. 

In 2011, Phơ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Phơ has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Phơ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Phơ hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to puchase more poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina 35 years old, supports a family of 5 members. 

She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 20 years earning an income of KES 13,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. 

Her hope is to lead a stable life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina lives in Buza area, on the outskirts of Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children and she sells maize flour to food vendors. She prepares the flour by herself and she buys the maize in retail, sends it to the milling machine and packs the product in packets of 5-10 kilogrammes.

She also sells by-product as animal feed. She is planning to increase her stock of maize as she is often faced with stockouts. To meet her planned target she is need of USD 400.

loans.use: Wprking Capital

loans.name: Anisa

texts.en:
Anisa is 37 years old and a mother of 4 children. They live in district 3 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Anisa has a shared business with her son. They sell corn in the bazaar. Due to a lack of ingredients, she took a loan from AFSG to buy corn, ghee, gas, plastic, salt, etc.

Anisa prepares the ingredients for her son and then her son sells them in the bazaar. Through this process they can cover their family expenses.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Silvia Nelly

texts.en:
Silvia Nelly is married with six children, two of which are married, two are working and her two youngest daughters are still in school. Her husband Alfredo runs a machine shop from their home, but they don’t have a steady income. It was difficult at times to cover all of their expenses, so 17 years ago Silvia decided to earn another income and has since been preparing and selling Mexican sweets and fixed-price dishes.

Silvia only wants the best for her family. Her love for her children has motivated her to keep her business growing for so long. Currently she needs a $275 loan to purchase ingredients necessary for the meals she prepares because she would like to offer her clients a wider variety of dishes. Play a key role in this business and in Silvia's life. She and her family truly appreciate your help.

La señora Silvia Nelly, es casada y tiene 6 hijos, de los cuales 2 están casados, 2 trabajando y sus dos hijas más pequeñas aún estudian. Alfredo, su esposo, tiene un taller mecánico en su propio domicilio, por lo que en no tiene un ingreso fijo y en ocasiones era difícil solventar todos los gastos, por la necesidad de un ingreso extra, hace 17 años Silvia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de antojitos mexicanos y comidas corridas.

Silvia sólo busca lo mejor para su familia, el amor hacia sus hijos la ha motivado todo este tiempo a continuar con su negocio y hacerlo crecer, ahora necesita de un préstamo por $ 275 dólares que utilizará en la compra de los insumos que requiere para la elaboración de sus comidas, porque quiere ofrecer una mayor variedad de platillos a sus clientes. Se parte fundamental en el negocio y la vida de Silvia, ella y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use:
To purchase ingredients

compra de insumos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy his merchandise in bulk

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
Sona A. is a 59-year-old married woman who owns a milk products business in the small, southern village of Varkhankend, near Saatli region. She has five children. Sona has twelve years of experience in selling milk products. Dairy products are in high demand all across Azerbaijan and people use yoghurt and milk every day. They think it is very healthy and tasty at the same time.

Sona and her husband work very hard to cover all their family needs. But now the children are growing up and life has become much more difficult. Sona decided to improve her living conditions and purchase one milk cow and one calf for meat production. The estimated cost for a cow is 700-800 USD and for a calf is 200-300 USD.

loans.use: Purchase one milk cow and one calf

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a display case and merchandise

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en: Mahammad is a 47-year-old farmer who raises livestock for sale. He lives in Varkhand village of the Saatli region with his wife and has 4 children. He started his small business in 1995 when he first borrowed money and purchased calves for meat. It brought good income and helped to cover his family needs. But still his poverty has pushed him to broaden his business by purchasing additional calves and a milk cow. For this purpose he applied for 1200 USD. This amount will buy one milk cow for 700 USD and 2 additional calves.

loans.use: Going to purchase one milk cow and two calves

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is married. She lives in Zaporozhye and works in the local Krytyi market selling women’s terrycloth bathrobes as well as blankets and pillows. She rents a vending spot in a nice, busy location which is attractive for customers passing by her kiosk. Antonina has been in this business for 6 years. Presently, she has about US$ 1600 in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about US$ 300.

Antonina admits that she needs financial assistance to increase her wholesale purchase amounts. She is requesting a loan of $400 to increase her turnover capital. Antonina believes that good sales will help her earn more and better provide for her family’s needs. She is hoping to continue to develop her business and add new inventory items to her assortment of merchandise.

loans.use: To expand her business this Christmas season by purchasing wholesale

loans.name: Virtudes

texts.en: Virtudes is a 39 year old mother of three. Her husband works as truck driver for a local company. Virtudes lives in Casabe, a community of Santo Domingo. She earns a living running a business that is very unusual in her community; she lends money to women in the neighbourhood, charging them some interest. She has been running this business for more than ten years. Virtudes is employed in a local shop, and every month,  when she gets her salary, she puts aside some money to invest in the business. Her husband also helps with this business by contributing some of his wages. Virtudes says there are a lot of people who visit her house to use the services. She explains that she offers very low interest rates to the customers. The entrepreneur has requested a loan to continue with her activity.

loans.use: to invest in a small money-lending business.

loans.name: Almuhammad

texts.ru:
Almuhammad Ergashevich A. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 42 years old and is married with 6 children. He has a specialized secondary education. His is a driver by profession. He is also engaged in animal husbandry which allows him to provide for his family. He buys and fattens calves for 45 days and then resells them at the local market. He has been working in this field for over 20 years. He wants to purchase a calf with the proceeds of the loan. He plans to repay his loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Артыков Алмухаммад Эргашевич проживает в районе Рудаки . Возраст 42 года, женат имеет 6 детей. Образование средне-специальное. По специальности водитель. Занимается животноводством, что позволяет ему обеспечивать свою семью. Покупает и откармливает бычков в течении 45 дней , продает на местном рынке . .Опыт в этой сфере имеет свыше 20 лет .Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцкв .

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Mrs. Touch Thy, 48, earns $2.50 per day as a grocer and farmer. Her husband, Mr. Nov M., is also a farmer and makes $1.25 per day. They live with their 8 children in Banteaydey Krom Village, Pursat Province. Four of their children are married. One is a farmer and grocer, and another makes marble statues. M. requests a loan of $600 to purchase marble for his children to carve and sell statues. He hopes this loan will help increase his family’s income. The photo is of his children because Mrs. Touch Thy and Mr. Nov M. were not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase marble for his children to carve and sell statues

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi H., 54 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 1999. Her main activities are to breed the pigs and grow pot plants while her husband and her children make gloves. Her family average income is approximately 200 USD/month. Since the beginning of this year, price for everything goes up. Therefore, Mrs. H. wants to borrow money to expand her farms. Her suggested amount of money is 575 USD. She intends to repair the pigsty, improve the farm and buy 6-7 more pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Hường, 54 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1999. Công việc chủ yếu của chị Hường là chăn nuôi lợn và trồng cây cảnh còn chồng và các con chị may găng tay. Thu nhập bình quân của cả gia đình trên dưới 200USD/tháng. Sang năm nay, giá cả hàng hóa đắt đỏ, chị Hường mong muốn được vay thêm vốn mở rộng đầu tư tăng thu nhập. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị Hường là 575USD. Dự định của chị là sẽ sửa sang lại chuồng trại và mua 6-7 con lợn giống.

loans.use: Buy pigs and improve farm

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina B. is a 55 year old lady. Her husband's name is D. A., who is 10 years older than her. Sakina is a housewife. Her husband runs a small canteen-like hotel. Therefore Sakina B. applies for a loan for her husband so that he would be able to increase his profit from his canteen.

She has been joined in her loan group by a few more members: Azmin B. who wants a loan to buy buffalo. Razia B. wants a loan to buy goats. Amina B. wants a loan to buy a piece of land. Razia B. wants a loan for her milk business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Iris Suyapa's Group

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Iris A. me dedico a la venta de tacos de res y de pollo, tambien frabrico charamuscas y paletas de fruta, tengo la ayuda de mi esposo para salir adelante con nuestro hogar, el se dedica a la carpinteria, pero tambien vende mercaderia, nuestras hijas estan en la escuela, tengp 5 años de dedicarme a esta actividad, pero en estos momentos necesito un credito para poder tener mas produccion y asi vender mas, para generar mayores ganancias, ya que la situacion esta muy dificil.

loans.use: compra de tortillas, carne, pollo, bolsas, paletas, salsas, chiles, verduras

loans.name: Sedika

texts.en:
Sedika is a 46 year old woman from Puracić, located near the town Lukavac. She is married with one son, who is pictured here and will be entering the 5th grade next year. While her husband is employed, he was recently injured and is temporarily on sick leave. He receives some compensation while he misses work, but not his full monthly salary.

This is Sedika’s first loan with Žene za Žene, and she has requested 1200 KM. She will use this loan to buy land where she can cultivate strawberries. Sedika already has a small stretch of land where she grows strawberries currently, but she wants to plant and grow more on a regular basis. However she doesn’t want to rent land, as she believes that renting will be a waste of money in the long run. Sedika hopes that using this loan to buy more land will be a good investment for her and her family’s future.

loans.use: To buy a new field for planting and growing strawberries.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene started her own business after her divorce because the family income diminished, so she needed to find a way to cover the household expenses and raise her 3 children. She started out in 1997 working at a relative’s restaurant. In 2000, she decided to set up her own stand to sell gorditas (small, thick, corn flour tortillas), and her daughters started to help her prepare the stews and serve the customers in their spare time.

She needs a loan of $600.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to remodel the business space with paint and furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Irene inició el negocio cuando se divorcio, los ingresos familiares disminuyeron, y tuvo que buscar la forma de solventar los gastos de la casa y de sus 3 hijos, comenzó en 1997, trabajando como empleada familiar en un negocio de comida de un familiar. En el 2000, se decidió a poner su puesto de gorditas y sus hijas empezaron a trabajar y en su horario libre le ayudan con los guisos y en atención a clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar el local con pintura y compra mobiliario.

loans.use: Remodel business space

loans.name: Thorng

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorng K., age 26, is married with one little child. She works with her husband farming rice and raising a few pigs, making collectively about $2.50 of income each day. However, growing rice is not a good option and the income is not nearely enough to cover her entire family's expenses. The inflation rate is out of control, so the price of goods has increased as well. 

In order to maintain her living condition, Mrs. Thorng K. has applied for a loan of $1000 to purchase more piglets and cows to breed. She will be able to sell them for profit in about six to seven months. 

Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Thorng K. wa not available.

loans.use: To buy piglets and cows to breed

loans.name: Gerardina

texts.en:
Gerardina B. D. H. is a member of the community bank, Fe, which means "Faith" in Spanish. She, her husband, and their four children live in Ayacucho. At the open market where residents and visitors of Ayacucho come to purchase a variety of items, you can find Gerardina selling various meats.

Her loan of 750 soles ($250 USD) will be used to buy more meat including chicken and pork and also to buy wine. Gerardina's goal for her business is to maintain her business and continue working until she no longer able to work.

loans.use: To buy meat and wine

loans.name: Abdujabbor

texts.en:
G. Abdujabbor has worked on his farm for his entire life, and now lives there with his wife and three children. He relies completely on his crop of potatoes and vegetables to feed his family, because those are the only things that will grow on his land. 

Abdujabbor was born and raised in Shahristan and learned to farm vegetables from his father. Today, his children help him with his business. Because he has a large family, Abdujabbor has applied for a loan of $600 to help buy fertilizer and sacks in which to store his crop. This amount would help him accomplish his goals in a short time. Your generosity can help change his life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and potato sacks

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios and her husband work together as farmers. Their marriage has been blessed with six children, two sons and four daughters. Their children are: Martha, 34 years old, a high school graduate; Berth, 28 years old, a high school graduate; Maricel, 24 years old, a high school graduate; Mary Rose, 18 years old, also a high school graduate; Romy, a third year high school student; and Shena Mae, 11 years old and a 1st year high school student. Four of their children are already married. They have three grandchildren. Their family happily lives in Barangay Rizal Quirino, Isabela. Here, people are united in their work for their community and for their families.

Aside from farming, Remedios and her husband also raise two hogs and vend cogon (a native grass). The couple is doing everything they can to earn a living.

In order to avoid asking for credit from traders, Remedios would like to take this opportunity to request a loan of PHP 13,000. This will provide for their farm and help to maintain their hog raising business.

Remedios said that they must work hard in order to improve their lives.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Pisa

texts.en: Pisa O. V., 50, is married with five children.  She has many years of experience in the farming business. She sells to the villagers and to the general public three days per week. She has three previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 4 Tala (about US$1).  SPBD loans are Pisa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase Gromoxone, sting, chemicals, bush knives, and seedlings

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Шарофат получает кредит второй раз , она получала кредит для приобретения скота (коров). Ее сыновья собираются в Россию на заработки. Сейчас скот подешевел, поэтому ей не хочется продавать скот, через несколько месяцев скот будет стоить дорого и она продаст по хорошей цене. Она получает деньги на билеты сыновьям, расплачиваться будет продажей молоком и другими кисломолочными изделиями.
texts.en:
This is the second time Sharofat will be receiving a loan. The first time, she needed the money to purchase cows. Now, her sons are leaving to seek work in Russia. The prices for cattle have now decreased, and Sharofat would rather not sell it now, but instead wait a few months, until the prices go up again. This loan will be used to pay for her sons' travel. Sharofat will repay the money using the profits from sales of milk and milk products.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Consumer credit

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia A. sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, bringing them home for processing and preservation, and then sending them to the market for sale. Felicia has received junior high school education. She is married and has 2 children; her husband is a fisherman.

Felicia has been selling fish since 2002. She is responsible for paying housekeeping expenses since her husband takes care of the family’s other financial needs. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards a house she wants to put up for her children with her husband.

loans.use: increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en:
Vasil is married. He owns a retail business in Belaya Tserkov and sells various home products at the local market. He has been in this business for 16 years already. He tried selling various types of products and finally setled on this one. Vasil is a hard-working and persistent person. These character traits have helped him to develop his business and make it a stable source of income.

Vasil would like to get a loan of 5,000 UAH to increase his inventory and offer his customers an even bigger variety of goods. His business goal is to make enough money to help his children and grandchildren as well as fix up his property and plant a nice fruit garden.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of  his shop

loans.name: Mireille

texts.fr:
O. Mireille est née le 16/01/1982 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du BENIN. Mireille est originaire de TAKON dans le département de PLATEAU. Mireille est célibataire sans enfant. Mireille est titulaire du baccalauréat et vit chez sa maman à Agongbomey, un quartier de Cotonou.  Mireille est dans le commerce des cartes de recharge téléphonique.Mireille gère en plus de cela deux combines téléphoniques. L'activité de Mireille est très florissante et nécessite plus de moyens financiers qu'elle n'en a. En effet, Mireille envisage acheter d'autres appareils téléphoniques afin d'ouvrir des cabines téléphoniques dans d'autres quartiers de la ville de Cotonou. C'est pour cette raison que Mireille sollicite un quatrième crédit à ALIDé pour satisfaire sa clientèle.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Mireille O. was born on January 16, 1982 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Mireille's roots are in Takon, in the Plateau province. Mireille is single and has no children. She has her "bacc." (advanced high school diploma) and lives with her mother in Agongbomey, a district of Cotonou. Mireille sells rechargeable phone cards and she also manages two public telephones. Her business is flourishing and necessitates increased working capital that she doesn't have. In fact, Mireille is hoping to buy more telephones so as to have telephone booths in other sections of the city of Cotonou. For this reason, Mireille is requesting her fourth loan from ALIDé so as to satisfy her clientele. The significance of ALIDé in the local language of Benin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor". Benin is a small country in West Africa next door to Nigeria, where the GNP is about $1,500 per year. ALIDé offers special loans at 0% interest to very vulnerable individuals and is part of a group which will soon begin a program of small scale health insurance for recipients of micro-credit.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of rechargeable telephone cards and two public telephones

loans.name: Bunmi

texts.en: Bunmi O. is 43-years old and married with three children. Bunmi sells medicines and provisions. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more medicines and provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines and provisions to sell

loans.name: Moussiliatou

texts.fr:
D. G.  Moussiliatou est née le 04/08/1971 à Parakou, la plus grande ville du Nord du Bénin, dans le département du Borgou. Moussiliatou est mariée à AGOUNDO Abel chauffeur de profession. Moussiliatou est mère d’un seul garçon du nom de Orace qui est en quatrième année du cours primaire. Moussiliatou est maîtresse couturière et a ouvert depuis cinq (5) ans son atelier de couture au quartier Ayélawadjè à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Moussiliatou a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits à ALIDé pour vendre des articles de mercerie. Moussiliatou a très bien remboursé ces trois crédits et a également réussi à développer son commerce de vente d’articles de mercerie avec. Toutefois, Moussiliatou n’a pas encore tous les articles de mercerie que sa clientèle lui demande. Moussiliatou veut aussi s'approvisionner en gros désormais. Alors Moussiliatou pour satisfaire la demande de ses clients et arriver à faire plus de profit, sollicite un quatrième crédit de ALIDé. 


 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Moussiliatou D. G. was born on 4 August 1971 in Parakou, the largest city in the north of Benin, in the department of Borgou. Moussiliatou is married to Abel Agoundo, a driver by profession. Moussiliatou is the mother of one boy named Orace, who is in his fourth year of primary school. Moussiliatou is a master dressmaker and, 5 years ago, opened her own sewing shop in the Ayélawadjè district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Moussiliatou has already benefited from three previous loans through ALIDE to sell haberdashery items. Moussiliatou repaid all these three loans perfectly and successfully developed her business of selling haberdashery items through these loans. However, Moussiliatou does not yet have all the items which her clientele asks for. Moussiliatou would also like to supply herself in bulk from now on. Thus, to satisfy the demands of her clientele and to make a bigger profit, Moussiliatou is seeking her fourth loan through ALIDE. The meaning of ALIDE in Fon, the local language of Benin, is "there is always a way for the poorest." Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, and its annual per capita income is $1,500.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dressmaking supplies in bulk

loans.name: Annonciathe

texts.en:
Greetings from M. Annonciatha, a 34-year-old married woman with five children, ages 1, 6, 7, 9, and 11. She lives in the Nyarugenge district of the city of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.

Mrs. M. owns a shop that offers a variety of different kinds of merchandise. At present, her husband does not earn any income. She earns a monthly proft of about $458. She has 10 years of experience in this business and has no employees. She generally starts working at 6 a.m. every morning and closes at 10 p.m. nightly.

This entrepreneur is seeking a loan in the amount of 500,000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company. With this loan, Annonciata will buy more merchandise to increase her store's offerings.

Mrs. M. plans to reinvest the increased profit back into her business.

loans.use: To increase her store's offerings and to reinvest in her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Work capital (to purchase disinfectants, soaps, cleaning gel, and detergents).

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is 56 years old and lives with her husband in Saida, southern Lebanon. She has owned a grocery store for nine years. Fatmeh requested a loan of $1500 USD from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase merchandise and an ice-cream refrigerator for her store. This is her third loan cycle and she has always paid on time.

Fatmeh is successful in her work because she knows how to treat her customers, who are family members, friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t have a lot of cash. Fatmeh set up her grocery store because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and an ice-cream refrigerator for her store

loans.name: Lowela

texts.en:
Lowela O. is from the village of Quiboro, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 25 years old. Lowela is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lowela owns and operates a business venture in the service sector. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transport services with the help of their motor vehicle in the local community. Lowela has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lowela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lowela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Lowela is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used partly for repair and maintenance; a portion of it will be used for venturing into a food sector business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Lowela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: a portion for repair and maintenance of motor vehicle and the other portion to start up a food business

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya V. is divorced with 4 kids. Her family is bigger than the average Ukrainian family which has made it hard for her to provide for her family. Mariya started her business only two years ago when she saw an opportunity and decided to fill the niche. Today she runs her small sweets and pastry sales business in one of the local markets in Drogobych. She has about 30,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her gross income is about 10,000 Grivnyas a month.  

Mariya is seeking a loan of 13,500 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise for further retail sale. She has proved to be a hard-working and friendly entrepreneur who knows how to best serve her customers and keep her business running effectively. Mariya has a good credit history.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise.

loans.name: Bethel Group

texts.en:
George is 44 years old. He is married and the father of four children. All his children are currently in school in the community where they live. He is a trader who buys and sells cutlasses. He purchases cutlasses in bulk from Accra, sharpens them, and retails them to the farming communities to weed their farms. He has been in this business for sixteen years now and has lots of experience. He requests the loan to buy a bulk supply of cutlasses in order to meet the demand of the farming communities.

George is the leader of a trust bank group called Bethel. In the group photograph, he is the man who is seated. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, etc. In this group, the individual members act as a form of social collateral, which creates peer pressure amongst the members to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of cutlasses and a sharpening machine

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
58-year-old Gloria L. owns a small rice field in her village. She has six children, the oldest of whom is 39 years old. They do not live with her any more. Her husband left her when her children were still young. Now she pays laborers and workers to till her rice field so she can provide food, clothing and other basic needs for her household.

She would like to request a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to finance her farm and to pay her workers for preparing the land and make it ready for planting.

“In CEVI, the monthly payment is easy to repay because it has only a 2% interest rate” she said.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Mary Ann S

texts.en:
Mary Ann S B. is from the town of Katipunan, Guipos,Zambo.del Sur. She is 30 years old. Mary Ann S is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Mary Ann S owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Mary Ann S has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mary Ann S joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann S has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Mary Ann S is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Mary Ann S from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Samwel Okoth

texts.en:
Samwel A. is 45 years old, married and he has two children. He operates a blacksmith business at Ngara street in Eldoret town.

He was introduced to KADET by a group member. Samwel has applied for a loan which she intends to use to improve his metal business by buying tools which include a new plate for his machine, welding rods, angle irons and square tubes. 

In future he intends to diversify to selling ready made goods and also be able to educate his children.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Buying more tools for his business

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza P., who is 38 years old, is a rice farmer. She owns a 1-hectare farm that she hopes will provide her family enough income to buy adequate food, clothing and other basic needs. She has three children. Her eldest is only 14. She wishes that someday she could buy more farms so as to be able to support all the family's needs.  

She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farming necessities to grow her rice to harvest. With this loan, she doesn’t need to apply for a loan from loan sharks, who charge high interest rates.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Mr. Leonardo R. is 35 years old and married to Maria Nela who is also 35 years old. Leonardo is from Camarunggayan, Aurora, Isabela. The couple is blessed with two angels namely: Bea Lobel and Lea Loreine. Bea Lobel is seven years old and Lea Loreine is only five years of age.

Leonardo wants to help his wife because of their living conditions. He wants to improve their living conditions while he is still young and strong for the welfare of his children. He is also saving for the future education of his two lovely angels.

Leonardo wants to borrow Php 5,000 for the maintenance of his tricycle because it is his main source of income. He’s hoping that the loan he is requesting from Kiva lenders will be considered.

loans.use: To use for the maintenance of his tricycle

loans.name: Sembwi

texts.en: Sembwi N. is 61 years old, is married to N., and they have three children. Sembwi is a farmer and she does the farming on her own piece of land which she has been doing for the last seven years. Sembwi learned about KADET from other women who had already registered as members in KADET and later on she joined. This will be her second loan which she is planning to use to plant potatoes and carrots which normally do well in her area due to good climatic conditions. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to buy dairy cows to supply milk for her family and also to sell to her neighbors to supplement her income. Sembwi’s dream is do large-scale farming and attain financial independence. She is a hardworking woman who is determined to achieve her set goals despite her age. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To plant more potatoes and carrots

loans.name: Destiny

texts.en:
Destiny sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for four years. Her husband is an electrician, and through her grocery business, Destiny has been able to supplement her husband's income in order to meet the basic needs of their family.

Destiny is 35 years old and has three children: they are in nursery and primary school. Destiny is a client of LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization), which is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She hopes to increase her offerings and improve her sales during this festive season.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase groceries to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge is a diligent farmer. He is 35 years old, married and has a 1-year-old child. He plants rice on his farm. He spends most of his time at the farm, making sure it’s free of weeds and other pests. He wants to achieve an abundant harvest so he can earn more. He wants to improve his family’s living conditions and save for his child’s future.

Jorge became a member of the Kiva field partner, CEVI, early this year. He used his first loan to finance his farm. Now he is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP. With this loan, Jorge will be able to buy farm supplies like fertilizers to be used at his farm. He will also be able to pay the laborers who help at the farm.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance M. is 52 years old and married to Samuel, a teacher in Kilifi. They are blessed with seven children. Constance is a business lady and she sells charcoal to customers. She purchases bags of charcoal in wholesale and later sells to the Mnarani residents as a retailer. She has been serving her community well and at the same time generating some profits. She has been in the charcoal business for two years.

This is Constance's second loan. She paid the first one well. With this loan, she intends to purchase more charcoal stock for re-selling.

In the future, Constance hopes to diversify her source of income by opening a food cafeteria.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal stock for to sell to customers

loans.name: Griselda Rosario

texts.es:
Griselda es socia del Banco Comunal Huamanguina.
Griselda es casada, tiene 54 años y 5 hijos, Griselda tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Griselda necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Griselda son que sus hijos se superen y tener salud.
texts.en:
Griselda is a member of the Huamanguina Communal Bank. She's 54 years old, married, and has 5 children. Griselda has a store in her house where she sells groceries, vegetables, and meat every day. Griselda needs a loan of 900 Peruvian soles, money which she will invest in the purchase of rice and sugar. Griselda's dreams are for her children be successful and healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa F. is from the town of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 31 years old. Theresa is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Theresa owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Theresa has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Theresa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Theresa is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Theresa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Edith Sofia

texts.es:
Edith es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Edith es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Edith vende ropa, productos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, además Edith trabaja en un Jardín como auxiliar.
Edith necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chompas, polos.
El sueño de Edith es tener una tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Edith is a member of the Communal Bank Lirio. Twenty-five years old, she is a live-in partner and has one child. Edith sells clothing to friends and relatives and works in a garden as an assistant. Edith needs a loan of $425 to invest in sweaters and Polo shirts. Edith's dream is to have a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sweaters and Polo shirts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair the gear box and general maintenance of his car

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mrs. Kong M., 28 years old, has a rental kiosk inside the local market where she sells fish, vegetables, and some groceries. She is also assisted by her husband in selling groceries. Kong M. has been running her business since 2008 making around US$5 a day. The  couple has been married for many years but have no children. To increase the family's income and to make the business more successful, Kong M. has requested a loan to stock up on groceries, vegetables, and fish to sell. Note: Mrs. Kong M. was busy at her business activity when the photo taken so her husband is shown instead.

loans.use: To stock up on groceries, vegetables, and fish to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay II.
Elena es casada, tiene 69 años y 4 hijos, Elena viaja a las ferias junto a su esposo, en donD. venden ropa variada, actividad que realiza algunos días D. las semana, además Elena por las tardes venD. comida en su casa.
Elena necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. ropa variada.
Los sueños D. Elena son terminar D. construir su casa y construir una casa para cada uno D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the Ollantay II Community Bank. She is 69 years old, married, and has four children. She and her husband travel to markets where they sell clothing a few days a week. Elena also sells food from her house in the afternoons. She needs a loan of S/.3000 to buy more clothing. Her dream is to finish building her house and to build one for each of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Esohe

texts.en:
Esohe is happy with her trade and she has been in this business for long. She sells drinks and sachet water at retail prices to her customers. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase drinks and sachet water to sell.

Esohe is 42 years old and she is married with 5 children.  She lives in Edo State, Nigeria. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and sachet water to sell

loans.name: Love Jesus Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Diana is a 45-year-old woman who describes herself as a good leader.  She is married to a farmer and has 9 children between the ages of 10-26.  Diana would like to provide her children with a university level education.

For the past 4 years, she has made and sold “kenkey.”  “Kenkey,” a traditional Ghanaian food, is a maize-based starchy ball that is usually eaten with pepper and fried fish.  Diana will use the loan to buy 2 bags of maize, 2 cartons of fish, and vegetables. Diana would like to expand her business by providing her “kenkey” to more people in her town as well as neighboring towns.

Diana is currently the leader of the trust bank group called 'Love Jesus'.  There are 6 members in this group. The other group members operate various food processing and trading businesses. They hope to receive the loan to enable them to grow their business and be able to provide more support to their families.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients like maize, fish, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to enlarge his shop

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn S. is from the village of Upper Lamac, Oroquieta City. She is 39 years old. Emelyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Emelyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from cultivating fruit trees and harvesting fruit such as mangoes and avocados for sale. Emelyn has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Emelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Emelyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new equipment and tools. This will be the second loan taken out by Emelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and tools

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Carapeguá en el Barrio San Cayetano se encuentra el formar parte del Programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras. 
Cada una de las integrantes son mujeres muy activas que desean trabajar para salir delante de la mejor manera posible.
 En Carapeguá  una actividad muy común es la artesanía como la preparación de ponchos, hamacas, frazadas de lanas y de otros tipos de hilos, así muchas a de las integrantes se dedican a la artesanía como la señora Luciana quien es artesa.
Ella trabaja en esta actividad hace mucho tiempo, y fabrica los productos con la ayuda de su familia.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos, trapos, colorantes y otros materiales que ella utiliza para la fabricación de sus artesanías.
texts.en:
A group that is participating in the Program of Women Entrepreneurs is located in the neighborhood of San Cayetano in the city of Carapeguá. All of the members are active women who want to work to get ahead in the best way possible.

In Carapeguá a common activity is making crafts such as ponchos, hammocks, wool blankets, and other types of woven products. Many of the members are crafts people, such as Sra. Luciana, who is an artisan. She spends most of her time in this activity and her family helps with making her products. Luciana is requesting a loan to buy thread, cloth, dyes, and other materials that she uses in making her handicrafts.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase thread, cloth, dyes, and other materials

loans.name: Reyna De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Reyna de los Ángeles R. F., vive en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, es casada, de 37 años cuyo esposo labora como chofer, siendo la fuente de ingreso de la economía del hogar, son una familia de 5 hijos  los cuales estudian la primaria y a secundaria.

Ellos son una familia muy humilde que dentro de sus planes a futuro están las remodelaciones de su hogar, la señora se dedica a  la venta de frijoles y es por esta razón que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de granos básicos y abarrotería para aumentar el inventario y elevar los volúmenes de ventas, y que a futuro mejoren poco a poco la economía de esta humilde familia.
texts.en:
Mrs Reyna de los Ángeles R. F. lives in the Juan Ramon Padilla division, is married and 37 years old. Her husband works as a driver, which is the source of income for their family. They are a family with 5 children who study in elementary and high school. They are a very humble family. Part of their plans for the future include remodeling their home. Reyna sells beans, and it is for this reason that she is requesting a loan for the purchase of basic grains and groceries to increase her inventory and volume of sales, and so that in the future she can improve her humble family's economic state bit by bit.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of basic grains and groceries

loans.name: Saimumin

texts.en: Saimumin S. is 31 years old. He is married and has two children. He is a small-business entrepreneur who sells different kinds of detergents, like soap, shampoo, toothpaste, shaving cream and washing powder, and many other foodstuffs in his store. Saimumin is not alone in this business. His wife actively helps him with sales. Today, Saimumin is requesting a loan of $3,000 to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. Saimumin’s main goal is to educate his beloved child so that someday he’ll become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing detergents for increasing the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Glenda Yanett

texts.es: La señora Glenda tiene 35 años, tiene dos hijos a su cargo. Tiene aproximadamente 2 años de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería en general. Ella ofrece sus productos de manera ambulante, pues de esta manera ha logrado obtener los clientes que tiene hasta el momento, pues gracias a la buena administración que ha logrado obtener su negocio sigue activo, pues siempre ha sido una mujer muy luchadora. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de ropa y zapatos, ya que actualmente tiene pedidos que debe cumplir. Su mayor anhelo en el futuro es tener una tienda y se encuentre más estable.
texts.en:
Glenda is 35 years old and has two children to care for. For about two years she has worked selling general merchandise. She offers her products as a traveling vendor, since in this way she has managed to get the customers she now has, and thanks to her good management the business remains active, since she has always been a very determined woman. The loan will be invested in buying clothing and shoes because she currently has orders that she must fill. Her greatest desire for the future is to have a shop and be more stable.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing and shoes

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 39 años, es una madre de familia muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Jaime de 39 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Joel de 18 y Kevin de 16 años, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Desde muy pequeña Carmen aprendió a trabajar en la chacra, fue ahí donde asimiló todos los secretos para lograr un buen cultivo, ahora tiene sus propias tierras, las cuales cultiva y cuida con mucho amor y paciencia. Ella siembra alverja, papa y gladiolos, las cuales lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, ya que siente que su arduo trabajo esta dando sus frutos, lleva 18 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden afectarlos. Su mayor deseo es comprarse un carro, con el cual pueda trasladar sus productos hasta el mercado de Tarma. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y siempre está poniendo la cuota de humor en el grupo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para sus tierras, ya que desea que sus nuevas siembras le den buenos frutos.
texts.en:
Carmen, 39 years old, is a very simple and hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her husband Jaime who is 39 years old and their two dear sons, Joel, 18 and Kevin, 16 years old. She wants to provide her children with better living conditions. Carmen started learning to work in the farm when she was very young. It was where she learned all the secrets to a good crop. She now has her own land where she sows and cares for with a lot of love and patience. She sows peas, potatoes and gladioli which she sells at Tarma's wholesale market. The thing she enjoys the most about her work is harvesting her crop since she can see that her hard work is giving fruit. She has been in this activity for 18 years and believes the hardest part of the work is taking care of the crop to prevent plagues from affecting it. Her biggest wish is to buy a car to transport her produce to the Tarma market. This is her first loan with MFP. She is aware that she needs to pay her installments on time and she is willing to do it. She is a very happy partner of her community bank and she is always offering the group a dose of humor. She will buy fertilizer for her land with the 3,000 nuevos soles she requests. She wishes her new seeds to give good fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more fertilizer to cultivate her land

loans.name: Encarnación

texts.es:
Encarnación es un padre de familia de 41 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Laynas del distrito de La Matanza, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Morropón, la zona se encuentra ubicada en la región Piura, a mas de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a labores asociadas a la agricultura, actualmente cuenta con una plantación de plátanos en un terreno situado cerca de la zona, el trata de otorgar el mayor cuidado a los racimos para que puedan desarrollarse de una mejor manera ya que de su venta depende el sostenimiento de su familia.

Encarnación desea brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo comprando algunos fertilizantes y algunas medicinas que prevengan la presencia de plagas. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es una persona bastante conocedora del manejo de este cultivo. Su mayor anhelo es mantener a su plantación sana para que pueda brindarle una buena producción y pueda ayudarse de ella para sacar adelante a su familia. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Encarnación is a 41-year old father who lives with his wife and children in the Laynas sector of the district of La Matanza.  This is an agricultural zone in the Morropón province, which is located in the Piura section of the country.  It is more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

For more than five years, he has dedicated himself to activities related to farming.  Currently, he has a banana crop planted on some land near this zone.
