He tries to give great care to the growing bunches so they can develop better, as his ability to support his family depends on selling his product.

Encarnación would like to better maintain his plantings by buying some fertilizers and treatments to prevent the presence of plagues.  In order to meet his objective, he has requested a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

He is a very knowledgeable person with regard to farming.  His greatest wish is to keep his crops healthy so his land can yield a good amount of product, which will help him get his family ahead.  He has previously had loans with Edpyme Alternativa and has demonstrated that he is punctual and responsible at the moment of assuming his loan payments.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and treatments to maintain his banana crop.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva tiene 46 años, vive con sus 4 hijos  en su casa propia. Casi toda su vida ha estado ligada a las actividades agrícolas pero desde hace más de 15 años decidido dedicarse más a la ganadería ya que diariamente vende leche que extrae de las vacas que posee, asimismo vende los becerros, de esa manera se genera más ingresos. En ocasiones recibe el apoyo de sus hijos, ya que en sus ratos libres la ayudan en esta actividad. Actualmente siembra papa y maíz pero en menores proporciones, ya que le sirven para su propio consumo. Eva ha comprobado lo rentable que suele ser la venta de leche, es por eso que desea ampliar su establo y mejorarla. Es el segundo crédito que tiene un crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, asimismo manifiesta se cumplida con sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, que son responsables y muy solidarias. En tanto agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar alfalfa y pasto que servirá de alimento para sus animales.
texts.en: Eva is 46 years old and she lives together with her four children in their own home. Almost her entire life she has been involved in agricultural activities, but more than 15 years ago she decided to specialize to be milk farmer instead. She obtains milk every day from the cows she has and she also sells the calves to generate more earnings. Sometimes her kids help out in their spare time. She has been sowing potatoes and corn in small amounts but they are used mostly for their own consumption. She has seen the milk sales are very profitable and it is for this reason that she wishes to expand her stable and improve it. This is the second loan accessed through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very grateful for the financial support and she is committed to the loan terms. She also enjoys taking part in her community bank because all of the members are known to her and they are very responsible individuals and are team oriented.  She is grateful to all of those individuals that will contribute to the loan she requests. The loan will be very helpful in the progress of her business. The loan that she requests will be invested in the purchase of sacks of fertilizer to plant alfalfa and grass.  These will be used in producing feed for her livestock.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizer to grow feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Adrian Benigno

texts.es:
Adrian Benigno A. G. tiene 22 años. Es soltero vive con los padres, vive  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1  hijo.

Adrian pertenece a la Ventanilla La Florida ubicada a media hora del Cantón  San Miguel, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura como fuente para los ingresos de las familias, esta ventanilla tiene 14 miembros.

Adrian se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz, trigo, fréjol y papa,  las comprar las realiza en San Miguel y vende en el mercado de San Miguel y en la misma localidad.

Solicita  el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, trigo, fréjol y papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Su sueño es hacer una casa y dar el estudio al hijo.
Le gusta pasear en la moto.
texts.en:
Adrian Benigno A. G. is 22 years old.  He is single and lives with his parents in the San Miguel canton of the Bolivar province.  He has one child.

Adrian is a member of the Ventanilla La Florida located a half hour away from San Miguel, it is a group dedicated to agriculture as a means of obatining income for their families.  This group has 14 members.

Adrian is in farming.  He grows corn, wheat, beans and potatoes.  He purchases supplies in San Miguel and sells his products at the market in San Miguel and at his farm.

He is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for the planting of corn, wheat, beans and potatoes.  With the help of the loan, he will be better able to financially support his family.  His dreams are to build a house and provide for his son's education.

He likes to ride his motorcycle.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for planting corn, wheat, beans and potatoes.

loans.name: Reina Mariluz

texts.es:
Reina se dedica a la venta de granos básicos y tortillas, tiene 31 años de edad y reside en Jucuapa departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 10,8,2 años de edad, ella lleva ya dos años de tener el negocio y trabaja de 8:00am a 5:00pm, lo comenzó por iniciativa propia, por la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con las demandas del hogar.
Ella hoy solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, maicillo, frijol, estos son los granos que comercializa con la gente cercana de la zona, esta inversión le ayudara a tener productos a alcance para vender en cualquier momento, también tendrá la oportunidad de tener mejores ventas y que sus clientes la prefieran.
Su sueño es que su negocio sea estable para generar los ingresos suficientes y dar a sus hijos la educación necesaria para optar por un estilo de vida distinto.
texts.en:
Reina works selling basic grains and tortillas.  She is 31 years old and lives in Jucuapa in Usulután department.  She lives with her husband and three children aged 10, 8 and 2.  She has had this business for two years and works from 8.00am to 5.00pm.  She set up her business on her own initiative as she needed to help her husband with their household expenses.

She is requesting this loan to buy corn, millet and beans.  These are the grains that she sells to nearby people in the area.  This investment will help her to have products on hand to sell at any moment.  She would also have the opportunity to have better sales and for her customers to prefer her business.

Her dream is for her business to be stable so that she can make enough income and give her children the necessary education for them to choose a different style of life.

loans.use: To buy corn, beans and millet

loans.name: Amaria Araba

texts.en: Amaria Araba Z. goes to the nearby villages to buy foodstuff to sell in Elmina. Amaria has eight children. Her husband is a security man. She contributes to the payment of school fees and utility bills. Amaria wants to expand her business. She is requesting to use the loan to purchase more foodstuff to meet the demands of her customers. Amaria plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff to meet the demands of her customers

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah N. lives in the Kalerwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has six children, all of whom attend school.  She also takes care of her brothers.  Sarah has a business of selling used clothing. She has been in this business for six years, and she works seven days a week. Sarah sells her products at the market.  Sarah has requested for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. The main business challenges for Sarah include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to start selling wholesale only and to build her own house. Sarah  lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, food, and medication.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace runs a sari-sari store. Sari-sari stores basically sell small quantities of various foodstuffs, grocery items and beverages. “Sari” is a native word for variety. This is a small store that is either attached to the owner’s house or in a small native cottage not far away from the owner’s house. Such stores are convenient for people in the village who live far from the marketplace. 

Mary Grace started her variety store through her initiative of dealing with customers. She wants to continue her business; it gives her family good proceeds to support the educational needs of her two children. She is requesting a loan of PHP20,000 so that she can have the funds needed to buy more food products and basic household necessities. This will allow her to attract more customers and increase her sales. 

Mary Grace dreams of growing her variety store into a mini-grocery store and expanding it to other villages, to send her two children to college, and to have their own beautiful house and land for comfortable living. 

Her children are her inspiration to pursue her variety store. She now feels very happy for the help of ASHI and KIVA partnership, which allows her to pursue her dreams for her family. She hopes that they continue the service for a long time and help many families who want to get ahead.

She has shown herself to be hard-working to make her dreams come true and hopes that her business will continue to be more productive and improve her overall quality of life for her entire family.

She says “Thank You” to all her Kiva lenders around the world for offering her financial support and giving people a big chance of reaching their dreams in life. She prays that they will be blessed.

loans.use: will buy more food products and basic household necessities

loans.name: Placida

texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” cooperative bank, which is located in the Oropesa district of the province of Quispicanchi in the deparment of Cusco, Peru.

Her name is Placida and she is 45 years old.  Placida is married and has six children. She is requesting the loan to invest in her bread making business.  The city of Oropesa, Peru is famous for making bread and she is interested in using the loan to buy flour, yeast, wood, and other ingredients to make bread.  She also wants to buy firewood to fire her oven.

She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in Bakery / Firewood

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia A., 56 years old, is married with 5 kids. Alicia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. She works hard to provide her family with a better standard of living. Alicia plans to start a backyard piggery to have an extra source of income.

Alicia is in need of additional seeds and fertilizers. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 PHP from Kiva partner, CEVI. She will also use part of the loan to buy piglets to raise. She is hopeful that this loan will help improve her harvest.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Aimee

texts.en:
Aimee is 26 years old and is married, with three children between the ages 4 and 8 years old. She sells bedding in her shop. Her business is well-organized and open from 8am until 5pm every day.   She has been working in this business for 3 years.

This is Aimee's first loan from Vision Finance Company and she plans to use it to purchase more bedding to sell.  Any profits she makes will be used to continue to grow her shop.

loans.use: To buy more bedspreads for her shop

loans.name: Korng

texts.en:
Korng S., 46, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for its Pre-Angkorean temples. S. is a silk weaver, earning an income of 2 USD per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of 1.50 USD per day.  Each month, the family has to spend 50 USD on food and 52 USD on other necessary expenses.

S. is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase more raw silk to produce silk products for sale. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy more raw silk to produce silk products

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: This picture was taken on one of Hannah's normal rounds selling "kenkey" (fermented corn dough balls). Hannah A. has received junior high level of education. She is a single parent taking care of three children. Hannah has been selling "kenkey" and fried fish for 10 years. She singlehandedly takes care of her family with the income she makes from her sales. A loan will go a long way to boost her kenkey business. The new profit will be reinvested into her business.

loans.use: to boost her "kenkey" business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna, now age 48, is a mother of six children, three of whom are adults and the other three are still in school. She has been in commercialized mixed farming for twenty-five years producing tea, bananas, coffee and maize in her hometown of Kisii, in South Rift, Kenya.

Anna has requested this loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says she has decided to venture into dairy farming and hopes to succeed just like she has been doing in other farming ventures. Anna reiterates that all her children are educated through her farming businesses.

Anna too urges for more training especially in dairy farming and would also advocate for loans to be made more accessible.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 21-year-old engaged man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and two siblings. He has two years of experience working with mobile phones. He began as an employee in a mobile phone shop and opened his own store in 2009. With his loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will increase his selection of mobile phones and prepaid telephone cards for resale. The majority of phone users in Lebanon purchase these prepaid cards.

 He reports that both his business productivity and his income will increase as a result of the loan. He is planning to get married soon, so his only purpose at this time is to earn a higher income in order to gather the needed resources to complete all the wedding preparations.

loans.use: to expand his selection of mobile phones and prepaid telephone cards.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam N. lives in the Kalerwe neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, none of whom are in school. Mariam has a business selling cold drinks. She has been in this business for 2 years, and she works 6 days of every week. Mariam sells her products at the local market.

Mariam has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva's partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of water, crates of beer, passion fruits and sugar. She also generates additional income through selling chapatti (unleavened flatbread) and samosas (a type of pastry).The main challenges for Mariam's business include the rainy season and the ever-increasing prices of passion fruits and sugar.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to one day own a permanent business location. Mariam lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and food for her children.

loans.use: to buy more passion fruits, crates of soda and boxes of mineral water for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to sell fresh fruits and vegetables in a shop instead of from a cart.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El señor José Luis M. es un hombre muy responsable y buen padre de familia que desea ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. La vivienda la adquirió de interés social y este tipo de casas son muy pequeñas por lo que el decidió construir en la parte trasera una recamara mas para vivir cómodamente, pues esta familia es formada por 5 integrantes esposa e hijos. José Luis con ahorros propios levanto lo que es la recamara principal pero aun le sigue faltando algunos detalles como loes enjarrar y pintar para que se vea mejor y este protegida. Con el préstamo otorgado comprara lo que es el material y pagar la mano de obra.
texts.en:
José Luis M. is a very responsible man and a good father who would like to offer his children a better quality of life.  He acquired his home through a government subsidy program and these types of houses are very small.  For this reason, he decided to build an additional bedroom out the back of his home so that he could live more comfortably, as his family has five members including his wife and children.

José Luis used his own savings to build the bedroom but he still needs to do some work such as plastering and painting so that it looks better and is protected.  He will use the loan he has been granted to buy materials and pay labor costs.

loans.use: to plaster

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 40 years old, married to Isaac, and together they have two children, aged twelve and nineteen years old. She has been in the salon business for the last eight year, earning a profit of 30,000 per month.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a staff member and this will be her first loan. She plans to add to her stock of chemicals, braids, and such. As for the anticipated profit, she plans to open another salon.

In the future she hopes to open more than five salons and employ people.

loans.use: to add to her stock of chemicals, braids, and such.

loans.name: Julia

texts.pt:
nasceu na Provincia de Inhambane, Sul de Moçambique, tem 49 anos de idade é solteira mãe de 6 filhos  dos 14 aos 29 anos 3 é que vão a Escola os restantes estão nos seus lares. Faz a 7ª classe não conclui devido a falta de condições, vive na casa dos pais e responsabiliza se por eles.

vivia na Provincia de Sofala centro de Moçambique onde tinha sua própria casa. mas seu marido vende a casa sem o consetimento dela e é disalojada, tendo assim que voltar a casa dos pais onde consegue aranjar um emprego no Colégio Maria Auxiliadora ( Namaacha) como servente. Trabalha ha 17 anos das 6h as 14h auferindo 2.400.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa, mas conta com ajuda das suas filhas que envam lhe 1.000.00mt mensalmente.

Este é seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt com o qual pretende iniciar com a nova obra pois onde iniciara com o primeiro emprestimo de 6.000.00mt ficava distante do seu trabalho, posteriormente legaliza um outro terreno que esta proximo do trabalho e da vila. Nunca trabalhou com outros Bancos e esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo.
texts.en:
She was born in the Inhambane province,  in southern Mozambique.  She is 49 years old and the single mother of 6 children ages 14 to 29 years old.  Three of the children are going to school the rest are in their own homes. She went to school until 7th grade, which she did not complete, due to lack of logistical conditions. She lives in her parents home and is also responsible for them.

She lived in the province of Sofala, in central Mozambique, where she had her own home, but her husband sold the house without her consent.  She was homeless and had to return to her parents home, where she was able to get a job at the “Saint Mary Christian School”, in Namaacha city, as an assistant. She has worked for 17 years from 6:00 AM to 2:00 PM earning 2.400.00mt, which she applies to household expenses, but she does get help from her daughters who will send her 1.000.00mt monthly.

This is her third loan with the Hluvuku [field partner loan agency] in the amount of 12.000.00mt.  With this loan, she hopes to start a new project continuing what she started with the first 6.000.00mt loan, which was far from her work so she hopes to get legal access to another parcel of land to work within her village.  She has never worked with other banks, and is confident she will repay the loan ahead of time.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Sukhum

texts.en:
Sukhum is a housewife. Her husband is a motor taxi driver with $2.50 per day for his income. She has three children, all of them are working in the factory and they can make $5 per day for their income. 

Every month, Sukhum has to spend $77 on food, and $5 on electricity. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for her son to do motor taxi driving like his father. If she can save more money, she will buy a van for her husband to transport the factory workers to their location which will bring more income to her family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more seeds and manure for his banana plantation.

loans.name: Yurley Faride

texts.es:
Desde que Yurley cumplió 18 años comenzó a trabajar en una fábrica de confección, es por esto que decide tener su propio negocio para así poder no solo tener su propia empresa sino también para comenzar a forjarle a su hijo un mejor futuro.

Ella trabaja todas las mañanas en producción para luego en las tardes salir a repartir los pedidos y hacer la estampación, ella quiere comprar mas insumos para así poder hacer mas producción de prendas y de esta maneta incrementar sus ingresos y así darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
At age 18 Yurley began working in a clothes factory.  But she decided to set up her own business and carve out a better future for her son.

In the morning she produces her products and in the afternoon she distributes orders and takes care of printing.  She wants to buy more supplies so she can increase production and income, thus providing her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy supplies.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: La señora Alejandra se de dedica a  la venta de leche al por mayor a la empresa PIL y su esposo la ayuda con trabajos de agricultura. El crédito lo requiere para  la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mejorada, para así poder aumentar la cantidad de leche a ser vendida y mejorar sus ingresos. La familia vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Laja del departamento de La Paz; Alejandra es casada y tiene cinco hijos. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2009 y presenta un historial de pagos excelente.
texts.en:
Sra. Alejandra sells milk in bulk to the PIL dairy plant. Her husband helps with the farm work. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a dairy cow of improved breed. This will help her increase the amount of milk that she can sell and improve her income. Her family lives in their own home in the town of Laja in the Department of La Paz. Alejandra is married and has five children.

She has been a client of IMPRO since 2009 and presents an excellent payment history.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are in school.  Jane lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.   

Jane has a beauty salon business. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. She also generates additional income through rental houses.

Jane has requested for a loan of 1,300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves. The main business challenges for Jane include thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a bridal salon and also to build other rental rooms.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves.

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en: Nelli is engaged in the agricultural business. She keeps livestock and cultivates land. Nelly would like to start cultivating eggplant and expand her business. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase eggplant seeds. With the loan's help, Nelli will develop agriculture and get more income. This will allow her to renovate the barn in the future and also to improve her family's living conditions. Nelli lives together with her son, daughter-in-law and two children.

loans.use: to pay for eggplant seeds.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es: La señora  Olivia, se dedica a la producción de leche y también trabaja realizando artesanías pues es tejedora de mantas. El crédito lo requiere para la comprar  un par de vacas lecheras y así podrá aumentar la producción de leche y obviamente sus ingresos. Vive en casa propia ubicado en la localidad de Achacachi  del departamento de La Paz;  es soltera  y no tiene hijos. Esta es la segunda vez que su crédito será enviado a Kiva para fondeo.
texts.en: Olivia is a dairy farmer and also works making crafts since she’s a blanket weaver.  She needs the loan to buy a pair of dairy cows to increase milk production and, obviously, her income.  She lives in her own house located in Achacachi in La Paz Department.  She’s single and has no children.  This is the second time her loan will be sent to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to buy a pair of daily cows.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: La señora Maria Antonia se dedica a la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Desde hace mas de 36 años que tiene este negocio, comenzó este negocio con la ayuda de su esposo quien siempre la apoyado fue así que comenzó a ampliar su actividad. Actualmente  solicita este crédito para la compra de cal, maíz, leña, comal entre otros productos. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y que sus utilidades sean mejores para así darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Maria Antonia sells and produces tortillas. She has had this business for more than 36 years, having started out with her husband's help. He has always supported her and this is how she started to expand her business. She requests a loan t purchase lime, corn, firewood, a grill, and other products. Her dream is to make her business grow and that her profits will increase to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase lime, corn, firewood, a grill, and other products.

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Artemia is 58 years old and married. She has four children. 

Artemia has been in the scrap buying business for 10 years. She earns about 5,000 PHP per month with her business. Artemia also buys coconut shells to make charcoal. 

Artemia has requested a loan to buy more scrap to sell. She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more scrap to sell.

loans.name: Pania

texts.en:
Pania is 61 years old, married, and has nine adult children. Her younger children still go to school. Pania’s husband is a farmer.

Pania has been running a sari-sari (variety) store business for two years. She sells items like shampoo, coffee and bread. Each month, Pania earns 3,000 PHP with her business. 

She plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, soap and shampoo. Pania hopes for her living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en:
Orlando has been a farmer for nearly 15 years. He patiently manages his corn field to provide for his living expenses. Orlando is 39 years old and is married. He and his wife have been blessed with six children. He dreams of improving his farming business so that he can send all his children to a higher level of education and improve their standard of living. 

Orlando only generates an income of P25,000 from cropping due to his obligation to the traders where he gets his farm inputs. According to him, his profit is not enough for his family because of the expenses for tuition fees and household expenses. 

He would like to ask for financial assistance in the amount of P27,000, which would allow him to pay for the labor costs of transplanting and plowing the corn field as well as to buy farm inputs to maintain his farming business. Through his requested loan, he will no longer be subject to high interest rates. Also, he could minimize his expenses because he will not be paying high interest rates. In this way, he could save some money and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for the labor costs of transplanting and plowing the corn field as well as to buy farm inputs to maintain his farming business.

loans.name: Abejitas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Jorge es parte del grupo “Abejitas Trabajadoras” dice que le pusieron ese nombre al grupo por que consideran a este insecto como muy trabajador. el tiene 32 años de edad el es originario de una población donde su principal actividad económica es el cultivo de guayaba, el esta casado y tiene dos niños los cuales estudian la primaria, el se dedica desde muy joven a la elaboración de pan, pero hace 4 años de independizo para aportar económicamente a su casa, para que así le deje un poco mas de ganancias, dice que su familia fueron los que le enseñaron hacer los panes de diferentes como las deliciosas chilindrinas, donas, conchas, espejos, teleras, cuernitos y muchas mas variedades. Dice que a muy temprana hora se levanta para elaborarlo desde las 4 de la mañana, el vende en su población el pan ya en varias tiendas tiene pedidos y esta pidiendo un crédito para comprar materia prima como harina, leche, huevo, azúcar, gas, colorantes etc. dice que en especial en el mes de noviembre hace lo que son los panes de muerto que son muy vendidos debido a que en el país se festeja el día de muerto. El esta muy contento por que le harán el crédito por que así tendrá insumos para hacer sus panes deliciosos, la meta de Jorge es hacer otro horno de lodo ya que así saben mas sabrosos los panes y se cosen con leña y les da un sabor diferente.
Los otros once integrantes se llaman Gloria,  Cristina, Elizabeth, Rosa, Mariana, María de Jesús, Adriana, Teresa, Alma Delia, Sandra, Georgina todos ellos están pidiendo sus créditos para invertirlo en sus negocios como venta de zapatos, mueblería, dulcería, bordados de prendas artesanales, florería, antojitos, cosméticos por catalogo.
texts.en:
Jorge is part of the “Abejitas Trabajadoras” (Little Worker Bees) communal bank and says that they gave the group that name because they consider the insect to be very hardworking. He is 32 and a native of a town where the principal economic activity is guava cultivation. He is married and has two children, who are in primary school. He has worked, from a very young age, as a baker, but four years ago he branched out on his own in order to provide economically for his household and earn a bit more income. He notes that it was his family who taught him how to make different kinds of breads such as the delicious chilindrinas (sugar coated buns), doughnuts, conchas (sweet buns), espejos (large, glazed cookies ), teleras (a type of bread), cuernitos (croissants) and many other varieties. 

Jorge says that he gets up at a very early hour, at about 4 in the morning, to do his baking. He sells his bread in the city, since various stores have already placed orders. He is asking for a loan to buy basic ingredients such as flour, milk, eggs, sugar, cooking gas, food coloring, etc. He says that, especially in the month of November, he makes bread for the Day of the Dead, since the Day of the Dead holiday is celebrated in the country. He is very pleased that they will give him a loan because then he will have the supplies needed to make his delicious breads. Jorge’s goal is to own another mud oven because the bread has a more delicious taste and it is cooked with wood which gives it a different flavor.

The other eleven members of the communal bank are Gloria, Cristina, Elizabeth, Rosa, Mariana, María de Jesús, Adriana, Teresa, Alma Delia, Sandra, Georgina. They are all requesting loans to invest in their businesses selling items such as shoes, furniture, sweets, embroidered handicrafts, flowers, appetizers and cosmetics by catalog.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients for bread-making.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Karla tiene 25 años de edad y vive en el municipio de Choloma. Ella es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad. El mayor asiste a la escuela. Karla y sus hijos viven con la madre de Karla. 

Karla especializa en la elaboración de donas. Inició el negocio en octubre del año 2010 para sacar a su familia adelante. La madre de Karla le ayuda hacer las donas y el negocio tiene dos vendedores que se encarguen de vender las donas de forma ambulante. Karla también las vende en la maquila donde trabaja. Su horario es uno de “4x4” donde trabaja 4 días y luego tiene 4 días libre. Cuando no esté en la maquila, ella se dedica a su negocio. 

Solicitó este crédito de L10,000 para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de las donas (harina, azúcar, leche y sal entre otras cosas). Su sueño es llegar a tener su casa propia y que sus hijos se gradúen.
texts.en:
Señora Karla is 25 years old and lives in the town of Choloma.  She is a single mother with two children aged 6 and 2.  The older one is in school.  Karla and her children live with Karla's mother.

Karla specializes in making doughnuts.  She started her business in October 2010, in order to move her family ahead in life.  Karla's mother helps her make the doughnuts, and the business has two salespeople who are responsible for selling the doughnuts as street vendors.  Karla also sells them in the factory where she works.  Her schedules is what's known as "4x4", where she works for 4 days, and then has 4 days off.  When she isn't in the factory, she works in her business.

She requested this loan of L10,000 for the purchase of raw ingredients for making the doughnuts (flour, sugar, milk, salt, among other things).  Her dream is to be able to have her own home, and for her children to graduate.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making doughnuts, such as flour, sugar, milk and salt.

loans.name: Lwichi Control Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Lwichi Control Group in Western Kenya! Lilian is the facilitator of the Lwichi Control group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Lilian takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Lilian had an excellent maize yield harvesting 19 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Lilian was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Lilian and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Lilian will educate her children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Lwichi Control group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Lilian with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Flor De Lipe Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE LIPE” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Cristina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: producción de agricultura, comercio de sogas, comercio de verduras.

La señora Cristina  indica que es la primera ves que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de la promoción. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de pitas y sogas que viene trabajando hace años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de pitas y sogas) que comprará de Desaguadero y lo comercializa en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The communal bank “FLOR DE LIP” will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi Center. It is made up of eight members and led by a committee which is headed by a woman named Cristina. The businesses that the members of the association bring forward are varied, including: agricultural production, rope sales, and vegetable trade. 

Cristina says that it is the first time that she has been a part of Pro Mujer, to which she was invited as part of a promotion. Right now she has a business selling twine and rope, which she has been doing for years.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her merchandise (to purchase twin and rope) that she will buy in Desaguadero and sell in street markets. This type of job lets her make money, which allows her to support her family. She is married and has five children.

What they asked her what she liked about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training.

loans.use: to buy twine and rope.

loans.name: Osmar

texts.es:
El señor Osmar tiene 31 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Villarrica. El comenta que se dedica a la mecánica automotor, su padre es mecánico de profesión y su madre realiza artesanías en aopo i.
Osmar  aprendió de su padre todos los secretos profesionales para llegar a ser uno bueno. Actualmente tiene todas las herramientas que necesita, como ser un compresor de aire, soplete, aire de oxigeno, herramientas de uso manual y otros, para realizar variados servicios mecánicos.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos para poder venderlos en el taller mecánico. Agradece a la fundación por esta oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
Osmar is 31 years old, single and living with his parents in the city of Villarrica.  He comments that he works as an auto mechanic.  His father is an auto mechanic by profession and his mother is an Ao po'i craftswoman.

Osmar learned all his father’s professional secrets to become a good one.  He currently has all the work tools he needs like an air compressor, welder, oxygen tank, manual tools and others to do all the various types of car repairs.

He is asking for the loan to buy spare parts to sell in his auto shop.  He thanks the foundation for the opportunity it’s giving him.

loans.use: to buy auto spare parts for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila, de 37 años, es una mujer buena y amable, esta casada y tiene cinco hijos de los cuales 2 ya son mayores e independientes y tres menores de 11, 7 años y uno de 9 meses, ellos dependen de ella y su esposo para poder tener una mejor calidad vida. El trabajo de Zoila consiste en la venta de pescado, todos los días desde las 4 de la madrugada sale en busca de los mejores productos para dirigirse a las diferentes calles de la ciudad y vender éste alimento. Cuando inició con su trabajo aún recuerda que lo hacía con una pequeña bandeja que máximo entraban 10 kilos, ahora creció mucho desde entonces y vende en bandejas llenas de aproximadamente 120 kilos durante al día. Lleva realizando éste trabajo por 6 años y tiene la satisfacción de vender mucho.
Todo su trabajo lo realiza sola y en algunos casos tiene la ayuda de sus hijos, empezó a realizar esta actividad con la necesidad de tener mejores ingresos en la economía del hogar, y gracias a mucho esfuerzo pudo consolidarse como una de las vendedoras de pescado más solicitadas en las calles pues sus clientes la esperan a diario para poder comprar sus pescados frescos. Espera seguir creciendo más y trasladar su venta en su propia casa. Este será el crédito número 3 con MFP, por tanto está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio, además está muy comprometida una vez mas en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en el anterior crédito que tuvo. Con el monto solicitado comprará más productos para seguir con su venta, además de refaccionar y cambiar algunos materiales que utiliza en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Zoila, 37, is a good, kind woman.  She’s married and has five children two of which are already independent adults and three minors who are 11 and 7 years old and a 9-month-old.  They depend on her and her husband to have a better quality of life.

Zoila’s work consists in selling fish.  She goes out every day at 4am to seek out the best products to then head for the streets in the city to sell this food.  When she started out with her work she remembers that she did it with a small tray that only held 10 kilos.  Since then she’s grown quite a bit and now sells trays full with about 120 kilos during the day.  She’s been in business six years and has the satisfaction of selling a lot.

She does all her work alone though sometimes gets help from her children.  She started this business needing to earn better income for her family and thanks to much effort was able to consolidate herself into one of the most sought after fish sellers in the street because her customers wait for her daily to buy her fresh fish.  She hopes to continue to grow more and move her sales into her house.

This will be MFP loan #3.  She’s happy to know that she’ll have financial support because she’ll feel sure to get ahead with her business this way.  Besides, she’s very committed once more to make her installment payments like she did with her previous loan.  She will use the requested amount to buy more products to continue with her sales as well as to renew and replace some of the materials she uses in her work.

loans.use: to buy more fish and trays and other supplies.

loans.name: Avaz

texts.ru: Авз проживает в городе Вахдат. Ему 33 года. Он женат. У них четверо детей. Он имеет средне - специальное образование. По специальности он бухгалтер. В этой области работает пять лет. Кроме того он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Этим видом деятельности он занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для закупа семян пшеницы.
texts.en: Avaz lives in the town of Vahdat. He is 33 years old. He is married and has four children. He has specialized secondary education. He is an accountant by profession and has worked in this field for five years. Avaz also grows and cultivates crops. He has been in this business for four years. He is taking out the loan to buy seeds of wheat.

loans.use: to buy wheat seeds.

loans.name: Giang

texts.en: Giang is 41 years old. She has two children whom one is in high school and one is adult. She raises pigs and sells cooked food for a living. She has done these job for 11 years and gained from them 4,200,000 VND. She has taken part in crediting program of SEDA from 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to upgrade her pigsty.

loans.use: to upgrade her pigsty.

loans.name: La Gran Amistad  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Gran Amistad este formado por 8 mujeres que son amigas, viven por la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, lugar de hermoso paisajes gracias a su geografía accidentada y sus verdes campos producto de los sembríos de su población, esta parroquia crecer cada día más en el comercio gracias a su gente. Las socias al igual que la mayor parte de su gente se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales, comercio y muchos laboran en la ciudad, algunos han dejado a sus familias y han migrado en busca de mejores oportunidades, pero a pesar del crecimiento que tiene esta parroquia aun mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Bernardita,  tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 12 hijos, 7 de sus hijos son casados y viven independientes, sus 5 hijos solteros tienen 17, 15, 14, 10 y 8 años de edad, dos estudian en el colegio, un hijo es discapacitado por lo que pasa en casa y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como albañil. Viven en una casa prestada pero tiene una casa propia en otro cantón.

Doña Bernardita desde muy joven se dedica  a la agricultura y a la cría de cuyes y gallinas, esta actividad económica lo aprendió de sus padres, ahora este trabajo le ha permitido mejorar la estabilidad económica de su hogar y salir en adelante. Siempre le gusto este trabajo ya que le da el tiempo para estar en casa, cuidar de su hogar, sus animales y  de sus cultivos los cuales los vende en un mercado de la ciudad de Cuenca, depende del día sus productos se venden a buenos y malos precios, pero siempre es optimista y espera que cada día sea mejor que el otro. 

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento para todos sus animales y pollos.
 
Su meta es de seguir superándose y brindarle una mayor estabilidad a su familia.

loans.use: Comprar alimento para animales y pollos.

loans.name: Bashar

texts.en: Bashar is 41 years old; he lives in Nablus with his wife and three children. He opened a small workshop for stone digging in 2000. His business is the only source of income for his small family. Bashar is satisfied with the income from his business, but he needs this loan to repair his workshop equipment and expand it. He also wants to hire another labourer to help him because his customers are constantly increasing. Bashar is very grateful to everyone who helps him achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to repair his workshop equipment and expand it.

loans.name: Adelhelma

texts.en:
Adelhelma, who is in her early 30's and married, has two schooling children. She has been a tailor for eight years now. She works from 8 am to 6:30 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Adelhelma's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy sewing equipment and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to repay her loan, to reinvest in her sewing business, to cover household expenses and to pay school fees for her children

She will use this loan to buy sewing products and best materials for making suits and female dresses in the latest style. She dreams of building her own house and expanding her business to the next step.

Adelhelma will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sewing products and best materials for making suits and ladies' dresses that are in style.

loans.name: Carmen Lizeth

texts.en:
I cook and sell tortillas, as I have for several years. I am a single mother, I have two children who help me sell tortillas in our community. I also sell cheese, quesillo(a white traditional Latin American cheese), and butter. My earnings cover family expenses and feeding and schooling my children.

Loan Use: Purchase of corn, lime, firewood, water.

Me dedico a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas desde hace algunos años, soy madre soltera tengo 2 hijos que me ayudan a vender las tortillas en nuestra comunidad, vendo tambien queso, quesillo, mantequilla y me genera un ingreso extra para poder cubrir los gastos de mis hijos en sus estudios y alimentacion.

loans.use: Compra de maiz, cal, leña, agua.

loans.name: May

texts.en: May, 32, is married to a fisherman in the fishing village of Falefa. She had been doing the selling of the fish caught by her husband. As she became more confident of expanding her fish vending business, she joined a solidarity group organized by SPBD in her village. She got a small loan and used it as working capital to buy more fish from other fishermen. She is now intending to expand her thriving business by buying additional coolers and deep freezers to extend the shelf life of the fish she is selling to neighboring villages.

loans.use: To purchase two additional coolers and two deep freezers

loans.name: Sumrud

texts.en: Sumrud S. owns a couple of cows in the small village of Shahnerzerli, in the Devechi region of Azerbaijan. She is raising cattle to sell for slaughter as well as raising milking cows in order to sell the milk to the merchants in the local markets and bazaar. Sumrud is looking for funding in order to purchase a couple more cows so that she can increase her product output and therefore increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Houn

texts.en: Mrs. Houn R. is 26 years old and operates a small floral shop in Siem Reap, Cambodia.  She can earn about $3/day in this business, while her husband earns $7/day working as a driver for a tourist company.  Together, they support 2 young children.  This loan will be used to purchase flowers for Mrs. Houn R.' shop.  As her business grows, she hopes to buy bicycles for her children to ride to school.

loans.use: To purchase more flowers for her shop

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Vannak married in 1984 and has 7 children. He started his business as a construction contractor more than 20 years ago. He contracts to build houses and other buildings from village to village. He sometimes stays at the construction site.

Vannak's wife, Sok Rady, sews clothes at home. They both only finished primary school. Therefore, they are sending all their children to school in the local schools and of course they encourage their children to pursue higher education.

Vannak is asking for a first loan of US$ 200 from MAXIMA. With this loan, he will repair his house. We feel confident that Vannak has ability to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Repairing house

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a very active and enterprising woman. She is 44 years old and married to Mr. U. with six children.

In order to take care of her family, Florence started her own business selling drinks and palm oil six years ago. She is requesting a loan of $400, which will enable her buy more palm oil and drinks for sale. She plans to repay it in eight months.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and palm oil

loans.name: Dadadjon

texts.ru:
Dadadjon works on the regional market. The goods are delivered to him from the city. He is married and has 3 children. He has been working on the market for the past 8 years. He came to MicroInvest in 2007 asking for a credit that will allow him to increase the size of his business.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Дададжон работает на рынке своего района, ему привозят товар с города. Он семьянин, имеет троих детей и на рынке он около 8 лет. В "Микроинвест" он обратился в 2007 году, что бы расширить бизнес.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries and resale on the market

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Mrs. Francisca F. has worked selling all kinds of food in the city of Chinandega for 18 years now. She is a single mother with a child for whom she is responsible, so she has to ensure he has food and education.

Mrs. F. is an example for many people, because she started her business without capital. She started selling tortillas until she had saved enough to buy merchandise for her business, and nowadays she has seen better results from her business.

It is important to highlight that Ceprodel has supported Mrs. F. through loans, which have allowed her to increase her sales, and most of all, having her own food stand in the city of Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora F. es ejemplo para muchas personas ya que inició su negocio sin tener capital por lo que comenzó a vender tortillas para ahorrar hasta comprar los enseres para su negocio y hoy en día ha visto mejores resultados en su negocio.

Es importante destacar que Ceprodel ha apoyado a la señora F. por medio de créditos a su favor que han hecho que ella pueda aumentar sus ventas y sobre todo tener su propio establecimiento de venta de comida en la ciudad de Chinandega.

loans.use: Buying ingredients (Compra de ingredienes)

loans.name: Oyshajon

texts.ru:
Oyshajon D., who is 50 years old, has a Bachelors degree in Economics, is married, and has 5 children. Oyshajon has been in the business of selling children's toys, glassware, and gifts for the past 15 years. She rents a space on one of the markets in the town of Vahdat. Using the loan she is planning to purchase additional inventory. These funds will help her to increase the assortment of goods and help local residents have access to and ability to purchase a variety of glassware and other goods that she sells. Oyshajon will be paying off the loan withing the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Додочонова Ойшачон, возраст – 50 лет, образование – высшее, по специальности - экономист, замужем, имеет 5-х детей. Ойшачон занимается продажей детских игрушек, посудой и подарками. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 15 лет. Для этого она арендует небольшой магазин на одном из рынков города Вахдата. На полученный кредит она планирует приобрести новый товар. Кредит поможет увеличить Ойшачон ассортимент продаваемого товара, а жители района всегда будут иметь возможность прийти к ней в магазин и приобрести, то что им надо из посуды или других вещей, которыми она торгует. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase additional assortment of inventory

loans.name: Kabumbi V C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Moreen N.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more shop items. Moreen is 27 years old and is married with a husband, who sells spare parts for work. She has 4 children ranging from age 2 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Moreen makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy more business stock. Moreen has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to pay rent for the shop premises and the loan was paid back on time.

Moreen is joined in her small group by Magret N., Josephine N., Mary N., and Jesca N.. Magret N. has a business running a restaurant and wants to purchase more furniture like tables. Josephine N. is currently operating a business in tailoring and wants a loan to buy more cloth material and fabrics. Mary N. operates a business of fresh food sales and wants to purchase more foods to sell. Jesca N. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add capital stock.

loans.use: To add more commodities to retail shop

loans.name: In

texts.en:
Mr. In T., age 71, is an old man who lives with his wife, age 77 at home and make no income. They have three children, two of whom are farmers and one other who has a business fishing for a living.
To improve the fishing business, the family must purchase more fishing tools like nets and so on. This will allow the son to catch more fish to sustain the family’s income. (Mr. In T. is pictured on the right hand side, his son, the fisherman, is in the middle and the woman on the left  is his daughter)

loans.use: To purchase more fishing tools like nets and so on.

loans.name: Yoeum

texts.en: Mrs. Yoeum A., 27, is married with two little children and works weaving mats to raise her standard of living. A mat-weaving skill has been left and taught by her ancestors. Generally, whenever her outputs are done, the brokers come over and purchase during the day. She can make about $2 each day of net income. Her husband, meanwhile, works as a construction foreman, earning around $5 per day. With the incomes that she and her husband make are basically help to cover her daily expense and her loan repayment. Recently, this couple has taken out a loan to build partly of her house and the rest of the money will be used to reinvest in her mat business. She feels amazed with the loan on her family.

loans.use: to build partly of her house and the rest of the money will be used to reinvest in her mat business

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr:
Jeanne H. was born around 1967 in Porto Novo. A widow responsible for three children (two girls and one boy), she lives in Ekpe in the commune of Seme Podji in the south-east of Benin. Since she lives not far from the Ekpe market which is especially lively at night, Mrs. H. sells prepared food: vegetable sauces, peanut sauces, cornmeal mush, etc. Since her foods are much appreciated, she would like to try out other types of dishes with her very faithful clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

H. Jeanne est née vers les années 1967 à PORTO NOVO. Veuve ayant à sa charge 3 enfants (2 filles et 1 garçon), elle réside à EKPE dans la commune de SEME PODJI au sud-est du BENIN. Ayant son domicile non loin du marché d’EKPE qui s’anime beaucoup plus la nuit, dame H. Jeanne vend du repas prêt à manger: sauce de légume, sauce d’arachide, pâte de maïs, etc. Son repas étant bien apprécier, elle envisage s’essayer à d’autres types de sauces et de pâtes qu’elle soumettra à sa clientèle qui lui est très fidèle.

loans.use:
Purchase of one basket of fresh fish, three baskets of condiments, ½ bag of corn and ½ bag of manioc flour

Achat de 1 panier de poisson frais, 3 paniers de condiments, ½ sac de maïs et ½ sac de farine de manioc.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam S. R., 36, lives in the Kampong Cham province with her husband, Ros Bou Rithy, and their two young children. She sells common Khmer dishes that she cooks, earning US$6 net income each day. She and her husband work together in their business, serving pork and beef with Khmer wine. She has asked for a loan of US$500 to build a separate room for their restaurant business to increase their customer base. Their current business is hampered by a lack of adequate space. In the future, she would like to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: Build a separate room to sell food

loans.name: Pavlo

texts.en:
Pavlo is married. He lives in Khoost and works as a taxi driver. He has been in this business for five years. His monthly income is about $500. One of the most outstanding characteristics of his venture has been its stability and consistent growth.

Pavlo is requesting a loan of 3500 Grivnas to cover expenses connected with paperwork he needs to prepare in order to install a gas equipment system in his vehicle. Pavlo has been planning to make these changes for awhile because he wanted to decrease his fuel costs and make his business more efficient. Pavlo has proved to be a responsible client with Nadiya Ukraine. We believe his drive for success and increased profits will be the best motivation for prompt loan repayment and further development of his business.

loans.use: To get all paperwork and install gas equipment

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina is married and has four children. Her children are 16, 19, 21, and 24, respectively, and the older three are married. Cristina's husband works as an agent. Cristina has always liked working in sales, so two years ago she started a perfume business. She sells perfumes to her family, friends, and neighbors. All of her sales are on credit, and sometimes her clients are late on payments. This has led Cristina to give preference to clients who can secure payment.

Cristina needs a loan of $650, which she'll repay in 6 months. She'll use the money to build her inventory of perfumes and to fill the orders that she already has.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Cristina es casada y madre de 4 hijos de 16, 19 21 y 24 años (los tres mayores ya casados), su esposo trabaja como comisionista. Ella inició el negocio ya que siempre le han gustado y se ha dedicado a las ventas, comenzó hace mas de 2 años, tenia un dinero ahorrado y empezó vendiendo perfumes a familiares, amigos y vecinos, todas sus ventas son en pagos, en ocasiones le quedan mal, aun que siempre le pagan pero esto ocasiona que ella se retrace en surtir otros pedidos seguros que tiene.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $650 que pagara en 6 meses para tener inventario extra de perfumes y poder cumplir con los pedidos que tiene.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en: Firuza K. is 41 years old. She is married and has six children. Her husband has no fixed job, so Firuza must work to support her large family's needs. She worked fortwo years in a gift shop, and thanks to her savings, six years ago she was able to start her own business. She now sells clothing for children. She gets help from her children, who take care of the store in the afternoon. Thanks to her hard work, her customers increased and she had to rent the store next door to expand and offer a better variety. She is now requesting a loan of $1000 USD, which she will use to buy new clothing for the autumn season. She commits to repay the loan over a period of 12 months. Firuza is thankful for your generosity and help.

loans.use: Purchasing of the new clothing for increasing the range of goods.

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.en:
Lucinda G. D. L. is a member of community bank Obreras, which means "worker" in Spanish. She is married with four children and lives in Ayacucho. To support her family, Lucinda works as a mid-wife, as well as at an artisan workshop. With the help of her niece and son, she also runs a small kiosk with computers that offer internet services.

With her loan of 1800 soles (~$600 USD), she will invest in her various businesses by purchasing materials for the artisan shop, such as yarn, as well as an oven and more computers for her kiosk. With her savings, she hopes to reach her goal of providing for herself and her husband as they grow older.

loans.use: To purchase yarn for her artisan shop, as well as an oven  for her home and more computers for her internet kiosk business.

loans.name: Afito

texts.fr: Veuve  avec trois personnes à charges, madame Afito A. est née en 1955à Dagué. Elle est populaire dans le village à cause de son dynamisme et de son activité vente de médicaments génériques dans la pharmacie du village. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour approvisionner sa pharmacie en produits pour le bonheur des habitants du village et aussi pour sa propre survie car c’est cette activité qui la fait vivre et fait nourrir les personnes dont elle a la charge et surtout d’assurer la scolarité de ces enfants.
texts.en:
A widow with three people in her care, Ms. Afito A. was born in 1955 in Dagué. She is popular in her village because of her dynamism and her work selling generic medicines in the village pharmacy. She is requesting this loan to supply the pharmacy for the village inhabitants and their happiness and also for her own survival, since it is from this work that she makes a living and feeds those in her care. It also ensures the schooling of these children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell generic medicines

loans.name: Rosa Isela

texts.es: La señora Rosa Isela es ama de casa, esposa, trabajadora y muy pronto madre de un nuevo bebe, ella al igual que su esposo están solicitando este crédito para la colocación de protecciones en puertas y ventanas para mayor seguridad de la familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Isela is a hard-working homemaker and wife and will very soon be the mother of a new baby! She and her husband are requesting this loan to install security devices on their windows and doors in order to have a safer home for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hardware (security devices for windows and doors)

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
La Señora de Nombre Luz Maria García A. tiene la edad de 51 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Luz tiene 4 hijos de los cuales su edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 27 años labora por cuenta propia su otro hijo de 26 años también labora por cuenta propia y su otro hijo de 24 años que cursa el 4 año de secundaria ya que tiene que recurrir a clases por la noche debido a que trabaja por la noche y su otra hija que tiene la edad de 17 años, su esposo labora como capataz de campo, los propósitos de Doña Luz son de sacar delante su negocio por lo que tiene que generar ingresos para su familia ya que tiene que buscar el pan de cada día para su familia sus deseos son de vender mercadería al por mayor para suplir las diferentes necesidades que de sus clientes sus sueños son que la situación del país mejore para que los nicaragüense puedan optar por mas trabajos y mejoremos la economía del país.


La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería, la ubicación de su negocio es en el reparto. Ronal Altamirano de la escuela 2c abajo, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 5 años, sus inicios dan comienzo con otro tipo de negocio ella comienza vendiendo refrescos y desayunos a los paileros del Ingenio de Monte Rosa por lo que esta actividad la realiza diario por lo que ella distribuía los productos de comida  y su esposo la ayuda a recolectar el dinero del pago de los clientes y mas tarde decide implementar otra forma de generar ingresos para su familia como lo fue establecer una pulpería por lo que ahora tiene los dos negocios y su objetivo son de mantenerlos para que estos le proporcionen lo necesario para poder vivir por lo que necesita el financiamiento  para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de sus productos como los son granos básicos, pollo, crema y queso ya que tiene que surtir su pulpería para ofertar a sus clientes lo que estos necesitan.
texts.en:
Luz Maria García A. is 51 years old and married. Luz has four children: her eldest son is 27 and self-employed; her second son is 26 and also self-employed; her third son is 24 and studying in his fourth year of high school because he is going to night school as he works at night; her daughter is 17. Her husband works as a field foreman. Luz's goal is to continue in business as she needs the income for her family to put bread on the table. She wants to sell merchandise in bulk to satisfy her clients' demands. She dreams of a better future for her country, with more employment for Nicaraguans and a stronger Nicaraguan economy. Luz has run a grocery for 5 years. She began with a different line of business, selling refreshments and breakfast to the coppersmiths of the Monte Rosa sugar refinery: she would distribute the food daily and her husband helped by collecting the payments from her clients. She later decided to make money for her family by starting a grocery and she now has the two businesses. Her goal is to keep both businesses generating income for the family to live on. She needs this loan for working capital to buy staples such as grains, chicken, cream and cheese as she has to stock her grocery to offer her clients what they need.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley J. is 50 years old, married, and lives in Obay, Polanco Zamboamga del Norte. She has 4 children and 2 are in school. One of them is graduating this coming March. According to her, their life’s journey has been full of challenges.  Her husband works hard as a carpenter, sewer and driver so that he could give the best of things for his family but still it is not enough. To help out, Shirley began selling snacks at school.

Hearing about Paglaum MPC, she joined on May 17, 2006.  Shirley stopped selling snacks in the school and used her first loan was used to open a sari-sari store on their house.  She sells firewood and even fruits in her store. Recently, she asked for a $325 loan to buy merchandise for the sari-sari store & to repair their tricycle for her husband’s income. She hopes for the progress and success of her business so that they could raise their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for sale & to repair their motorcycle for hire

loans.name: Zinaba

texts.en: Zinaba A. is a single parent and has 1 child. She has received schooling through junior high. Zinaba sells local dishes known as Kenkey and also fries fish at Kotokoraba in Cape Coast, which she has done since 1999. Zinaba uses her income to pay for rent, utility bills and other financial expenses . Zinaba will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to buy more corn to increase the sales of kenkey to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Zinaba plans to save towards acquiring a piece of land for the building of the family house so that they can stop paying rent and also get a comfortable shelter for the family.

loans.use: Zinaba will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to buy more corn to increase the sales of kenkey to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Anim

texts.en:
L., age 56, lives in Siem Reap Province and is taking a loan of US$ 700 to build a new house for herself and her family. She is the mother of three children: all of them are married and live in different houses except the youngest family who own a tourist (12 chairs) transporting service is living with her.

Loeng who works as a local primary teacher is the husband of L.. L. plants bananas and some kinds of vegetables behind her house. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: To build a new house for herself and her family

loans.name: Ruziki Kigogo Group

texts.en:
Helene S., age 32, is married with three children (ages 15, 12 and 7). She has a business selling vegetables and fruits in Kigogo Fresh. She started the business 5 years ago and works daily from 6am until 10pm. Helen is able to earn about US$ 62 per month.

This will be Helene's eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, and she is excited to get started! She intends to use the loan to increase her stock and to buy material to make bricks to build her home.

Helene will share this loan with her loan group, Riziki Kigogo. The group has 16 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Helen is the first on the right in the blue dress.

loans.use: buying more vegetables and fruit for re-sale and bricks for her house

loans.name: Fakeye

texts.en: Fakeye D. is 30 years old and married with a child. He sells planks to make a living. He is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more planks to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Adelina Manuel

texts.pt:
Adelina Manuel M. nasceu em xai-xai distrito capital da província de Gaza ao sul de Moçambique, tem 36 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 3 filhos, com idade entre o primeiro com 17 o segundo com 13 e o terceiro tem 10 anos respectivamente.

Adelina é estudante da 10ªclasse curso nocturno, mudou se da cidade de xai-xai em 1986 na companhia da sua família onde vieram morar no distrito de Boane, local onde vivem até nesta data.

Adelina é trabalhadora nas bombas da Galpe como cozinheira desde 2000, obedecendo um calendário das 7 as 17h todos os dias excepto segunda-feira , deste emprego é paga um salário mensal de 2450,00mt assim conseguindo poupar mensalmente 500,00mt. Este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, teve 5 vezes na associação Gueguegue, com este pretende comprar material de construção afim de dar continuidade com a sua obra, e futuramente pretende solicitar empréstimo para construção de um estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Adelina Manuel M. was born in the Xai-Xai district of Gaza, in Southern Mozambique. She is 36 years-old, married, and the mother of three children, ages 17, 13 and 10. Since 1986 she has been living in the Boane district, with her family. Adelina is currently in 10th Grade, attending night classes. Since 2000 Adelina has been working as a cook at a GALP Gas Station. Working six days a week, from Tuesday-Sunday, 7:00 am until 5:00 pm, she makes a monthly salary of 2450,00mt, which allows her to save 500,00mt/month. This is her third loan with Hluvuku and the first with Kiva (she has had five loans with Associação Gueguegue in the past) . She plans to use this loan to buy construction material to continue building her house. In the future, she hopes to get a loan to invest in building a commercial space.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction material

loans.name: Nolberta

texts.es:
La señora Nolberta es Socia del banco comunal “Las Fronterizas” en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 54 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja desde hace 8 años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos y su primer prestamo fue de S/.300 soles, monto que le sirvió para adquirir más mercadería en su tienda de abarrotes.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles podrá adquirir una variedad de productos como arroz, azúcar, conservas, leche, aceite y enlatados. Ello le permitirá tener mejores ingresos y ayudará con los ingresos en su economía familiar
texts.en:
Nolberta is a member of Las Fronterizas Communal Bank in the Desaguadero district of Chucuito in the state of Puno. She is 54 years old, the mother of four children and a high school graduate. For the past eight years she has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement and her first loan was for 300 soles, money she used to buy more merchandise to sell in her general store. With this loan of 2,500 soles she will be able to purchase a variety of products like rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil and canned goods. This will help her to have a better income which contributes to the income of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil and canned goods to sell in a general store

loans.name: Sonomdendev

texts.en: Sonomdendev D. lives with his wife and two teenage daughters in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. His two daughters are in high school. Sonomdendev runs a small retail business selling food products, largely soft drinks, biscuits, and other items. He started his business in 2004 with the help of his wife. He rents a small stall in the local food market and sells the products his wife buys in wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Since launching his business, Sonomdendev has done well, more than quadrupuling his capital. In the future, he hopes to own a stall in the market, rather than rent. He has applied for this loan to buy more items to buy in Ulaanbaatar to sell to his customers.

loans.use: To buy food products from Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia

loans.name: Monica Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Mónica Elizabeth M. C. tiene 35 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Salaverry , provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudio secundarios incompletos , tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 dependen de ella económicamente. 
Mónica Elizabeth  se dedica a la preparación de tamales junto con su madre y su padre es el encargado de salir a venderlos por las calles de su distrito.  Ella actualmente ese encuentra laborando en la Municipalidad del Distrito de Salaverry.

Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió del Banco Comunal  “Las Emprendedoras II”, lo invirtió en la compra insumos como harina , aceite . aceitunas para la preparación de su tamales (plato tipico de la región). 
Con la ayuda del préstamo empezó a comprar sus insumos  al por mayor y así poder estar abastecida y generar mayor  ganancia.
Con el crédito de 1.200 soles lo invertirá en su negocio, en la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus tamales.
También tiene planificado en esta semana comprar productos de limpieza como desinfectantes, lejía. Ácido muriático, etc  los cuales va a ofrecer a sus amistades, compañeros de trabajo, vecinos y familiares.
Mónica tiene como sueño, incrementar su negocio para obtener dinero darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y poder ayudarlos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Sra. Monica Elizabeth M. C., 35, lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She started high school, but didn't finish. She has 5 children, two of whom still live at home. Monica Elizabeth earns a living making tamales with her mother. Her father is responsible for going out in neighborhood and selling the tamales. She works in the Salaverry district. She used the first loan that she received from Las Emprendedoras II community bank, for 300 soles, to buy supplies such as flour, cooking oil, olives for making tamales (a traditional dish of the region). The loan allowed her to buy supplies in bulk so that she could be well-stocked and increase her earnings. She will use the 1,200 soles loan to buy supplies for making her tamales. She also plans this week to buy cleaning products such as disinfectants, bleach, muriatic acid, etc. which she'll sell to friends, co-workers, neighbors and relatives. Monica dreams of growing her business to get more money and give her children a better quality of life and help with their schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus A. is from the village of Comon, Mambajao Camiguin. He is 34 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jesus operates his own business venture in the services sector. The main source of income for the business comes from providing services such as vulcanization and tire repair. Jesus has been engaged in this business for over 36 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jesus joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jesus is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase materials and equipment that will improve the services he offers. This will be his first loan from HSPFI, and Jesus plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase of materials and equipment that will improve the services offered

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina, a mother of seven children, comes from Mumias, a rural area in Kenya. She operates a second-hand clothing business in a small trading center called Harambee. Her business involves buying second-hand clothes from the border town and selling them in an open-air market on Tuesdays and Saturdays. On Saturdays, Amina also travels to Mumias open-air market to sell her merchandise (a distance of about 20 kms).
