El Trabajo que realiza Aidee, es muy diverso: Desde, costura, hasta un pequeño negocio de comestibles, que implementó en un de los ambientes de su casa. Hace apenas dos años que sus ganancias están incrementando considerablemente y esto debido a los diferentes ingresos que tiene. El negocio de compra y venta de pollos, la venta de hamburguesas en su localidad y la tienda de productos de primera necesidad; la hacen sentirse una mujer desarrollada. Por ello para más adelante desea expandir su negocio, no solo con comestibles, también una fuente de soda. Dando a su población; según sus propias palabras “un lugar donde puedan conseguir todo”. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y, como todas las integrantes de su banco comunal se siente satisfecha con el trabajo realizado, ya que les ayuda a salir adelante. Con el crédito solicitado, está pensando implementar su tienda de comestibles, con productos de primera necesidad y carne de pollo.
texts.en: Aidee, 45, is married to Pablo, 56, and they have 4 children.  But only Marco, who is 17, still lives with them.  They raised their children in their own home, located in the Santa Rosa neighborhood in the community of Puente Paucartambo (in the central Peruvian forest).  Aidee does a variety of types of work; she does sewing and also has a small food store that she set up in her house.  In just the last 2 years her earnings have increased considerably, owing to the different sources of income that she has. The business of buying and selling chickens, the sale of hamburgers in her area, and the store selling basic consumer goods make her feel like a very accomplished woman.  Because of this, in the future she wants to expand her business, not only with food but also to include sales of soda, giving the people in her area, according to her own words "a place where one can find anything." This is her 4th loan with MFP, and like all the members of her communal bank she feels satisfied with the work she does, which is helping her to get ahead.  With the loan she requests, she plans to stock her food store with basic consumer goods and chicken meat.

loans.use: to buy perishable food products and basic consumer goods for her store

loans.name: Zainura

texts.en:
Zainura is a widowed mother of two children. After the death of her husband, Zainura had to find ways to provide for herself and her two kids. For 17 years, she has had a small business selling clothing for children. It has now become the main source of income for her family. Zainura is a cheerful, hard-worker despite the difficulties she faces. She has received and repaid 18 loans from “IMON International” which has helped create stability for her business. Zainura is requesting a loan for 7500 Somoni for purchasing new goods. One of her long-term goals is to rent a second vending facility. In pursuit of her goal, Zainura plans to invest her extra profits into the expansion of her business. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase additional clothing for sale

loans.name: Teolfila

texts.en:
Teolfila L., 55, is from the village of Cabungaan Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Teolfila owns and operates a motor transportation services business. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Teolfila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teolfila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP to repair an existing vehicle in order to provide a better service. This will be her fifth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle in order to provide better service.

loans.name: Rossmery

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MAMA SIMONA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Poroy, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rossmery; ella tiene 28 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas y patos, la socia después lo distribuye a sus clientes que son los restaurantes y personas en general que le solicitan, sus clientes también se encuentran en Cusco y parte del Valle Sagrado 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más animales para su negocio y así poder tener más variedad de animales para  poder ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rossmery is a member of the "MAMA SIMONA” community bank which is located in Poroy district, in Cusco province and department.

Rossmery is 28 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 3 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business raising animals such as guinea pigs, chickens and ducks which she then distributes to her customers, including restaurants and people in general who request them.  Her customers are also to be found in Cusco and parts of Valle Sagrado.

Rossmery is requesting this loan to buy more animals for her business so that she can have a greater variety of animals to offer her customers.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy more animals for her business so that she has a greater variety of animals to offer her customers

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma A. is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

Fatuma runs a stall at the market from which she sells food to market dwellers and neighbors. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and improve her living standards.

With a 20,000 KES loan Fatuma wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and sugar. She hopes to establish a restaurant in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour and sugar

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en:
Augustin is 37 years old and owns a laundry company. Augustin is married and does not have children of his own, but he has two dependents. Augustin's well-organized shop has been open for 3 years and employs 10 people, opening at 5AM every day except Sunday.

Augustin is requesting a loan to purchase additional equipment for his employees. With the additional profits he hopes to receive from this, he intends to continue to expand his laundry business.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for his employees

loans.name: Thon

texts.en: Thon P., 49, is married with four children living at home in the Takeo province. She grows rice and raises animals, typically making US$3 each day. Her husband is a local doctor who typically makes about US$5 each day. Thon P. would like a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a plot of land to resell when the price goes up.

loans.use: To purchase land to resell.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SILKINCHANY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Jerónimo,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fortunata; la socia tiene 54 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de cuyes y pollos para luego venderlos a sus clientes, a la vez la socia se dedica a la agricultura ella siembra papa, maíz entre otros y luego lo vende de forma ambulatoria en los mercados y clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona bien alegre y responsable.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para sus animales como pasto, maíz, alfalfa entre otros y también fertilizantes y abono para su chacra.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the ” SILKINCHANY” communal bank.  The bank is located in the San Jerónimo district,  which belongs to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The associate is Señora Fortunata.  She is 54 years of age, married and has 4 children.  The associate fills her daily activities with the business of raising guinea pigs and chickens in order to later sell them to her clients.  At the same time, the associate is dedicated to agriculture. She sows potatoes and corn, among other crops, and later sells them on foot in the markets and to clients who ask for her.  The associate is a very happy and responsible person.

The associate requests the loan to purchase food for her animals such as grass, corn and alfalfa, among others, and also fertilizer and pesticides for her small farm. 

The associate is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy food for her animals such as grass, corn, and alfalfa, among others, and also fertilizer and pesticides for her small farm.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent is 31 years old and single. He sells home equipment, such as plates, glasses, spoons, etc. He is requesting a loan to buy more equipment in order to earn increased profits. With the profits and his savings he plans to build his own house.

loans.use: To purchase home equipment to sell

loans.name: La Divinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Divinas lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras ellas son Maribel del Socorro P., Yeni del Carmen Torres Cerrato y Daniel Iván B. Cerrato.
La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Maribel del Socorro P. de 31 años quien se dedica a la venta de ropa interior desde hace 4 años. Este negocio lo inicio con su liquidación en la zona Franca. 
Ella tiene dos hijos de 15 y 13 años respectivamente por los cuales trabaja arduamente e invertirá el crédito en mercadería para surtir su venta.
Los otros integrantes Yeni de 33 años es propietaria de una pulpería y Daniel Iván B. vende ropa de todo tipo.
texts.en:
The 'Las Divinas' group is made up of three hard-working, determined and enterprising people: Maribel del Socorro P., Yeni del Carmen Torres Cerrato and Daniel Iván B. Cerrato.

The group's coordinator is Maribel del Socorro P..  She is 31 years old and has been selling underwear for 4 years.  She started her business with her severance pay from a job in the duty-free zone.  Maribel has two children, aged 15 and 13, for whom she works very hard.  She will invest her loan in buying merchandise to stock her business.

The other members of this group are 33 year-old Yeni who owns a small grocery store and Daniel Iván Bejerrano who sells all kinds of clothes.

loans.use: to buy underwear

loans.name: Ghahraman

texts.en:
Ghahraman D. lives in Dovrus village, Syunik region, with his wife and son. Ghahraman’s son works at a school as a custodian, receiving a very small salary. Their main income comes from agriculture.  

Ghahraman’s financial means are not enough for him to develop his agriculture activity. He has applied to SEF for a loan to increase his herd and purchase seeds. Ghahraman has taken out several loans from SEF, and each time the loans have helped him to develop the business further.

loans.use: to pay for livestock and seeds.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 36 years old, married and blessed with a six-year-old child.  He is a clinical officer by profession and runs St. John Medical Services.  It has been five years since he started the business and has employed one person.  He hopes to open a nursing home and a fully equipped theatre in the future.  He has requested 15,000 KES to pay school fees for his six-year-old child.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his child

loans.name: Unidas De Santa Clara Group

texts.es:
El comite se encuentra en el 4º ciclo, las integrantes se mantienen unidas y pagan responsablemente sus cuotas.
Se encuentran muy animadas de permanecer en el grupo y se consideran muy buenas amigas. En sus reuniones planean las actividades mensuales que en grupo realizan.
La Sra. Mirta Marlene tiene su confitería, se dedica a ella y realiza los bocaditos dulces y salados por pedido, además sale a vender sandwiches, empanadas y chipas por la zona con ayuda de su hija de 12 años.
Es madre de tres niñas que van a la escuela y es por ellas que lucha cada día por salir adelante. Ella desea progresar más y por eso solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, harina, cremas dulces, leche, etc.
texts.en: This group is on their 4th loan cycle. The members are a united group and they make their payments responsibly. They are very eager to remain in the group and they consider themselves to be very good friends. During their meetings they plan the monthly activities for the group. Mirta Marlene has a confectionary. She makes the sweet and salty snacks herself, for which she takes orders. She also goes out to sell sandwiches, stuffed pastries, and tapioca cheese breads in the region with her 12-year old daughter’s help. She is the mother of three girls and they are in school. It is for their sake that she struggles each day to move forward. She wants to progress further and for this she requests a loan. She will purchase sugar, flour, sweet creams, milk, etc.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make sweet and savory snacks.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 46 years old. She is married and has 3 children.

Riza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,500 loan through NWTF. She would like to use the loan to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her sari-sari store.

Riza has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 12 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Riza aspires to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la Señora Maria Cristina, domiciliada en la Compañia Tacuapi a 40km de la oficina de Curuguaty.
Para el nombre del comité escogieron “San Blas” y actualmente esta en el segundo siclo, con 10 integrantes, todas ellas son mujeres muy sacrificadas y solidarias entre sí, para poder salir adelante juntas.
La sra. Ramona posee un copetín, o kiosko, donde vende bebidas y toda clase de comestibles preparados por ella misma, pues cada día realiza varios tipos de comidas rápidas como empanadas, hamburguesas, croquetas, y demás, para poder venderlos a las personas que muchas veces no pueden regresar a sus casas para almorzar o desayunar, entonces ella se encarga pulcramente de realizar sus comestibles y venderlos.
Gracias a la calidad de sus productos posee muchos clientes, y desea mantener ese nivel, por ello solicita el crédito a fin de adquirir bebidas e insumos para la preparación de sus alimentos.
texts.en:
María Cristina who lives in the Tacuapi Compañía 40 kilometers from the Curuguaty office spearheaded the formation of this committee.  The committee chose the name “San Blas” and they are in the second cycle with 10 members.  All the women are very self-denying and mutually supportive in order to get ahead together.

Ramona has a snack bar or kiosk where she sells beverages and all kinds of dishes prepared by herself.  She prepares all sorts of fast food daily like turnovers, hamburgers, croquettes, and others to sell to people who often can’t return home to have lunch or breakfast so she takes care of very hygienically preparing their meals and sell them.  Thanks to the quality of her products she has many customers and she wants to stay at this level so she asks for a loan in order to acquire beverages and ingredients to prepare her food.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare her food and to buy beverages.

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Macanja, Provincia de Tete ao norte de Mocambique casado e pai de 3 filhos de idades entre 20 a 27 anos. Fez o nivel superior e parou quando foi incorporado ao serviço militar obrigatorio. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua mae enviando algum valor para algumas despesas de casa.
Saiu de tete para Maputo em missão de serviço, trabalha como funcionario permanente das Forças de Defesa de Mocambique ha mais de 31 anos. Nao tem empregado  e recebe um salario de 20.612.70mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Ja teve emprestimos no BIM, que aplicou no inicio da construçao da sua casa. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem sao clientes desta instituiçao e este é o seu primeiro emprestimo no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construçao (cimento, vidros, barrotes e outros) para dar continuidade com o melhoramento da sua casa.
O seu sonho é ver a sua casa concluida e confortar melhor a sua familia. Pretende comprar uma viatura ,para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Arnaldo was born in Macanja district, in the northern Mozambican province of Tete. He is a married father of 3 children, aged between 20 and 27 years old. He completed higher level studies before leaving school to fulfil his military service obligations. He lives in his own home with his family and supports his mother, sending her money to help out with her household expenses.
He left Tete and came to Maputo during his military service. He has been in permanent work as an office clerk for the Mozambique Defence Forces for 31 years. He does not have any employees and he receives 20,612.70MZN each month, which he uses for household expenses and puts some away as savings in his bank account (BIM).
He has already borrowed money from BIM, which he used to begin building his house. He heard about Hluvuku through friends who are also Hluvuku clients. This is his first loan of 25,000MZN and he will use it to buy building materials, such as cement, glass, timber and other materials, to continue with his home improvement.
His dream is to see his house finished and see his family in greater comfort. He would like to buy a car and he intends to apply for further Hluvuku loans to achieve this aim.

loans.use: to buy building materials (cement, glass, timber and other materials).

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 43 years old and married. She has 2 children. Her husband is a driver. She earns money by selling pork in a small market. The family lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hoa intends to take a loan to purchase many kinds of pork to expand her business and to better meet the demands of her customers. She hopes that through the loan she will be abL. to increase her income to improve her family's living conditions and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase many kinds of pork.

loans.name: Yasinta

texts.en:
Yasinta is 25 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Yasinta has had a small retail shop for one year that sells sugar.         
	
To help expand her business, Yasinta has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Yasinta hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself.  In the future, Yasinta hopes to expand her business. Yasinta is a member of BRAC’s enterprise program, (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale

loans.name: Mahoua

texts.fr:
Née il y'a 44 ans à Bougouanou (république de Côte d’Ivoire),  Mahoua est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle réside  avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Sanoubougou I Kapel Kourou, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après plusieurs activités sans succès, cette femme s’est initié depuis plus de dix années à cette activité  d’achat et de vente d’habillements et de parures (pagnes wax, tissus brodés, sacs à main, colliers, perles etc.). Elle achète ses marchandises sur places auprès des commerçants grossistes de Sikasso avant de les revendre à sa place au marché du quartier où ses marchandises sont beaucoup sollicitées de sa clientèle (composée essentiellement des femmes de ménages et vendeuses de condiments du marché) pour la qualité des ses articles.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis quelques mois.  Elle est est à son premier prêt individuel qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 15 complets de tissus brodé, 10 pièces de pagne wax, 10 sacs à main, des colliers des femmes. 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce premier prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts.
texts.en: Born 44 years ago in Bougouanou (in the Republic of Cote d'Ivoire), Mahoua is a married women and the mother of seven children. She resides with her husband and their children in a large traditional family in Sanoubougou I Kapel Kourou, an outlying district of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After several unsuccessful businesses, this woman became introduced, over ten years ago, to the business of buying and selling clothing and finery, such as Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), embroidered fabrics, handbags, necklaces, beads, etc. She buys her merchandise locally from wholesale merchants in Sikasso and then resells them from her spot at the neighborhood market where her goods are in high demand by her customers (composed essentially of housekeepers and condiment sellers at the market) for the quality of her items. Concerned about further satisfying her burgeoning customer base, Mahoua decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She is now on her first individual loan, which will be used to buy: 15 outfits of embroidered fabrics, 10 lengths of Wax pagne cloth, 10 handbags, and some women's necklaces. With this loan, Mahoua envisions making a monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to increase her working capital, to help cover family expenses, and to pay the loan interest.

loans.use: to buy clothing and finery

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a widow with seven children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and water bills.

For the past 15 years, she has operated a quarry business, selling wholesale to constructors. She dreams of establishing a goat meat business in the future.

With a Kshs 30,000 loan Dzame wants to purchase stones for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase stones for resale.

loans.name: Lamiya

texts.en:
Lamiya is a farmer. She is 21 years old, married, and has three children. Lamiya puts a lot of enthusiasm into the development of her farming efforts because she is aware that it can help her children. Lamiya grows carrots, potatoes, cucumbers and potatoes. She wants to maximize her profits and place her children into a school. Her husband is a workman at construction field. His salary is too small to cover family needs. 

Lamiya needs to buy lubricants and mineral fertilizers to recondition the land, and seeds for sowing, in order to have a good harvest in the upcoming season. Her wish to improve the living conditions of her family brings her to request a loan to increase the quality and quantity of her harvest. Lamiya requests a 1,000 AZN loan. She wants to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Lyuba

texts.ru:
Люба – вдова. Она из городка Королево, где она занимается продажей женской одежды. У Любы – собственный магазин женской одежды. Конкуренция отсутствует как таковая. Люба занимается торговлей уже 11 лет. В товаре е нее 85 000 гривен. Доход составляет 8 000 гривен в месяц. 

Любе необходим кредит в размере 18 000 гривен длятого, чтобы приобрести 40 комплектов женской одежды, реализовать их и за счет этого увеличить свой доход. Люба планирует в будущем открыть еще одну торговую точку и помогать своему сыну, который женился совсем недавно. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Lyuba is a widow.  She is from the town of Korolyovo, where she is involved in sales of women's clothing.  Lyuba has her own women's clothing store and has no significant competition.  She has been involved in sales for 11 years.  She has 85000 hryvnia invested in her merchandise and a monthly income of 8000 hryvnia.  Lyuba needs a loan in the sum of 18000 hryvnia in order to purchase 40 sets of women's clothing, sell them and, thus, increase her income.  Lyuba plans to open another retail outlet in the future and help her son, who recently got married.

loans.use: to purchase 40 sets of women's clothing

loans.name: Ablayo

texts.fr:
Ablayo est une femme  âgé(e) de 29 ans. Elle est mariée à un gestionnaire.
Ablayo est couturière de profession et ajoute à cette fonction la vente des pagnes afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients depuis 2005. Elle a ouvert son atelier dans un quartier de la place et achète ses marchandises à Lomé.
Ablayo a requis son premier crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes et prendre le reste pour aménager son atelier.
texts.en: Ablayo is a 29-year-old woman who is married to an administrator. Since 2005, she has been a clothier by profession and has included the sale of pagnes (colorful West African cloth) in order to satisfy her customers further. She opened her own shop in a local neighborhood, and she buys her merchandise from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Ablayo has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy pagne cloth and to use the rest to renovate her workshop.

loans.use: to buy traditional cloth

loans.name: Shamshad Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad bibi is 31 years old and married with five sons. Two of her sons go to school, but the others don't. Her husband is an electrician by profession, and  offers his customers electricity repairing services. He is very skillful in his business and has been operating it for the past 15 years.

Shamshad herself is involved in a sewing business. She does sewing & embroidery works at home by receiving orders from her neighboring clients. She uses her income to pay for utilities.

Shamshad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy electricity repairing tools, like a drill machine and pliers, to provide better services to his customers. She is hopeful that the loan investment will be profitable one for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy electricity repairing tools.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines. Marilyn has been in this business for eight years now.

Marilyn requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sacks of soybeans and firewood.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucía tiene 68 años D. edad, está felizmente casada con José, con quien tiene 9 hijos. D. ellos solo 1 está en su poder, ya que los demás tienen sus propias familias. Vive en su casa propia en el distrito D. San Luis D. Shuaro. Lucía, desD. pequeña, se dedica a las labores del campo. Aprendió a trabajar arduamente gracias a la influencia D. japoneses y nativos D. su zona. Lucía es huérfana, pero como su vida inició lejos D. sus familiares ahora, a su edad pueD. disfrutar D. una amplia familia, pues sus 9 hijos le dieron 33 nietos. “Me siento contenta y recompensada con mi familia”, menciona. Cuenta con terrenos agrícolas propios, en ellos produce café, plátanos y palta; D. los que obtiene buenas ganancias. Así también, esta dulce abuelita, tiene un negocio en el que venD. abarrotes, ropa, artículos D. cocina, zapatos, etc. Este negocio ha crecido, ya que Lucía inició esta actividad desD. los 19 años. “Al día obtengo, con suerte, 120 soles y cada 15 días compro la mercadería para mi tienda, me va bien”, explica. Con el tiempo, no podrá esforzarse demasiado en sus sembríos, así que continuará con su bodega. Espera ver felices a sus hijos y nietos, a los que apoya económicamente frente a cualquier situación. Éste sería su préstamo número 5 D. MFP, por esa razón promete ser puntual en los pagos, como lo fue anteriormente. En cuanto a su trabajo con su banco comunal, muestra alegría y confianza entro del grupo, por que la mayoría son familiares suyos. Invertirá el dinero del crédito en la compra D. mercadería para su negocio. Comprará ropa y algunos artículos para la campaña naviD.ña.
texts.en:
Lucía, 68, is happily married to José; they have nine children.  Only one of them is still in their care because the others have already formed their own families.  She lives in her own house in San Luis D. Shuaro District.  

Since she was a little girl, Lucía has worked in the fields.  She learned to work hard thanks to the influence of the Japanese people and of people native to her zone.  Lucía is an orphan and even though her life began far from relatives she can now enjoy a large family because her nine children have given her 33 grandchildren.  “I feel happy and rewarded with my family,” she mentions.  

She owns farmland where she grows coffee, bananas and avocadoes that produce good profits.  In addition, this sweet grandmother has a business selling groceries, clothes, kitchenware, shoes, etc.  This business has grown since Lucía started it when she was 19 years old.  “If I’m lucky, I earn 120 soles daily and every two weeks I buy merchandise for my store; I’m doing well,” she explains.  In time, she will no longer be able to exert much effort anymore in her fields so she will continue with her store.  She hopes to see her children and grandchildren happy; she supports them economically in face of any situation.

This will be MFP loan #5 for her so she commits to being punctual with her payments like she’s been previously.  As far as work in the communal bank is concerned, she displays joy and trust within the group because most of them are her relatives.  She will use the money from the loan to buy merchandise for her store.  She will buy clothes and some items for the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes and Christmas-themed items for the home.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La sra Cirila es una señora muy trabajadora, que se dedica a la produccion de leche cruda tiene cuatro cabezas de ganado lechero, que las cuida en su casa, ella casi vive en uan zona urbana y para evitarse problemas con los vecinos lleva a comer pasto a sus vacas a lugares alejados. 

La sra Cirila es una mujer emprendedora que le gusta su trabajo.Su esposo radica mayormente en la provincia Chapare, entonces ella se queda sola con su hija, quien esta estudiando en el colegio aun. La Sra. Cirila desea que con la compra de una vaca mas pueda ayudarle a generar mas ingresos y darle a su ultima hija mejores oportunidades y que pueda estudiar luego una carrera. Es asi que Cirila solicita el credito para comprar una cabeza de ganado lechero.
texts.en:
Cirila is a hardworking woman.  She has four dairy cows that she raises in her home and she specializes in raw milk.  She lives in an urban zone and takes her cows to graze in distant pastures to avoid problems with her neighbors.

Cirila is an enterprising woman who likes to work.  Her husband mostly stays in the Chapare province, so she stays with her daughter who attends the local school.  Cirila would like to buy another cow in order to increase her income and provide better opportunities to her daughter, so that she can study and have a career.  Cirila is asking for this loan to buy another dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a mik cow.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: This is 38-year-old Salamatu. She is married, and has 3 children, ages 21, 18 and 14 years. In 1999, Salamatu established her rubbers, clothes and slippers business. She began her business because she was trained in business. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,100,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Salamatu requires a loan in order to buy more plastic, clothing and slippers for her business. In the future, Salamatu plans to open her business in another area in the city and build her own house.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more plastic, clothing and slippers for her business

loans.name: Tharcisse

texts.en:
Tharcisse is married and has one 4-year-old child. He has been a rice farmer for 15 years. He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs, and to buy seeds and fertilizers during rice production time. 

With profits the from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers, and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida, 44 years old, is married and has 4 sons and a daughter. Her eldest son sells samosay, a local food made of flour, and two of her children are studying. Khalida is a housewife who stays at home to carry out household responsibilities.

Khalida's husband sells peanuts. He purchases them at wholesale prices and sells them for a profit from his shop. He is a very hardworking person who works with great dedication to fulfill the needs of his family. Khalida has applied for a loan from KIVA's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. He will use the loan to buy peanuts in larger quantities and of better quality, which will allow him to sell for higher profits. He is very experienced and knows the ups and downs of his business very well. Khalida is confident that an investment will help him make more income for the family.

Note:In the photo, Khalida is holding a book (called Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy peanuts to resell

loans.name: Sovorn's Group

texts.en:
Sovorn is a 38-year-old mother of two children. She lives in a village located in the Sa Ang district, where growing vegetables is commonly the main source of family income. Like other villagers, she has been growing taro as her primary business to support her living. She has been in this business for ten years. 

Sovorn is the second cycled client with VisionFund, and now she leads a borrowers' group of three members who have just joined, each of whom has been with VisionFund for from one to two years. As the leader of the group now applying for a loan, she will use this loan to buy taro seedlings and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow more and healthier taros and to earn more income to better support her family.

loans.use: To buy taro seedlings and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en:
Kassim is a 31-year-old single man who owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for himself. 

Kassim has operated as a mason for the past 10 years. In addition, he is a fisherman. His potential clients are the local area villagers. He faces a major challenge of customers delaying to pay their debts on time. He dreams of expanding his business. 

With the KSHS 15,000, he wants to purchase construction materials like building blocks, cement, and spades for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to uplift his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials like building blocks, cement, and spades

loans.name: Dougoutiguila Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe Dougoutiguila Benkadi 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Soké, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec    MINATA OUMAR  , debout au milieu sur  la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, des petits matériels agricoles, des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,75 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Dougoutiguila Benkadi 2" are married women averaging 35 years of age and three children each all living in traditional families in Soké, a village in San (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution. The past loans have indeed been paid back. 

The crop grown is rice, as is the case with MINATA OUMAR, standing in the middle in the photo. With her loan, she intends to buy sundry equipment, farm inputs, and seeds and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining  0.75 hectare.

The produce will be sold in the village and at the San market after the harvest. The customer base is composed of men and women. 

She expects to make an average profit of 100,000 francs CFA per planting season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and to buy farm inputs, sundry equipment, and some seeds

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is 75 years old and is often referred to as a really hardworking individual. As a group leader, she is representing her group in Webuye District, formed by 15 farmers, including herself.

Jane has been a farmer for more than 50 years, and has worked with One Acre Fund for a while now, having joined for the first time in 2011 because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Not only will she get maize seeds and fertilizer with her loan, but also two solar lights in order to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. She decided that she will use the profits she gains from this year’s harvest to send her children to school.

With this loan, Jane’s Group will receive a total of 14 solar lights as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Vicenta

texts.en:
My name is Maria I., I sell ice cream, frozen fruits, fruit cakes, and ice cream cones. I have had my business for 3 years and it is located in the city of Danli. My children help me in the store and my earnings help cover family expenses. My goal is to expand my inventory in order to increase sales and with the profits, improve my business, support my family as well as a provide a quality education for my children.

Loan Use: Purchase ice cream, sticks, fruits, cups, bags, sugar, colorants, cones.

Mi nombre es Maria I., me dedico a la venta de ice cream, paletas de frutas, charamuscas de frutas, conos, tengo mi necogio hace 3 años y esta ubicado en la ciudad de Danli, tengo la ayuda de mis hijos para la atencion de los clientes, mi negocio me genera ingresos para cubrir con los gastos de mi familia, mi meta es poder aumentar mi inventario para tener mayores ventas y con la ganancia que obtenga poder acondicionar mejor mi negocio, sustentar la alimentacion de mi familia y un buen estudio a mis hijos.

loans.use: Compra de ice cream, paletas, frutas, vasos, bolsas, azucar, colorantes, conos,

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en: Tarana is 48 year old IDP from Jabrayil region that is still under occupation. After arrival and settlemnt in Beylagan town she rented a small place in the market to contribute to her family. Having no funds of her own she applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed 4 loans first in 2001 amounting $200 and her last in 2006 amounting $900. Now she is in need of another loan to increase the inventory.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods

loans.name: Surkhay

texts.en: Surkhay is a local resident of Beylagan. He is engaged in sheep breeding. He has 20 sheep at the moment. He sells sheep at the local animal market or slaughters them. He takes the herd out to graze very often. He needs to buy new heads of animals when he sells or slaughters some of them in order to keep up the number of the herd. Now he needs to buy 10 new sheep. His own funds are short and he has applied to Normicro Beylagan branch for a loan. He needs $400 to buy 10 sheep.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep to add to the herd

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a thirty year old father of two young children, ages 1.5 and 4. He has had his business selling bicycle parts for two years. Operating out of Lupida, a small town in western Kenya, Peter sells all types of parts, including tires, rims, breaks, spokes, and peddles. 

Currently, the biggest obstacle he faces is a lack of capital. There is high demand for bicycle parts in the area because bicycles are the central form of transportation in the region. It is the main way that people move from town to town, from the farm to home, etc, and bicycles are even used as an integral form of commercial transportation. Called ‘Boda bodas’, young men put pads onto the back of their bikes and take people for rides for about 10 Kenya Schillings (1 USD is about 67 Ksh).

As it is, Peter receives 10-20 customers per day, and is able to collect a daily profit of about 150-200 Ksh. He hopes to receive a Kiva loan so that he can increase his supply of bicycle parts, and believes that with a loan, he can increase his profits to 300-400 Ksh per day. 

Peter’s business helps him to provide for his two young children. He is able to give them the basic necessities, but in the near future he will have to start paying for school fees. While primary education is provided by the government in Kenya, families still face minor costs for uniforms and books. Moreover, when his children reach secondary school, he will have to pay much more substantial costs in order to educate them. Peter has ambition to grow his business to meet future challenges, and hopes that a Kiva loan will help get him there.

loans.use: To increase his stock of bicycle spare parts.

loans.name: Masoma

texts.en: Masoma lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is educated, and she is a widow. Her husband died of cancer 5 years ago. She has a son. She is a very enterprising and responsible woman. She has a carpet weaving shop. She learned this business in Pakistan during the war in Kabul. Now she needs money for her business. She wants to take a group loan to purchase all her materials. She would love to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a 53 year-old father of six and resides in Makangarawe in Dar es Salaam City. He has been in business for the past 10 years, now operating a charcoal business.

His business has grown tremendously and has acquired many new customers. He is in need of USD 350 so that he can expand his business.

loans.use: To further expand charcoal business

loans.name: Juju

texts.en: Juju is 24 years old and a mother of a 3-year-old daughter. She has a small shop that sells snacks, fried foods, and household goods. She has been running her business since joining MBK. Her husband is a farmer, but sometimes he earns extra money by driving people on his motorcycle. He usually earns $1.50 per day. She requests a $100 loan to buy more snacks and goods to fill her shop. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To fill the shop with more goods.

loans.name: Ismara

texts.es:
Ismara R. is a married woman with two children. Along with her husband she is responsible for her children's education. She started her business selling clothing three years ago with a starting capital of $1500 which she and her husband saved together.

Now Mrs. R. has a location in the central market of Chinandega and she is one of the most efficient sellers and through her dedication and hard work she starts early in the morning and works until dusk. Thanks to her work she has been able to be notably successful in her business.

It is important to mention that Mrs. R. has received 14 loans through CEPRODEL and is a committed worker. She has repaid all of her loans in the time and way agreed. Thanks to these loans she has been able to increase her sales and above all pay for her children's studies. She hopes that one day both of her children will be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Ismara R. es una dama casada y con dos hijos a su cargo el cual junto con su esposo tiene la responsabilidad de velar por su educación. Se dedica a la venta de ropa iniciando este negocio hace tres años con un capital inicial de U$ 1500 obtenido por ahorros de ella y su cónyuge.

Hoy en día la señora R. se encuentra ubicada en un tramo (local) dentro del mercado Central de Chinandega siendo una de las vendedoras mas eficientes ya que por su dedicación y gran esfuerzo inicia su labor desde tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el anochecer y gracias a esto ha podido superar su negocio de manera notable.

Es de suma necesidad señalar que la señora R. ha obtenido 14 créditos con Ceprodel siendo una fiel trabajadora ya que al tener tres años de recibir estos créditos ha cumplido en tiempo y forma con el pago de estos. Por esta razón es que ha podido notar mejoras en las ventas y sobre todo ha podido pagar los estudios de sus dos infantes que anhela que algún día lleguen a ser hombres profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Diana's Group

texts.en:
Diana, Silvia, and Elma have been members of the community bank “Universo” for a little over one year. In that time they have learned how to improve their health, use their money more effectively, and the importance of saving.

Diana is twenty years old. She buys spices in Ayacucho and then travels around the region and sells them at various local markets. In addition, she is studying economics at the local university.

Silvia is 28 and has two children. She also buys spices in Ayacucho and sells them at various regional markets. She was able to start this business one year ago with her first loan from the community bank. Before that she sold candies, but is able to make a larger profit with her new business.

Elma is 36 and has two teenage children. She buys plastic wares in Ayacucho and then sells them in other markets around the region. She has been running this business for 18 months. In addition, she owns a kiosk where she sells things like magazines and candy.

Diana, Silvia, and Elma need loans of 400, 200, and 200 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying spices, and more supplies for their kiosk.

The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving and each associate has an interest earning savings account. Diana, Silvia, and Elma are saving to buy a house, pay for school, and stocking their kiosk. They dream of being an economist, owning a home, developing their business, and seeing their children be successful.

loans.use: Diana, Silvia, and Elma need loans of 400, 200, and 200 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying spices, and more supplies for their kiosk.

loans.name: Guljahon

texts.ru:
Guljahon N. lives in Yavan. She is 31 years old, is married and has 2 children. Guljahon has a college education and works as a high school teacher. In addition she raises livestock and owns dairy cows. She uses the milk for her family and for sale to wholesalers. This business allows Guljahon to earn an additional income and to provide markets with fresh milk. She plans to use her loan to buy an addition cow. She will thereby increase milk production and her income. She plans to pay back the loan over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Начмиева Гульджахон проживает в городе Яван . Возраст 31 год, замужем имеет 2 детей. Образование высшее, по профессии и работает учителем в средней школе.Кроме того занимается животноводством. Имеет коров для получения молока. Молоко использует для семьи и для продажи. Продает молоко оптовикам. Этот бизнес дает возможность получить дополнительный доход и еще обеспечить рынки свежим молоком.Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы купить еще одну корову. Этим она увеличит объем получаемой продукции, что позволит ей получать дополнительный доход. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Asha's Group

texts.en:
I am Asha M.. I was married 19 years ago and have four children: two boys and two girls. All of them attend school except for my eldest daughter, who works at a beauty salon. My deepest wish is for my children to finish school and prosper in life. My husband creates beautiful dresses for women, which he sells at his ready-made garments store, and I request a loan to enable him to expand the store.

This loan will be shared amongst my group, consisting of: Maya B., who needs a loan for her family’s used items business; Shabana A., who is also borrowing for her ready-made garments trade; Rukhsana Y., who sells cloth, and Najma A.’s son, who has a motorcycle repair workshop.

loans.use: To expand my husband's ready-made garments business

loans.name: Mwanamkasi's Cassanora B Group

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is 33 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages18 and 14 years old. Mwanamkasi sells clothes. She started in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 4.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Fatuma and Tima, who sell bananas and fish.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis has a project in mind to be able to sell appliances in a stable way. He started his own business a year and a half ago, with the help of one of his brothers, distributing used appliances , principally washing machines and 24 inch televisions, which he fixes and sells at modest prices. He travels to the cities of Lima and Arequipa to sell them but he started to expand his market to other cities such as Nazca and Ica and will soon be able to open a rented space in the city of Lima. Luis follows his dream working hard to fix these appliances, which is the reason for which he is requesting a loan with the goal of investing it in the purchase of a great quantity of parts.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Luis, tiene un proyecto en mente poder vender artefactos de manera estable y emprendió su propio negocio hace un año y medio por medio de uno de sus hermanos que trabaja en una empresa exportadora de artefactos usados, los cuales arregla para luego ofertarlos a módicos precios, principalmente lavadoras y televisores de 24 pulgadas el se va de viaje a las ciudades de Lima y Arequipa para venderlos pero empezó a expandir su mercado a otras ciudades como Nazca e Ica, y próximamente podrá establecerse en un local alquilado en la ciudad de Lima, mientras tanto Luis persigue ese sueño trabajando arduamente en el arreglo a conciencia de estos artefactos y es la razón por la cual ahora solicita un préstamo a fin de invertirlos en la compra de mayor cantidad de repuestos.

loans.use: To buy the parts to continue with the repair of appliances.

loans.name: Teth

texts.en:
Teth N., 24, is a mother of one little child and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She is a garment factory worker and earns around $3.30 each day. Her husband, Seth Visal, has had a business running a motor-taxi since 1999. In one day, he makes $3.50. This couple also takes care of an old father and mother.

To increase their income to help support their extended family, they are requesting a loan to help purchase a small tractor. They will then rent the tractor to other famers.

loans.use: To purchase a small tractor for rental.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra has been teaching for 24 years. She is 46 years old, married, her husband is a carpenter and helps with household expenses. She has a son of 9 years of age who is receiving his primary education. Sandra's dream is to be able to finish building her home, and the loan she is looking for is to purchase tiles for her home. Sandra also sells cooked frijoles and popsicles from her home, and in this way is able to earn other income and satisfy the needs of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Sandra desde hace 24 años se dedica a la docencia, tiene 46 años de edad, es casada, su marido es carpintero y le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Tiene un hijo de 9 años de edad, quien se encuentra estudiando la educación primaria. El sueño de Doña Sandra es poder terminar de construir su casa de habitación, el préstamo lo está solicitando para la compra de cerámica la cual pondrá en la sala de su vivienda. Doña Sandra también se dedica a la venta de frijoles cocidos y paletas de helado en su casa de habitación, para así poder tener otros ingresos y satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.

loans.use: To purchase tiles for the floor of her home

loans.name: Linda Aracely

texts.es:
Linda started her business in order to obtain a better income, given that her husband's wages are barely enough to pay for utilities. She started 3 years ago with a large mirror and a chair. Afterwards, she bought a highchair in order to give children haircuts. Later, with some financing, she bought what she needed for her beauty salon- a hair dryer, clips, flat iron, thinning scissors, etc. She also started a small shop selling gifts and stuffed animals in her living room, which is the same space she uses for her beauty salon business.

She needs a loan of US $650 to purchase materials for her beauty salon and another sofa. She plans to repay the loan in 6 months.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Linda inició el negocio para tener un mejor ingreso, ya que el sueldo de su esposo apenas y les alcanza para pagar los servicios primarios. Comenzó hace 3 años, empezó con un espejo grande y una silla, después compro la periquera para cortar el cabello a niños, después con un financiamiento que obtuvo, compro lo que le hacia falta en su estética como pistola de aire, tenazas, plancha de pelo, tijeras de grafilear, etc., y también inicio en el mismo espacio de la estética, la cual esta instalada en lo que fue la sala de su casa, el negocio de venta de regalos y peluches.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $650 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar material para la estética y otro sillón.

loans.use: Purchase working materials

loans.name: Gulizor

texts.ru:
Сафаровой Гулизор 30 лет и она замужем. После окончания Вуза она захотела открыть свое дело, в котором помогли родители. Она 4 года как занимается торговлей женскими одеждами. Данный момент она арендует лавку на оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. У нее самые востребованные товары производства Турции.  В ее ассортименте товара можно увидеть махровые и велюровые халаты, хлопчатобумажные и шелковые пижамы и пеньюары, также очень красивые постельные белье и полотенца хорошего качества. Закупает товар у поставщиков из Китая . Для Гулизор качество товара очень важно, может поэтому у нее много постоянных клиентов.  
Гулизор хочет увеличить наименование товара и соответственно увеличить свой товарооборот. С помощью программы Кива она хочет получить займ в сумме 3000 сомони.
texts.en:
Gulizor S. is 30 years old and married. After graduating from university she decided to start her own business in which she got help from her parents. She has been selling women's clothing for four years now. At this time she is renting a space on the Kovron market in the city of Dushanbe. She sells merchandise from Turkey which are in very high demand. Some of the items in her stock include terry and velour robes, cotton and silk pajamas and peignoirs (undergarments), and also very beautiful bedding sets and high quality towels. She buys the items from manufacturers in China. The quality of her merchandise is very important to Gulizor and this is probably why she has so many regular customers.

Gulizor wants to increase the variety of her merchandise and accordingly increase sales and circulation of her inventory. With the help of Kiva she wants to get a loan in the amount of 3,000 somoni ($900USD).

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy robes

loans.name: Anne Del Carmen

texts.es: La profesora Anne del Carmen, trabaja como docente en el Instituto San Sebastián, de Acoyapa con 23 años de servicio, es muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajo, como también por sus alumnos, está casada, tiene un hijo de 23 años el cual cursa estudios universitarios. Está solicitando su 5to. crédito el cual utilizará para levantar una pared donde hará una división entre la sala y la cocina. Es una excelente cliente habiendo pagado sus créditos anteriores en las fechas estipuladas en su plan de pago, éstos le han servido para ir mejorando su vivienda y asi poder gozar en su jubilación de una vivienda digna la que siempre soño para ella y su hijo; A pesar de sus 50 años es una profesora dinámica y muy entregada a su labor para formar jóvenes que lleven una base educativa y moral a las universidades.
texts.en:
Teacher Anne del Carmen, works as an instructor at the San Sebastián of Acoyapa Institute, with 23 years of service. She is very well liked by her coworkers, as well as by her students. She is married and has a son of 23 years who studies at the university. She is requesting her 5th loan which she will use to raise a wall where she wants a divider between the living room and the kitchen. She is an excellent client, having paid her previous loans on the dates stipulated in her payment plan. These have served to continue improving her dwelling and in this way to be able to enjoy a worthy home in her retirement; the one that she always dreamed of for her and her son. In spite of her 50 years, she is a dynamic teacher and very devoted to her work of forming young people that bring an educational and moral foundation to the universities.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall between the living room and kitchen in her house.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel O. is a 42-year-old, single man. He lives in Benin City in the Edo State of Nigeria.

To earn a living, he is in the printing business; more specifically, he uses his printer to print designs for his customers. Now, he is requesting a loan in the amount of N70,000 ($600) to purchase a second-hand computer for designing purposes. By doing so, he will be able to reduce his costs because he is currently completing his design jobs elsewhere. In turn, he firmly believes that he will generate an increase in his profits. He thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a computer for design purposes

loans.name: Huerta Ramos

texts.es:
La Señora J. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del Centro Poblado de Chimbo, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Tiene 34 años de edad, es madre de 6 hijos que aún estudian, es casada y su esposo trabaja en el Valle de Ite, lugar donde siembra ají para luego venderlo, ambos se dedican a ese negocio. 

Con el primer préstamo obtenido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 500, compró un chanchito para engorde y luego venderlo para pagar su préstamo. Tiene un año trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la compra y venta de ají, el cual compra en Desaguadero y luego lo vende en Moquegua.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 5 cuotas, comprará un quintal de ají.

loans.use: Comprará un quintal de ají.

loans.name: Feagiai

texts.en: Feagiai T., 42, is married with four children. She is starting a taro and vegetable farming business. She sells to the village people two days a week. She is a new member and has received no previous loans with SPBD. Feagiai expects her weekly net cash flow to be 40 Tala (~$12 USD). SPBD loans are Feagiai’s only access to capital because she did not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She would like a loan of $275 to buy fertilizer, spades, and bush knives.

loans.use: To start her vegetable farming business

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Bertha es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco”, en el sector cuatro, comunidad de Sucano, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; de 36 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, y es madre soltera y posee estudios de secundaria incompleta (cuarto de secundaria).
Trabaja hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos e inicio su negocio de compra y venta de ganado (ovino, vacuno y porcinos), su primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles que los invirtió en la compra de mas ganado para poder engordarlo y venderlo.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, monto que destinará a la compra de mas ganado (ovinos, porcinos y vacunos) ya que ella posee pastos cultivados y es mas fácil engordar ganado, su ganado lo vende en pie en la ferias ganaderas de Pilcuyo y en carne en los mercados de Ilave y Puno.  De esta manera contribuirá a mejorar la calidad educativa de sus hijos; asimismo se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en cinco cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of "Las Brisas del Río Blanco" Communal Bank located in sector four of the Sucano community of the Pilcuyo district in El Collao province in the state of Puno. She's 36 years old, has three children, is a single mother and has an incomplete secondary school education (equivalent of the 10th grade). She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years and started her business buying and selling cattle, sheep and pigs. Her first loan was for 300 soles that she invested in the purchase of more cattle that she could fatten and sell. With this loan of 1,500 soles she will buy cattle, sheep and pigs because she already owns the pasture land and it's easier to raise them. She will sell her animals in the fairs of Pilcuyo and the meat in the markets of Puno. In this way she will contribute to the quality of education of her children. She promises to pay back the loan on time in five monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle, sheep and pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Ahamada's Group

texts.en: Ahamada H. is a member of Akuwa Ekibono group in Jinja. He is a married man with 6 children and he cares for 4 other relatives. Ahamada has been managing his retail shop for 9 years, a shop he created from the profits got from his farming business, and this is now mainly managed by his wife. Apart from building a house for his family, he has also bought another plot of land with the hope of constructing residential houses that will cater for his children’s school fees up to University level. He needs a loan to help with employing labor on his farm to supplement the force employed by his wife, and to buy seedlings. The balance will help to restock his retail shop with more products.

loans.use: Restock his shop, buy seedlings and hire labor for his farm.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary U. sells foodstuffs. She loves this business because she makes a lot of profit. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of $475 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She is 38 years old and married with four children. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia es socia del Banco Comunal La Paz, Amelia vive en la comunidad de Yanama que se ubica a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Amelia es casada, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Amelia se dedica a la venta de golosinas en la puerta del colegio de su comunidad. Además Amelia los días sábados prepara comida, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo.
Amelia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas y galletas.
Los sueños de Amelia son tener un negocio grande, surtido y ahorrar lo suficiente para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Amelia is a member of the "La Paz" community bank. Amelia lives in the community of Yanama which is 20 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Amelia is married; she is 30 years old and has three children. Amelia sells candies at the entryway of her local high school. In addition to this business, Amelia cooks food on Saturdays with her husband's help. Amelia needs a loan of 900 soles to buy soft drinks and cookies. Amelia dreams of having a large store, well-stocked and of saving enough money for her children..

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and cookies

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel O. is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She makes interlocking pavement stones that are used in the fittings of floors. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more materials like bags of cement and granite stones for making more interlocking pavement stones. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy materials to make pavement stones

loans.name: Nidia Luz

texts.es:
NIDIA LUZ Q. S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “DAMAS DEL ORIENTE” vive en la Jr Yarinacocha Nº 201.manantay. Tiene 47 años de edad, 5 hijos, de los cuales 3 de sus hijos están aun estudiando.  Ella y su pareja trabajan juntos.

Se inició en el negocio de venta de artículos de belleza y perfumes, y la venta por catálogos.  El primer préstamo  fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles,  donde compró una pequeña vitrina para poder mostrarlos, cuenta con clientes fijos y su negocio ha ido creciendo.

Hoy, ella ha progresado con su familia y el negocio ha mejorado.  Con este  préstamo de S/. 3.000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará perfumes, cosméticos y nuevos productos de belleza.

“Manuela Ramos es una ONG que apoya a una gran cantidad de familias, con pequeños préstamos que permite a las mujeres de esta zona a iniciar o a mejorar sus negocios y estoy contenta con esa ayuda” refirió.
texts.en:
NIDIA LUZ Q. S., a member of the Communal Bank “LADIES OF THE EAST," lives at Jr Yarinacocha Nº 201, Manantay. She is 47 years old, and has 5 children, 3 of whom are still in school. She and her partner work together.

She began her business selling beauty products and perfumes, as well as catalog sales. Her first loan was for S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, with which she purchased a small display case to display her products. She relies on regular customers, and her business has continued to grow.

Today, she has moved forward with her family and her business has improved. With this loan of S/. 3.000.00 Nuevos Soles, she will purchase perfumes, cosmetics and new beauty products.

“Manuela Ramos is an NGO that supports many families with small loans that allow the women of this area to start or expand their businesses, and I am happy with this assistance," she said.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perfumes, cosmetics and other beauty products.

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
El Sr. Anibal tiene 36 años y esta casado con la Sra. Rosana Paez.  Ellos tienen 4 hijos, todos en edad escolar.

El Sr. V. es contratista de obra de construccion y esto lo viene realizando desde el año 1996. Este oficio lo aprendio trabajando como jornalero de una empresa constructora.

Este credito lo solicita para comprar materiales para la contruccion de una casa cuyo presupuesto ya fue aceptada por el propietario.

Su objetivo es contar con una camioneta para poder transportar sus equipos y herramientas por que actualmente viene pagando por los servicios de fletes.
texts.en:
Señor Anibal is 36 years of age and married to Señora Rosana Paez. They have four school-age children. Señor V. is a building contractor and he's been doing this since 1996. He learned this trade while working as a day laborer for a construction company. The loan he requests is to buy materials to build a house, the budget for which has now been accepted by the owner. His goal is to obtain a pickup truck so he can transport his equipment and tools because he currently has to pay to hire that.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement, lime, bricks, tile, etc.

loans.name: Josefin Manafe

texts.en:
Josefin Manafe - (DNR.M-0692) is a 41 year-old female living in the town of Kaliakah. She is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Josefin Manafe raises pigs for sale. Josefin Manafe has been engaged in this business for over 9 years and earns approximately 450,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2008, Josefin Manafe joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities.  Josefin Manafe is requesting a loan from DINARI of 5,000,000 IDR to be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Josefin from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Josefin Manafe - (DNR.M-0692) merupakan 41 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Kaliakah.  Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 4 anak usia sekolah.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Josefin Manafe memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Josefin Manafe sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 9 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Josefin Manafe menghasilkan sekitar 450,000 IDR sebulan.


Dalam 2008, Josefin Manafe bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Josefin Manafe telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Josefin Manafe berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk meningkatkan/memperluas bisnis peminjam.


Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: La Solucion 3 Group

texts.en:
Evelyn R. approached Esperanza a couple of months ago inquiring about how to receive a loan for her business selling bedspreads, sheets, soap, and other household items. After several meetings explaining the loan terms and putting together a group of five women, she is ready to accept her loan in order to invest in and grow her small business. This is a rare opportunity for someone in her economic status, and she reinforced several times how grateful she was and how she couldn’t wait for her business to grow with this new investment.

Evelyn explained that, with new loan, she would be able to increase her merchandise and also be able to explore new markets for her products. She explained she wants to grow her business in order to hopefully proviD. a better life for her children. She has two boys aged 11 and 3, and she has one daughter aged 15. She speaks very highly of her daughter who is an excellent student who has dreams of attending college and becoming a professional. She explained her boys are typical boys who both love playing baseball.

In the future, Evelyn hopes to expand her business through new loans, and her long term dream is to own real estate that she could rent out. She has ambitious goals, but she knows she has to start small in order to fulfill her long term goals.

loans.use: To purchase bedspreads, sheets, soap, and other household items

loans.name: Rotchel

texts.en:
Rotchel R. is from the village of Barangay Poblacion, Iligan City. She is 32 years old. Rotchel is married to Jezer and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Rotchel owns & operates a food stall (school canteen). While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of food products in the school. Rotchel has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Rotchel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rotchel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rotchel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to the supplement income of her family and to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Laure

texts.fr: A. Laure est née le 23/02/1986 à Lokossa, chef lieu du Département du Mono d'où elle est originaire. Laure est célibataire sans enfant et vit auprès de sa mère à GBEDAGBA un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. Laure a démarré son petit commerce, il y a juste un an. Au départ, Laure s'est lancée dans la vente de téléphones mobiles à des employés d'une société de gardiennage : vente à crédit qu'elle récupère à petit coup à la fin de chaque mois.  Aujourd'hui, Laure a associé à la vente de téléphones portables, la vente de tissus. C'est pour renforcer cette dernière activité que Laure sollicite ce premier prêt d’ALIDé dans le but de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle qui ne cesse de s’accroître. Dans un avenir proche, Laure aimerait ouvrir une boutique pour y  exposer ses différents produits (téléphones portables et tissus).
texts.en:
