Laure A. was born February 23rd, 1986 in Lokossa, capital of the Mono region. Laure is single and has no children. She lives with her mother in Gbedagba a district of Cotonou, the economic capital of the Benin Republic. Laure only began her business a year ago. Initially, she sold mobile telephones on credit to a security guard company, and at the end of each month she would collect part of the telephone sale profits.Today, Laure has added the sale of fabrics to her business. She is seeking her first loan from ALIDe so that she might increase her business and meet the growing demand of her clients. In the near future, Laure would like to open a boutique to display her different mobile phones and fabrics.

Translated from French by Chloe Mark Translator, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of six pieces of twelve meter fabric from HITARGET and ten mobile phones.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah J. is from the village of Canubay. She is 27 years old. Leah is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Leah owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Leah has been in business for over nine years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2000, Leah joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leah has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Leah is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 16th loan taken out by Leah from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mile

texts.en: Mile S. is currently in the business of selling fruits like gavva, ovacado, oranges and many others and is requesting a loan to stock more fruits to sell.  Mile is 28 years old and is Married with a husband that is a soldier. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase fridges for keeping fruits longer BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more fruits to sell

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia D. is from the village of Balanlinao. She is 58 years old. Cresencia is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Cresencia owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Cresencia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Cresencia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cresencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Cresencia is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Cresencia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Otabek

texts.en:
Otabek is a responsible father and loving son. From the time he was a boy, he learned the honorable work of raising livestock, activities which were passed down from his parents and which today bring him satisfaction. Thanks to his valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, he has been able to obtain good results from his sales. This enterprising gentleman’s wish is to invest more capital in young animals. Otabek hopes to continue his dedication to his work, believing that by improving his stock and feed, his cattle will bring better prices. For this reason, he is turning to you for the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.  
 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Cathérine

texts.fr: F. Cathérine est née en 1971 à Adjohoun dans le Département de l'Ouémé. Cathérine est mariée à DADJA Félix. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés mais, ces enfants ne sont plus à sa charge. La famille vit depuis onze ans à Agbodjèdo à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Cathérine et son mari assurent ensemble les charges de la famille. C'est les produits vivriers(maïs, mil, sorgho, riz, etc.) que Cathérine vend. Cathérine achète ces produits à Kpodji et les vend à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Cathérine a déjà eu trois crédits de ALIDé qu'elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Toujours dans le souci de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle Cathérine sollicite ce quatrième crédit de ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Catherine F. was born in 1971 in Adjohoun of the Ouémé region. Catherine is married to Feliz Dadja. The couple have two children, both have been schooled, but they are no longer in their care. For the past eleven years, the family has lived in Agbodjedo, Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Catherine and her husband both contribute to the well-being of their family. Catherine sells food products such as corn, millet, sorghum, rice, etc. Catherine purchases her products in Kpodji and she resells in Dantokpa, the large international market of Benin. Catherine has had three previous loans with Alide (Kiva Field Partner) and she has repaid them all. With them she has been able to improve her business. Always with the goal of meeting client demands, Catherine is requesting a fourth loan from Alide, to supplement her working capital funds.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 100kg sacks of corn.

loans.name: Lovely Ann

texts.en:
Lovely Ann E. is from the village of Magcamiguing, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 21 years old. Lovely Ann is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Lovely Ann owns and operates a "tricycle" business in the local community. Lovely Ann is just starting this business.

Lovely Ann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lovely Ann is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lovely Ann from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income for their daily needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units, with offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for her tricycle

loans.name: Jenny Jovita

texts.es:
Jenny  M.  es socia del Banco Comunal Picoaza.  Este  banco está conformado por mujeres  de todas las  edades.  Picoaza es un pueblito ubicado a diez  minutos al norte de Portoviejo en la provincia de Manabí en la región costa de Ecuador, ésta  provincia es  muy  conocida por su gastronomía, las playas y los ceibos (árboles únicos de la región) y ésta localidad no podía ser la excepción pues es un lugar muy comercial, aquí  encontramos muchos  distribuidores de productos agrícolas,  consumo, ropa, etc.

Nuestra socia	es soltera y tiene un niño  de cinco años  de nombre  Steven, su casa es propia y en ella tiene una distribuidora de maquillajes,  perfumes y,  bisutería en general, cuenta  con un buen número de clientes fijos por los productos de buena calidad que distribuye.
 

Jenny  va a usar el credito obtenido para comprar  cremas, maquillajes, bisutería y todo en cosméticos para la época navideña para ofrecer más y mejores productos a sus clientes.  Su sueño es continuar con su negocio para mantener a su familia y para en el futuro mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Jenny M. is a member of the Picoaza communal bank. The bank is made up of women of all ages. Picoaza is a small town located ten minutes north of Portoviejo in the province of Manabí, in the coastal region of Ecuador. This province is well known for its cuisine, beaches and ceibo trees (unique to the region). It is also a commercial center, with many distributors of agricultural products, consumer goods, clothes, etc.

Jenny is single and has a 5-year-old son named Steven. She has her own house from which she operates her business selling makeup, perfumes, and costume jewelry. She has many regular customers because of the high quality of products she sells.

Jenny seeks a loan to purchase creams, makeup, costume jewelry and all types of cosmetics, to be able to offer her clients more and better products for the Christmas season. Her dream is to continue with her business to maintain her family and, in the future, improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase creams, makeup, and costume jewelry

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou N. est une femme de 52 ans qui habite a Yoff a la cite Apecsy  2.Elle est membre de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis janvier 2007 et a déjà bénéficié  d’un prêt antérieur Elle est mariée  et mère  de 7 enfants dont l’âgé  varie entre 13 et 35 ans C’est  par amour de l’activité  qu’elle s’est adonnée a la vente de petit déjeuner  dans une école  privée  qui se situe non loin de chez elle .Le développement de son activité depuis 2003 lui  permet de prendre  en charge la scolarité  de ses enfants en charge. Par conséquent  elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs dans le but de d’acheter a des prix plus compétitifs  les denrées  qui lui permettent de préparer  son petit déjeuner  et de les stocker.                                                                                                    
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les femmes  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou N. is a 52 year old woman who lives in Yoff in the Apecsy 2 city. She has been a member of the U-IMCEC bank since January 2007 and has already received a previous loan. She is married and the mother of seven children between the ages of 13 and 35. It was for the love of business that she took up selling breakfast in a private school located not far from her home. The development of her business since 2003 has allowed her to support the education of the children still under her care. She is therefore seeking a loan of 150,000 frs in order to purchase at more competitive prices the foods that enable her to prepare the breakfasts, as well as to stock the foods.

Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC - with the positive support of lenders - succeeds in supporting women in revenue-generating activities which promote valuable, socioeconomic development.


Translated from French by Jarred Taylor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase in working capital

loans.name: Liliana Teresa

texts.es: La Sra. Liliana, vive en casa propia, ella al igual de muchas clientes debe de levantarse temprano para llegar a las seis de la mañana al mercado ya que vive en una zona muy alejada de la ciudad de El Alto. es una de las pocas clientes que quedaron de las que se tenian en el Mercado Yungas durante todo el tiempo que ha trabajado con la agenia ha reflejado ser una persona dedicada y responsable no solo con su trabajo sino tambien con su familia, el empeño que le pone a su actividad se refleja en el crecimiento del mismo. La Sra. Liliana invertira el dinero del credito en la refaccion del puesto como ser el pintado de mesas y bancas y el cambio de tazas y jarros que se usan diariamente en el puesto.
texts.en:
Liliana lives in her own house. Like many other Emprender clients, she has to get up early to arrive at the market at 6AM, as she lives in a far neighborhood of El Alto. She is one of the Emprender’s few remaining long-term clients from the Yungas Market.

In all the time she has worked with the agency, she has proved herself to be dedicated and responsible, not only with her work, but also with her family. The determination that she puts into her work is reflected in the growth of her business.

Liliana will use this loan money to refurbish her food stall, including painting the tables and benches, and replacing the cups and jars that are used every day.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbish her food stall

loans.name: Yoconda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Fe.
Carmen es casada, tiene 32 años y 1 hijo, Carmen junto a su esposo tienen una imprenta llamada Multiservicios San José, en un local alquilado ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de recordatorios.
Los sueños de Carmen son terminar de construir su casa y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Communal Bank "Fe" ["Faith"]. Carmen is married, she is 32 years old and has one son. Carmen and her husband own a printing business called Multiservicios San José ["Multiservices Saint Joseph"], in rented premises located in Ayacucho's city downtown area. Carmen needs a 2,100.00 PEN loan to purchase printed cards given by people to friends and relatives as mementos after baptisms, first communions, weddings and funeral services. Carmen dreams of finishing building her home and increasing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of printed cards

loans.name: Pat

texts.en: Mrs. Pat M. and her husband are villagers in Trapeang Khlout village in Takeo province. She is 56 years old. She is a grocer in local village. Mr. Samet Toem, her husband, is a teacher in local school and a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to support his family living.  In order to improve condition this family living, Mrs. Pat M. decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries for re-selling which can gate some profit to support her family. This couple has two children, both of whom help their mother to sell groceries. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for re-selling

loans.name: Norita

texts.en:
Norita is 56 years old and married with three children: two daughters and one son.   She lives with her family in the province of Rizal in the Philippines.  Her husband Dante works in the construction business.  To supply additional income for her family, Norita is starting a business selling fried fish.

Norita would like to receive a loan to purchase inventory to launch her business including cardboard boxes as well as fish.  As a new member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Norita is thankful for access to capital and loans to support her entrepreneurial dreams. 
  
With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that her new business will generate steady income to improve her financial stability and her family’s quality of life.  Her long-term dreams are to continue supporting her children and grandchildren as well as building a stronger home that can withstand flooding common in her province.

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase inventory to launch her business

loans.name: Izay

texts.en: Izay I. is a successful father and dedicated husband. Together with his wife he has two kids. Izay began a small grocery store three years ago with a small amount of savings. He is assisted by his wife who helps him serve his clients. Today, his clientele has grown greater and his grocery becomes more popular. He is asking for a loan so that he may expand the variety of goods sold in his store. Izay is very grateful to everyone who is helping him achieve success in his business through this loan.

loans.use: To expand the variety of good sold in his store.

loans.name: Dulce Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Dulce María Hernández Álvarez tiene una pequeña ventecita en su casa de habitación que esta ubicada en el municipio de El viejo. 

Ella va a utilizar el crédito para surtir su  negocio  en la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, etc.
Ella es madre de 3 hijos y vive con ellos y su esposo.
Y hoy en día dice estar agradecida con CEPRODEL, por darle la oportunidad de poder crecer en su negocio así como en su vida personal.
texts.en:
Dulce María Hernández Álvarez has a small store in her home, which is located in the municipality of El Viejo. She will use this loan to restock her business by purchasing rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, etc. She is the mother of 3 children and she lives with them and with her husband. Today she says that she is grateful to CEPRODEL for giving her this opportunity to grow her business as well as her personal life.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy products to sell such as rice, beans, bread, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Fasilat

texts.en:
Fasilat is 35 years old, married, and has two children who are both doing fine. Her husband is an electrician and they live together in Lagos, Nigeria.
Fasilat owns a shop where she sells groceries and foodstuffs. The shop is at the front of her house and this enables her to open the shop from very early in the morning to late in the evening, every day of the week. The shop serves as her means of livelihood, and she has been in this business for the past four years.
Fasilat is determined and optimistic about the growth of her business and the prosperity of her family. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for this wonderful initiative.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina T. owns and operates a dressmaking business in her community. She has been in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a week. With additional working capital, Josefina’s business will continue to expand and she will be capable of offering satisfactory service to her customers.

In 2006, Josefina joined ASHI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in entrepreneurial business activities. She and her husband, Armando, have successfully repaid a previous loan from ASHI. Josefina requests a loan of 25,000 PHP so that she can support the expansion of her dressmaking business and be able to meet the growing demands of her customers. The loan fund will be used to pay for an additional aging overlock sewing machine. The additional equipment for her business will provide more efficient and better service to her regular and extended customers. 

Having the opportunity of a loan from Kiva through ASHI will provide Josefina a chance to accomplish her goals in life: to build a profitable dressmaking business, send all of her children to college, and invest in her home. She also hopes to see her family soon change their standard of living and get out from beneath the umbrella of poverty.

loans.use: To pay for an additional aging overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Dirisa

texts.en:
M. Dirisa is a hard-working business man of thirty, married with five children. He owns a retail shop located in Bulakati main market, Juma cell, Lukaya town council. His shop mainly deals with essential things like sugar, rice, maize flour, passion fruit and various others. He is using the loan to purchase retail items such as sugar, rice, millet flour, maize flour, passion fruit, etc. for resale so as to expand his business. 

His future hope is to expand his business, accumulate more profits, and use the accumulated profits to further improve his farming and give his children a better education and a better life.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as sugar, rice, millet flour, maize flour, etc. for resale

loans.name: Marcelle

texts.fr: Née en 1971 à Calavi, K. Marcelle est mariée à LANKPOKINTO Oumbabè, et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Marcelle s'est installée avec son mari et ses enfants au quartier Agongbomey à Cotonou (capitale économique du Bénin), depuis près de quinze ans. Marcelle vient en aide à son mari et supporte avec lui les différentes charges de la famille. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Marcelle vend depuis environs vingt ans, des détergeants (savons, dentifrices, etc.) à la devanture de sa maison. Marcelle s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Marcelle a déjà obtenu trois crédits de ALIDé, qu'elle a bien remboursés. Dans le but d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et d'accroître sa clientèle et par ricochet son revenu, Marcelle sollicite un autre prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1971 in Calavi, Marcelle K. is married to Oumbabè LANKPOKINTO and is the mother of three school-attending children. For 15 years, she's been living with her husband and children in the Agongbomey neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Marcelle helps her husband with the various expenses of the family. To provide for herself, Marcelle has been selling detergents, soaps, toothpaste, etc in front of her house for approximately 20 years. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international marketplace in Benin. She already benefited from three loans from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, that were all repaid without problems. With the goal of bolstering her working capital and increasing her clientele and, as a result, her income, Marcelle is seeking another loan.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of soaps and toothpaste

loans.name: Mien

texts.en:
Mien H., 26, is a low-income person currently living in Siem Reap Province. To earn a living, she sells vegetables that she grows herself on her own farmland; additionally, she buys fresh fish in bulk to sell retail. Typically, she earns an average of $2 a day as support for her family.

Mien H.’s husband is currently selling firewood that he obtains from the forest. However, he faces the fact that he doesn’t have a cart to transport his firewood from the forest. In order to solve this problem, Mien H. requests a loan to purchase a cart her husband can attach to a horse to use to pick up the wood.

This young couple has been married for years, but they do not have any children.

loans.use: To purchase a cart for her husband's business

loans.name: Rudelina

texts.en:
Rudelina P. is from the village of  Villa Verde, Iligan City. She is 38 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rudelina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Rudelina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rudelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rudelina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rudelina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Victor Bacilio

texts.es: Víctor Bacilio es un hombre trabajador, el señor tiene dos trabajos, en la noche trabaja en una maquiladora como  operador y en el día atiende su negocio de venta de abarrotes, el señor requiere de este prestamos para invertir en la compra de mas cosas para la tienda. Y así incrementar sus ventas y ganancias. El señor víctor siempre se ah preocupado por la educación de sus hijos es por eso que el necesita de su apoyo para poder darles a sus hijos una mejor educación y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Víctor Bacilio is a hard-working man. He has two jobs: at night, he works in a factory as a machine operator, and during the day, he runs his own business selling groceries. He needs this loan in order to invest in buying more goods for his store, in order to increase his sales and his earnings. Victor has always been concerned about his children's education, and for this reason he needs your support, so that he can give his children a better education and an improved quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in his business

loans.name: Chimgee

texts.en:
Chimgee T. is 32 years old and lives with her husband and son in Hovd province, western Mongolia. She and her family have been living in their own house for three years. Her son goes to a local kindergarten, while her husband Ganchudur helps with her business.

Chimgee and her husband began their business in 2005 and now they are planning on expanding their business by adding more computers so that they can accommodate more customers. Chimgee is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more computers for the PC game center.

loans.use: To purchase computers for her business.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 (Entente) Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI 2  est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de WARASSO dans l’ex l’arrondissement de Kimparana, du cercle de SAN, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali) qui vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, avec en moyenne 35 ans et au moins 7 enfants.
Elles cultivent  de l’arachide et du maïs. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année. 
KADIA S. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels agricoles et des intrants,  au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 25 000 à 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi 2 (entente, or "unity") group consists of married women from the village of Warasso in the in the ex neighborhood of Kimparana in the district of San in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of Mali) They live in traditional families, are on the average 35 years of age and have seven children. They grow peanuts and corn. In order to ensure that their agricultural activities are profitable, earlier this year they have decided to take advantage of the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. Kadia S. plans to use her part of the loan to purchase ample supply of peanut seeds, small tools and agricultural inputs at the big market of Kimparana. After the winter season, the harvest is stocked for a while until it goes up in price before being resold at the big market of Kimparana and at the nearby market, retail (often wholesale too), for cash to a customer base mainly coming from large towns. After this agricultural season, the group members plan to obtain a revenue ranging from 25,000 to 35,000 West African francs each, to be used for repaying the loan interests as well as for the everyday family expenses.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing agricultural inputs, seeds and small tools

loans.name: Efigenia

texts.es:
Este cliente es originario del poblado de telica , actualmente se dedica a la actividad comercial ,  la que ha ejercido por espacio de 10 años, donde ha tenido 9 créditos, con   nuestra empresa para diferentes rubros, prevaleciendo las del rubro vivienda, que  donde están mejorando por lo que se dedican a otra actividad 
El núcleo familiar está compuesta por  3 hijos los que están adultos y son profesionales solo uno está casado, que es varón y están solteros siendo 1 varón y 1 mujer, son una familia bien unida, y se dedican a hacer las actividades en conjuntos incluyendo a su marido quien tiene un taller de  vulcanización en el empalme de ansca.
texts.en:
This individual is originally from the village of Telica and she has been a small business owner for the past 10 years. She has had 9 past loans for varying purposes. She has invested in the improvement of their home, and she would like to invest again in that initiative. Her immediate family is made up of 3 grown children. They all have careers and only one is married. Her other son and her daughter are still single. They are a very close family unit and they participate in everything together. Her husband has a vulcanization shop in the village of Ansca.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to remodel her home.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites T. is from the village of Macanhan, Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 30 years old, married, and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $200 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marites joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Macanhan, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental
